On July 9th, Chicago Innovation took its 2023 Chicago Innovation Award winners, along with several sponsors and board members to ring the Opening Nasdaq Bell in Chicago. Widely covered in 
local and national news media
, the event recognized 
Chicago as the only city in the country to annually ring the Nasdaq Bell.
 
 
 
 
Local News Coverage 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
National News Coverage 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Photos from Nasdaq Studio and Times Square
 
View all photos from the day
 
 
 
 
 
 
Mayor Brandon Johnson proclaims July 9, 2024 as "Chicago Innovation Day,"
 
encouraging all residents, organizations and institutions to join in recognizing the innovative spirit that defines our great city. Read proclamation here: 
 
 
 
Welcome to our 
NEW
 Chicago Innovation Sponsor!
 
 
 
We're proud to spotlight Chicago Innovation Diamond Sponsor Lessen for its continued commitment to Chicago after acquiring SMS Assist last year. Lessen just signed a new long-term office lease to support the reinvigoration of the LaSalle Street corridor. As Lessen's President of the Commercial Division Maureen Ehrenberg said, "this area is poised to continue its economic ascendance — which will have a positive impact on the city’s tech sector — and it is an ideal location for our long-term future in the city.”  
Read the full press release here.

subject: Meet the 2024 CLO Symposium Day 3 Keynote Speaker
body:
We are thrilled to announce our Day 3 keynote speaker for the upcoming 2024 Chief Learning Officer Symposium 20th Anniversary: Ryan Millar, owner of Gold Medal Mindset. 
 
Day 3 Keynote Announced!
We are thrilled to announce our Day 3 keynote speaker for the upcoming 
2024 Chief Learning Officer Symposium, 20th Anniversary
: Ryan Millar, owner of Gold Medal Mindset. 
 
In his keynote address, “Gold Medal Mindset: The Blueprint for Peak Performance,” Ryan Millar, an Olympic gold medalist, acclaimed leadership coach and culture management expert, will share the foundational strategies that drive the world’s top athletes to victory. These same principles can be applied to propel leadership and organizational success. Drawing on his illustrious career in competitive sports and extensive experience in cultivating high-performing teams across Fortune 1000 companies, Ryan will outline the simple yet critical elements of a winner’s mentality that lead to exceptional performance in any individual, team, or organization.
 
Attendees will gain invaluable insights into building an environment of progress, the power of cultural data points, and embracing ownership to reach new heights of achievement.
 
Don't miss this opportunity to learn from a true champion and gain the tools to drive peak performance within your organization.
 
Register now and save $800 with our early bird pricing!
REGISTER NOW

Gold Medal Mindset

subject: Boost Your Career as Chief Learning Officer!
body:
The Chief Learning Officer Accelerator is a virtual seven-week, comprehensive and experiential development program focused on the most important topics and the latest CLO research and best-practice findings for high-level learning executives.
 
Fast-tracking New and Aspiring CLOs
Launching Oct. 28, 2024
 
Join us for the 
2024 Chief Learning Officer Accelerator program
, designed specifically for new and aspiring CLOs like you. Starting on October 28, this virtual seven-week program will release a new module each week, delivering cutting-edge research, best practices and actionable insights.
 
Here’s what past participants have to say about their transformative experiences:
 
“
I was blown away by the experience. The faculty was so knowledgeable and open to sharing advice and recommendations. They were so authentic and easy to be around.”
 
“This course is like an MBA for L&D.”
 
“I was able to expand my network with some of the most talented up-and-coming leaders in our industry and learn from a faculty of executives from some of the most prestigious corporate universities in the world. Just an amazing experience.”
 
“This course is worthwhile for anyone looking to become a CLO or gain a better understanding of what should be expected of a CLO.”
 
The CLO Accelerator is meticulously aligned with CLO LearningElite organizational criteria, ensuring you receive top-tier education and experience. You’ll gain:
Exclusive access to esteemed faculty and industry leaders
Interactive discussion groups and missions to share and learn from real-world experiences
A robust network of fellow learning professionals
Personal action plan development and case study application presentations with feedback
Don’t miss this chance to build a contemporary career and thrive in your role as a CLO. Secure your spot today and join a community dedicated to advancing learning leadership.
 
For more information and to register, visit our 
website.

subject: Doubling Down on Pride
body:
Out & Equal’s July 2024 Newsletter
 
 
 
Doubling Down on Pride
Coming out of Pride Month, July can feel a bit anticlimactic. The parades are over, and the celebrations have come to a close.
 
But that doesn’t mean we’re packing up and going home. 
If anything, now is the moment to double down on Pride.
 
This energy and momentum is powerful, and we cannot let it dissipate. Just because we’ve flipped the calendar from June to July doesn’t mean Pride and the principles behind it fade away.
 
As our community continues to face anti-LGBTQ+ legislation, rhetoric that seeks to demean, and actions that aim to erase, we must use our voice. We must remind the world that we are here. And as we have done so many times before, we must
 stand strong, persevere, and push forward. 
The moment demands it.
 
Right now, I’m feeling energized, inspired, and ready to take on the world. For me, that comes from the celebrations of Queer joy, the moments centered in community, and the reminder that we are a radiant, unstoppable force.
 
With our allies and entire community, we must and we will continue the fight for LGBTQ+ equity, inclusion, and belonging, in the workplace and beyond.
 
 
 
 
A Message to CEOs
During Pride Month, our CEO, Erin Uritus, penned a powerful piece in Fast Company. It contains a simple but important message to CEOs, applicable in Pride and beyond, "do something you can really, truly be proud of."
Valuing difference and leading with inclusion and belonging are the right things to do. They are smart business practice. They represent the future, and the future is here and now.
 
Read More
 
 
 
Radiating Pride with the Out & Equal Team
 
﻿
To celebrate the meaning, power, and impact of Pride, Out & Equal hosted a series of 
Radiate Pride Receptions.
 
Across the United States—Atlanta, San Francisco, Seattle, Los Angeles, and New York—hundreds joined the Out & Equal leadership team for celebrations that served as a:
Reminder that our community is an unstoppable, radiant force.
Space to build community and connections with other organizations working to advance LGBTQ+ equity, inclusion, and belonging in the workplace, and beyond.
Moment to spotlight and highlight Queer joy.
 
 
Check Out Our Recap Reel
 
﻿
In addition to these powerful convenings centered on community, Erin Uritus, our CEO, participated in impactful discussions on the value of “The Business of Belonging,” why authentic allyship matters, and how, as a collective community, we approach the future.
As we focus on Radiating Pride beyond June, be sure to 
revisit her LinkedIn Live conversation
 with Sander van 't Noordende (he/him), CEO of Randstad, and Allyn Shaw (he/him), Out & Equal Board Chair and EVP, COO, Consumer Technology, Wells Fargo on:
 
creating equitable workplaces where LGBTQ+ talent can belong and thrive,
the business case for inclusion and belonging, and
how organizations can drive positive change and show allyship year-round.
We are also grateful to the generosity of organizations like T-Mobile, which donated $200,000 to Out & Equal and Rise Brands, which raised more than $15,000 on our behalf. Through their support, we will continue to make meaningful impact and advance our mission of advancing LGBTQ+ workplace equity, inclusion, and belonging. 
 
 
Celebrating the Dynamism of the LGBTQ+ Community
As we recognize and celebrate Pride all year, we must highlight the diversity and intersectionality of the community, and the strength it brings to it.
Throughout the month of July, Out & Equal is proud to recognize and celebrate:
ALL MONTH: Disability Pride Month
JULY 6: Omnisexual & Omniromantic Pride & Visibility Day
JULY 14: International Nonbinary People’s Day
JULY 16: International Drag Day
 
Our movement can only succeed when everyone is brought along. It’s why at Out & Equal, we’re committed to advancing the community and achieving our mission by understanding the experiences of all of the communities that make up our movement.
 
For a deeper examination of intersectionality and inclusion, please view the resources featured within our 
February newsletter
.
 
 
Last month, to further highlight the value of LGBTQ+ inclusion and belonging in the workplace, 
Out & Equal announced a partnership with Windō
, the innovative platform for accessing, reviewing and comparing organizations’ sustainability data (environmental impact, DEI and employee well-being).
 
In our “In Conversation With” series we speak to Ken Janssens (he/him), Windō’s Co-founder and Head of Social Impact. In this discussion, Ken highlights his career journey, the value of DEIB, and how companies with a clear purpose that go beyond profit margins are more attractive to talent, especially Gen Z.
 
Read More
 
 
 
Driving Impact Across the Globe: 
Reflections from Out & Equal’s 
﻿
Southern States Forum
Did you know that the American South is more racially diverse, more religious, and makes up more LGBTQ+-headed households than any other part of the country?
 
It's why convenings like our Southern States Forum, which we hosted in Atlanta last month, are incredibly important.
 
Through a powerful program centered on intersectionality, inclusion-building strategies, and action-oriented solutions to drive meaningful change, we brought together leaders, practitioners, and changemakers for inspiring keynotes, dynamic discussions, and insightful learning sessions —all aimed at exploring the unique challenges and opportunities businesses face in creating truly inclusive workplaces for LGBTQ+ employees and allies.
 
Attendees from across the region and various industries had the opportunity to build long-lasting connections and gained the tools needed to become changemakers in their organizations and communities.
 
Read the Retrospective
 
 
 
Presented by Bank of America and Supported by Dell
Convening Next Week!
 
 
 
SAVE THE DATE!
This year’s Out & Equal 
Workplace Summit
 is back in Orlando from October 8-10 with our pre-Summit Leadership Lab Day on October 7!
The largest LGBTQ+ workplace inclusion event in the world,
 Summit promises to amplify much-needed inspirational stories, meaningful discussions, and thought-provoking sessions that will equip attendees with the tools and connections to make a difference in their organizations.
Workplace Summit Registration, which is Exclusive to Out & Equal Partners, is 
Now Open
!
 
Outie Awards Deadline Extended to Sunday, July 14!
We're extending the deadline to submit a nomination for the Outie Awards to 
Sunday, July 14 at 11:59 p.m. EST.
 
Don't miss your opportunity to elevate an LGBTQ+ inclusion champion and/or position your organization as an employer of choice that leads with inclusion and belonging. You can submit nominations across five categories:
 
Workplace & Belonging Excellence
Employee Resource Group of the Year
New Chapter Employee Resource Group of the Year
LGBTQ+ Corporate Advocate
Ally Changemaker
 
Submit a Nomination Now!
 
 
 
Welcome to Our New Partners! 
At Out & Equal, we work with the world's leading and most influential companies—and the inclusive leaders in these organizations—to advance LGBTQ+ representation, equity, inclusion, and belonging in the workplace. 
We’re proud to welcome
 Golden Goose, GRANITE, Huntington National Bank, Sedgwick, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs, and Yum! Brands 
as our newest members of the Out & Equal Partner Community.
 
 
 
Join the Out & Equal Community
 
Through thought leadership and partnership (advisory services, knowledge, resources, and tools) and global programs and transformative events, becoming an Out & Equal Partner will supercharge your LGBTQ+ workplace inclusion progress. 
We look forward to having you join us in the movement! 
Partner in the Business of Belonging™
Learn More
 
 
FOLLOW US
  
  
  
  
 
 
outandequal.org
Out & Equal | 
1111 Broadway
 3rd Floor | 
Oakland, CA 94607 US

Fast-tracking New and Aspiring CLOs
Launching Oct. 28, 2024
 
Are you ready to fast-track your career as a Chief Learning Officer? The 
2024 Chief Learning Officer Accelerator program
 launches on October 28, and it's your chance to gain invaluable insights, build a robust network, and enhance your leadership capabilities.
 
What You Can Expect:
 
Week 1:
 Demonstrating CLO Leadership
Deepen your understanding of CLO leadership, align business priorities, gain executive support, and develop strategic thinking.
 
Week 2:
 Becoming More Strategic: Mindset & Map
Establish a strategic mindset, align actions with corporate objectives, and enhance your leadership communication and accountability.
 
Week 3:
 Infrastructure & Measurement
Build a strong learning infrastructure, understand metrics, executive communication, and technology support to align with business strategy.
 
Week 4:
 Building a Learning Culture
Foster a high-impact learning culture to attract, retain, and engage talent while accelerating performance and navigating change.
 
Week 5:
 Technology & the Future of Learning
Explore the evolving tech landscape, impacts of AI, and emerging technologies to enhance learning experiences and decision-making.
 
Week 6:
 Creating Action Plans
Develop actionable plans for personal and organizational growth, setting short- and long-term goals to reach your aspirations.
 
Week 7:
 Application & Simulation
Apply your learning through practical simulations to solidify your skills and prepare for real-world challenges.
 
Our program is designed to equip you with the tools and knowledge needed to drive meaningful change within your organization.

subject: Join Us for a Courageous Conversation on DEIB at the 2024 Chief Talent Officer Summit
body:
One of the many impactful sessions we’re excited for at the upcoming 2024 Chief Talent Officer Summit: Beyond Talent Trends: Pioneering Progress Through Emerging Tech & Innovation is the "The Courageous Conversation - Diversity, Equity & Inclusion in Flux: A Conversation on Priorities and Leadership," taking place on Day 2 of the event.
 
Dear Ashton,
 
One of the many impactful sessions we’re excited for at the upcoming 2024 Chief Talent Officer Summit: Beyond Talent Trends: Pioneering Progress Through Emerging Tech & Innovation is the "The Courageous Conversation - Diversity, Equity & Inclusion in Flux: A Conversation on Priorities and Leadership," taking place on Day 2 of the event.
 
Our experts will explore how leaders’ priorities have shifted since the heightened focus during 2020-21 and the implications for talent management. This session will provide an in-depth look at how leaders are addressing the evolving questions and implications surrounding DEIB, how efforts and communications should be incorporated into organizational culture and where companies may be missing the mark.
 
Join us as we examine the challenges, opportunities and complexities of DEIB in today’s workplace — and so much more. Register today to save $500 with our introductory rate and join us Tues, Sept. 10 - Weds, Sept. 11, 2024, from the comfort of your own space. Members can register at no cost.
 
Best Regards,
Chief Talent Officer
P.S. Members Save! Not a member yet? Bundle pricing on an annual membership and registration for this event are available. 
Learn more here.

FAQs
Time is Running Out | Submit Your Nomination for the
2024 Women Leaders in Consulting 
Nomination deadline: July 25, 2024 
The impact of women's leadership on our profession cannot be overstated. It is one of the reasons Consulting magazine has endeavored to identify and recognize those individuals through the Women Leaders in Consulting awards.
As a voice for our industry, we believe it is important to point out the success and leadership of these outstanding consultants as they make an increasingly profound difference for their firms, clients, future women leaders and entrants to the profession.
In an industry overwhelmingly dominated by men, the women leaders of our industry play an immense role in growing our profession, keeping it nimble and moving it forward. 
Women Leaders in Consulting epitomize the character and leadership that make a measurable difference, not only for our industry as a whole, but for the up-and-coming women leaders we have yet had the honor of meeting.

subject: 💥 Insider Highlights: Wellness Events, Global Survey & Price Increase Reminder
body:
Unmissable Updates: Join our Women’s Wellness Network and secure a lower ticket price for Transform 2025 before July 19th.
 
Hi Hannah, 
 
Welcome to the first edition of your July Insider newsletters, filled with exciting updates. We're thrilled to launch our Women's Wellness Network event, invite you to share your valuable perspectives in the Global Insights Survey, and remind you to 
grab your 
Transform 2025
 ticket before the price goes up on July 19th. (
Psst: 
your Insider discount
 
saves you an additional $200 on your ticket!
) Don't miss out on these opportunities—get all the details inside!
 
 
We are excited to invite you to take part in our Inaugural 
Transform Global Insights 2025: The Now and Next of Work Survey
 and join us on this groundbreaking journey! Shape the present and future of work with global thought leaders by sharing your unique perspectives on DEI, Global Talent, AI, Well-being, and more. 
Take the survey
 and get full access to our upcoming report! 
 
Be sure to share the report in your People team newsletter, Slack, Teams, and other relevant channels. A diverse range of perspectives will enrich the data and enhance the quality of the report for everyone!
 
 
Join us on Thursday, July 18th at 9 am PDT for the kickoff of the 
Women's Wellness Network, 
"Exploring Hormones, Health and Happiness". 
 
This special one-hour inaugural event, brought to you by the Women's Wellness Network, is a community-focused gathering designed to foster connection and mutual support among women as we delve into important wellness topics.
RSVP Now
 
 
 
Save on Your Transform Ticket
Join us for Transform 2025, held March 17th-19th at Wynn Las Vegas! Your Insider discount saves you $200 off the current ticket price. Hurry, prices increase on Friday, July 19th!
 
Register now.
 
Speaking at Transform
Transform thrives on the communal exchange of ideas and insights, igniting inspiration for our global audience. We're looking for visionaries, innovators, and pioneers in the realm of work eager to share their expertise and push the boundaries of current thinking. 
Apply Now.
 
For those celebrating, we wish you a joyful and safe July 4th holiday!
 
Warm regards,
 
Samara Jaffe
Co-Founder and General Manager
Transform
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Transform Media LLC, 1850 Gateway Drive, Suite 700, San Mateo, CA 94404

subject: 2024 CLO Symposium Registration Open: Save $800 with Early Bird Rate!
body:
We are thrilled to announce the theme for this year’s 2024 Chief Learning Officer Symposium: Learning Leads the Way: A People + Business Strategy for Now & the Future.
 
Dear Ashton,
 
We are thrilled to announce the theme for this year’s 
2024 Chief Learning Officer Symposium
: 
Learning Leads the Way: A People + Business Strategy for Now & the Future
.
 
As people and skills become increasingly fundamental to organizational success, chief learning officers and learning leaders are navigating the complex interplay between L&D initiatives and broader business goals. Their voices and influence are growing in volume and strength.
 
This distinguished three-day gathering will explore the convergence of L&D strategy with overarching business strategy. Designed for forward-thinking CLOs and learning executives, the Symposium provides an exclusive platform to delve into the transformative power of aligning learning, development and talent initiatives with the strategic heartbeat of the organization.
 
What to Expect:
Insightful keynotes: Hear from industry leaders on the latest trends and strategies.
Peer-driven discussions: Engage with fellow CLOs and learning executives.
Interactive workshops: Focus on emerging technologies, skills agility, talent mobility and more.
Holistic approach: Equip yourself with tools to spearhead employee growth while driving tangible business outcomes.
 
Don’t miss the chance to be part of our 20th-anniversary celebration! Register now and 
save $800 with our early bird rate
! This offer won’t last long, so secure your spot today.
 
Register Now
 
We look forward to seeing you there and exploring the future of learning and development together.
 
Best regards,
Chief Learning Officer
 
P.S. Early bird registration ends soon! Don’t miss out on the opportunity to save $800 and be part of this transformative event. Secure your spot now!

body:

The Great Skills Journey: Upskilling & Reskilling at Scale
Weds, Jul. 24, 2024
VIRTUAL • INTERACTIVE • NO-COST 
Dear Ashton,
 
In today's fast-paced world, skills have become the focal point of how work is accomplished. Deloitte research indicates that organizations are shifting their focus from traditional job roles to skills-based approaches, creating a more scalable, manageable and equitable way of operating.
 
Join us for our upcoming Breakfast Club event, “
The Great Skills Journey: Upskilling & Reskilling at Scale
,” on Wednesday, July 24. This event will delve into how learning leaders are accelerating their upskilling and reskilling efforts and overcoming the significant challenges that come with large-scale initiatives.

subject: Transforming SAP: Upskilling Thousands with Pluralsight's Expertise
body:
SAP began engaging with Pluralsight in 2015 to upskill employees ahead of its transition to cloud-native architecture. But the partnership didn’t stop there.
 
SAP Employees Grow, Upskill with Pluralsight's Learning Platform
SAP began engaging with Pluralsight in 2015 to upskill employees ahead of its transition to cloud-native architecture. But the partnership didn’t stop there. SAP leaders knew they would also need to train their global workforce on technical topics related to the product change. In 2018, SAP’s workforce completed fewer than 3,000 courses. 
 
Just four years later, in 2022, they saw almost 28,000 course completions, and collectively, SAP employees learned for more than 75,000 hours on Pluralsight in 2023. The continued enthusiasm for Pluralsight’s content subsequently led SAP to open access to its entire development department, with plans to further expand this year.
DOWNLOAD NOW

subject: Building Global Community: Share Your Insights on the Evolving Workplace
body:
This survey is designed to gather worldwide insights into how organizations are addressing key workforce challenges. Your input matters.
 
Hi Hannah,
 
We’re excited to invite you to participate in the inaugural 
Transform Global Insights 2025: The Now and Next of Work
 survey. 
 
Your participation will help the community gain insights into today’s workplace dynamics and future trends by collecting authentic feedback from industry leaders like you. 
 
Why participate?
Shape Global Decisions:
 Your input will help drive innovation and progress in your global community.
Influence the Future of Work:
 Join thought leaders in discussing key topics like DEI, global talent, AI, workforce well-being, and share the tools you are using to support your organization in each of these areas.
Receive Exclusive Insights:
 Enjoy access to the full report once it’s published this Fall, and explore trends that will help you make strategic decisions and navigate the evolving work landscape.
Membership Benefits:
 If you haven't yet, join the online home for the Transform community, Transform Plus, and gain access to exclusive content, community resources, special member-only events and discounts.
The survey will take no more than 20 minutes to complete, and your input will support community learning, and impact the now and next of work. To receive your exclusive report, please 
complete the survey by July 19th. 
Take the Survey 
Thank you for your participation and for being a part of this groundbreaking journey! 
 
If you have questions, please feel free to contact us at 
insights@transform.us

subject: 20 Years of CLO Symposium: Learning Leads the Way at Our 2024 Event!
body:
This year, we’re thrilled to celebrate the 20th anniversary of this monumental event in beautiful Tucson, Arizona, on Oct. 21-23, 2024, with our focus of "Learning Leads the Way: A People + Business Strategy for Now & the Future."
Dear Ashton,
 
Since 2004, we at Chief Learning Officer have hosted our flagship event, the 
Chief Learning Officer Symposium
, bringing together 250+ learning and development professionals to learn from each other. 
 
This year, we’re thrilled to celebrate the 20th anniversary of this monumental event in beautiful Tucson, Arizona, on Oct. 21-23, 2024, with our focus of "Learning Leads the Way: A People + Business Strategy for Now & the Future."
 
We’re tapping into impactful stories, trustworthy resources and real-world examples to shape an agenda that is made up of true, applicable solutions, guaranteeing a one-of-a-kind event. Expect inspiring keynote addresses from Deborah Heiser, Ph.D., founder and CEO at The Mentor Project™, Ryan Millar, owner of Gold Medal Mindset, and Kason Morris, founder/principal for Kason Morris & Co., as well as a powerful panel discussion, energetic FASTtalks, educational workshops and more.
 
This prestigious three-day event is crafted for visionary CLOs and learning executives, offering a unique platform to explore the transformative power of integrating learning, development and talent initiatives with the core strategy of the organization. The focus will be on emerging technologies, skills agility, talent mobility and more, all designed to provide you with the tools to drive holistic employee growth and achieve measurable business outcomes.
 
Register now
 at our early bird rate and join us this fall as we explore how L&D leaders are aligning L&D strategy with overarching business goals.
 
We look forward to celebrating 20 years of shared learning and growth with you in Tucson this fall. See you there!
 
Sincerely,
 
Ashley St. John  
Editor-in-Chief and Chief Content Officer  
Chief Learning Officer

 to save $1,300 on your CLO Symposium registration – and gain access to many other great benefits!

subject: Chicago Innovation Monthly – June Edition
body:
Videos from Chicago ON Innovation
 
Large Corporations Connecting With Startups
 
How Intel Evaluates an idea
 
 
Embracing Risk for Innovation at Your Company
 
Acquiring Companies 
﻿
for Growth
 
 
 
 
 
Nominate for this year's Chicago Innovation Awards
 
The Chicago Innovation Awards is 
the longest-running and largest annual celebration of innovation in the Chicago region across all industries and sectors.
 
If you've launched a new product, service or organization across any industry in the past 4 years, you can nominate through July 31st. There is no fee to submit a nomination, and 
we encourage organizations to self-nominate
!
Read more on our website
 
 
 
 
Chicago Innovation Poll
Recap from May:
 
June Poll:
What do you think is the top reason why large corporations can 
﻿
excel at innovation?
.
Large R&D budgets
 
Deep pools of talent
 
Global market intelligence
 
Economies of scale
 
Access to capital markets
 
 
Upcoming Chicago Innovation Events!
 
Join us as we spotlight innovation in the ever-changing world of food. This year’s event features:
– Food industry innovators discussing 2024 trends that excite them
– Creative dishes that reflect Chicago's ethnic cuisines and neighborhoods
RSVP
 
 
Registration is now open for our annual 
In-Gala on August 7th. We're excited to see you and further our mission to bring innovation to everyone at this special fundraiser. 
﻿We hope you can join us at Morgan MFG, 401 N Morgan St.
Reserve your ticket now
 
 
 
 
Spotlighting the Accenture Corporate Innovator Award winners throughout the years:
 
 
 
 
 
Click Here to View all Chicago Innovation Award Winners
 
 
 
 
 
 
Noon Business Hour previews Climate Innovation Summit
Luke Tanen, president and CEO of Chicago Innovation joined Rob Hart on the WBBM Noon Business Hour with the details on the Climate Innovation Summit 
Listen here
 
 
 
Women in Cybersecurity
Connect with your local cybersecurity community at WiCyS’s June meet-up, taking place in Google's iconic Chicago office. This is a must-attend event to gain insights on Incident Response, as well as to mingle with your peers.
 
 
Angel Curious? Lofty Angels is a free community of people that ranges from those that are interested in learning about early-stage startup investing, to those that have been making investments for decades, and everyone in between. We provide access to live and recorded content, educational resources, in-person events, and opportunities to invest for those that are ready and interested. Our mission is to grow entrepreneurship, with a focus locally here in Chicago, and one of the biggest factors in enabling that growth is access to early capital, which begins with awareness, education and community.
Sign up here
 
 
 
NextGroup is celebrating FIVE years today!
 
A company founded in 2019 to support women who are re-engaging or making a shift in their careers. NextGroup was born as a community of support and programs to help women get to what’s next for their career and to enable businesses and nonprofits to access this valuable talent. In five short years, they have grown their community to over 6,500 women, placed 150 jobs, and hosted hundreds of virtual and in-person career-related events.
 
Become a Mentor to support IIT students in Chicago
One of our longtime partners, IIT, runs a terrific mentorship program out of the Stuart School of Business. This is a unique opportunity for people in the Chicago Innovation community to become mentors to support current students’ professional and career development. The deadline to become a Mentor is August 30th.
Learn more here
 
 
 
Interested in a scramble golf event with alumni and friends 
﻿
to support a local not-for-profit?
 
If so, come have fun and support High Jump to help empower Chicago middle schoolers.
This is the 3rd annual scramble golf outing hosted by the Chicago Booth Alumni Club of Chicago in support of a local Chicago not-for-profit focused on equalizing educational opportunities for Chicago students. The event will help raise funds and awareness for High Jump as it looks to bring equity to education for Chicago middle grade students who have exhibited academic ambition, potential and who are of limited economic means. 
Read more here

 Suite 201 | 
Chicago, IL 60614 US

subject: Watch Now: Onboard Faster, Reduce Costs & Drive Retention
body:
Watch now to hear success stories from retailers who have crafted ingenious onboarding strategies to drive retention, performance and cost savings.
 
Onboard Faster, Reduce Costs & Drive Retention
 
Watch Now!
 
You want to get new staff on the floor as quickly as possible, but you need them trained and ready to perform. Taking shortcuts around onboarding is tempting — but instead of reducing labor spend, it can increase costs related to turnover, safety and inefficiency. 
 
The alternative: onboard new associates faster and more effectively. 
 
In this session, our speakers will share success stories from retailers who have crafted ingenious onboarding strategies to drive retention, performance and cost savings.

subject: July 26 Breakfast Club:The Great Skills Journey: Upskilling & Reskilling at Scale
body:
Skills have been a key focus area for some time. According to Deloitte research, organizations are increasingly placing skills, rather than jobs, at the center of the way work gets done, and “by basing people decisions on skills more than jobs, organizations can have a scalable, manageable, more equitable way of operating.”
 
The Great Skills Journey: Upskilling & Reskilling at Scale
Weds, Jul. 24, 2024
VIRTUAL • INTERACTIVE • NO-COST 
Dear Ashton,
 
Skills have been a key focus area for some time. According to Deloitte research, organizations are increasingly placing skills, rather than jobs, at the center of how work gets done, and “by basing people decisions on skills more than jobs, organizations can have a scalable, manageable, more equitable way of operating.”
 
Join us on Weds, July 24, at the upcoming BreakfastClub, “
The Great Skills Journey: Upskilling & Reskilling at Scale,
” where we will explore how learning leaders are kicking their large-scale upskilling and reskilling initiatives into high gear and the steep set of challenges they are tackling in doing so.
 
Register today!
 
Warm regards,
Chief Learning Officer

You don't often get email from luke@chicagoinnovationawards.com. 
Learn why this is important
Ashton, 
We're excited to introduce a brand new event --- the 
Climate Innovation Summit on June 13th
.  With nearly 
20 speakers across four sessions
, the event convenes all types of innovators and leaders across industries who are combating climate change.  Find out why Chicago is a growing hub of sustainability-driven innovation.  
Event details are 
here
 and in the invitation below.  We hope to see you there.
Best, 
Luke Tanen
President and CEO
Chicago Innovation
 
 
 
Ashton,
Join us for this 
first-ever Climate Innovation Summit
, a new event that convenes the brightest minds, celebrates remarkable achievements in sustainability, and ignites inspiration in the fight across the climate change spectrum:
- The Air We Breathe
- The Water We Need
- The Food We Eat
- The Energy We Use
Sincerely,
 
Luke Tanen, President and CEO, Chicago Innovation
Tom Kuczmarski, Co-founder, Chicago Innovation 
Margaret Mueller, President and CEO, The Executives' Club of Chicago
 
 
 
SESSION 1: 2:20PM - 3:00PM 
 
 
Michelle Carr, CEO, Evergreen Climate Innovations
 | Formerly the Clean Energy Trust, Evergreen Climate Innovations supports entrepreneurs that are bringing impactful climate technologies to market
 
Freya Burton, Chief Sustainability Officer, LanzaTech 
| One of 
Time Magazine's
 "100 Most Influential Companies 2023," this carbon recycling technology company has raised $869 million, IPO'd in 2023 and has over 1,000 patents 
 
Erin Amico, CEO, Peggy Notebaert Museum
 | For 166 years, the Nature Museum has been connecting Chicagoans to nature and science  
 
Dr. Andrea Kramer, Senior Director of Restoration Ecology, Chicago Botanic Garden
 | This world-renowned living museum builds healthier communities through urban agriculture, plant conservation research, and showcases the beauty of horticulture
 
 
Dr. Trent Ford, Illinois State Climatologist 
| The state's leading authority on weather and climate data, maps, and information for government agencies, policymakers, and all citizens.
﻿
 
 
SESSION 2: 
3:10PM-3:50PM 
 
 
Mike Reardon, CEO, Triwater Holdings 
| Founder of Fortune 500 company U.S. Filter Corporation, which he grew to more than $5.5 billion in revenue; Former CEO of Culligan International, a 14,000 person global water treatment company
 
Margaret Frisbie, CEO, Friends of the Chicago River 
| 
Leads the only organization exclusively dedicated to improving and protecting the Chicago River system
 
Howard Learner, CEO, Environmental Law & Policy Center 
| Founded and oversees the Midwest's premier environmental legal advocacy and nationally influential eco-business innovation organization
 
Dr. Melissa Youngquist, Researcher, Shedd Aquarium
 | Member of the freshwater research team who focuses on how invasive species affect terrestrial and aquatic habitats 
 
 
Karine Rouge, CEO, Municipal Water, Veolia North America
 | Leads the municipal water teams which form the leading private water player, serving 28 million people in the US. 
 
 
 
SESSION 3: 
3:50PM-4:30PM 
 
 
Thomas Jonas, Founder and CEO, Nature's Fynd
 | Chicago's only food industry unicorn startup; raised $500 million from Bill Gates, Jeff Bezos, Al Gore and others to revolutionize how we consume protein
 
Mitch Harkenrider, Director of Strategy & Business Development, Canopy Farm Management 
| Launched in close partnership with the Savanna Institute, a non-profit research and education organization focused on tree-based regenerative agriculture
 
Matt Wechler, Award-winning Filmmaker and Creative Director of Hourglass Films
 | His stories focus on social and environmental injustice as well as the sustainability of our planet
 
Julia Stamberger, CEO, The Planting Hope Company
 | Publicly-traded startup known for its unique plant-based and planet-friendly food and beverage brands; recently acquired Argo Tea 
 
 
SESSION 4: 4
:40PM-5:20PM 
 
 
Amy Francetic, Co-founder, Buoyant Ventures
Founding CEO of the Clean Energy Trust
 | Amy leads this $80 million venture fund in Chicago that invests in digital climate solutions; Founded and led Energize Ventures, a $165 million venture fund that invests in digital energy technologies
 
Brian Imus, Executive Director, Illinois Green Alliance 
|
 
Leads this member-driven nonprofit that promotes green buildings and communities that give people better, brighter, and healthier places to live, work and learn.
 
Vik Vikrant, Chief Sustainability Officer, Accenture North America
 | 
Vik has advised companies for 20+ years on managing their organizations more successfully through sustainability, digital transformation and strategic partnerships
 
Francis Wang, CEO, Nanograf 
| Under his leadership, NanoGraf raised $65 million in venture funding in 2023, one of the year's 10 largest battery VC rounds. Francis has over 25 years of experience in energy storage and clean energy innovation, commercialization, and manufacturing.
 
Sri Deivasigamani, CEO, Intellihot 
| Founded and leads this company, backed by $65 million in capital, that combines AI with leading-edge technology to revolutionize the HVAC and plumbing industry
 
 
SESSION 5: 
Cocktail Reception 
 
Network with hundreds of attendees and discover how to collaborate with exhibiting organizations that are at the forefront of combating climate change
 
Held in in the beautiful Grand Ballroom at the School of the Art Institute of Chicago 
﻿
(112 S. Michigan Ave.) 
 
 
 
 
Thank you to our Climate Change Initiative Sponsors:
Reven Fellars, Joanna Bratt, Bess Celio, 
﻿
Benjamin Lumpkin, Mycocycle
 
Chicago Innovation | 
2001 N Halsted
 Suite 201 | 
Chicago, IL 60614 US

subject: Nominations deadline extended
body:
To view this email as a web page, 
click here
.
Due to a number of extension requests for nominations into the 
Women, Influence & Power in Law Awards 2024
, we will be extending until June 14.
We encourage you to seize this opportunity to elevate your achievements and amplify your voice within the legal community. Your participation not only celebrates your individual successes but also contributes to the collective advancement of women in law.
What are the judges looking for?
 
Above all else, we are looking for women legal leaders who are making a difference in the industry. What are some unique and innovative things about the work that you’re doing? What makes what you accomplished last year stand out amongst your peers? Was last year extraordinarily challenging? If so, how did you get through it? We know legal departments and law firms had a challenging year, so we want to know how you met those challenges and overcame them!
View the Categories
View 2023 Honorees
Nominate Here
We welcome self-nominations, as well as ones from colleagues, mentors, peers & clients!
The deadline for submissions is June 14, 2024.
START YOUR NOMINATIONS
THE CONFERENCE
Described as one of the “most inspiring and empowering women's conferences in the legal space,” Women, Influence & Power in Law (WIPL) offers an opportunity for unprecedented exchange with women in-house and outside counsel. This unique event is created with the assistance of an advisory board comprised of high ranking women, General Counsel or direct reports to the GC, from across the globe! 
Find out more

externalevents@lcwmail.com

subject: Future-Proofing Your Organization
body:
As the professional landscape continues to evolve, ensuring your organization is equipped for tomorrow's challenges is essential. Join us for an insightful webinar, "What's Keeping Your CEO Up at Night: How to Future-Proof Your Organization," on Thurs, June 20, 2024, at 11:00 a.m. CT.
 
What's Keeping Your CEO Up at Night: 
How to Future-Proof Your Organization
 
Thurs, June 20, 2024 at 11:00 a.m. CT
 
Dear Ashton,
 
As the professional landscape continues to evolve, ensuring your organization is equipped for tomorrow's challenges is essential. Join us for an insightful webinar, "
What's Keeping Your CEO Up at Night: How to Future-Proof Your Organization
," on Thurs, June 20, 2024, at 11:00 a.m. CT.
 
Led by Paul Eschen, CMO at BizLibrary, this webinar will draw from a recent "Trends in Training" survey of HR and L&D professionals, offering key insights into the skills and strategies shaping organizations in 2024 and beyond.
Here's what to expect:
Balancing Talent and Technology: Navigating Conflicting Priorities
Strategic HR Leadership: From Execution to Creation
The Evolution of Leadership: Trends and Challenges
Prepare your organization for tomorrow's demands. 
Reserve your spot today

subject: Practical Strategies for Leadership Development – Join Our Webinar!
body:
This webinar is designed to provide you with actionable insights to enhance your leadership development initiatives. Register now to learn more!
 
Getting the Most Out of Your Leadership Development with Group Coaching
 
Thurs, June 20, 2024 at 1 p.m. CT
 
Dear Ashton,
 
Unlock the full potential of your leadership development programs with practical strategies and expert advice on Thurs, June 20, at 1 p.m. CT for the webinar "
Getting the Most Out of Your Leadership Development with Group Coaching
." Samera Edwards, program manager, equity, inclusion & diversity at Waymo, and Mandy Varley, principal behavioral scientist at Torch, will guide you through strategic coaching methods to develop effective leaders.
 
You will learn how to:
Evaluate group coaching and 1:1 coaching against other leadership development options.
Set clear, achievable goals.
Select the best participants and build a successful cohort.
Communicate your successes internally.
This webinar is designed to provide you with actionable insights to enhance your leadership development initiatives. 
Register now to learn more
!

This is the consulting industry's largest and most in-depth survey assessing the profession's best working environments based on employee satisfaction.
For 23 years Consulting Magazine has presented The Best Firms to Work For, rankings, showcasing those companies whose policies and practices support their investment and commitment to keep their employees happy, engaged and professionally fulfilled.

The impact of women's leadership on our profession cannot be overstated. It is one of the reasons Consulting magazine has endeavored to identify and recognize those individuals through the Women Leaders in Consulting awards.

If your firm has not yet met the minimum numbers of survey submissions to qualify for Best Firms to Work For 2024, we are pleased to add some incentive to your process:
All finalists and honorees for the 2024 Best Firms to Work For will receive survey data based on the evaluations submitted by their timekeepers.

subject: Register now for our first ever Climate Innovation Summit on June 13th
body:
Dear Ashton,
Join us for this 
first-ever Climate Innovation Summit
, a new event that convenes the brightest minds, celebrates remarkable achievements in sustainability, and ignites inspiration in the fight across the climate change spectrum:
- The Air We Breathe
- The Water We Need
- The Food We Eat
- The Energy We Use
We hope you can join us,
 
Luke Tanen, President and CEO, Chicago Innovation
Tom Kuczmarski, Co-founder, Chicago Innovation 
Margaret Mueller, President and CEO, The Executives' Club of Chicago
 
 
 
SESSION 1: 2:20PM - 3:00PM 
 
 
Michelle Carr, CEO, Evergreen Climate Innovations
 | Formerly the Clean Energy Trust, Evergreen Climate Innovations supports entrepreneurs that are bringing impactful climate technologies to market
 
Freya Burton, Chief Sustainability Officer, LanzaTech 
| One of 
Time Magazine's
 "100 Most Influential Companies 2023," this carbon recycling technology company has raised $869 million, IPO'd in 2023 and has over 1,000 patents 
 
Erin Amico, CEO, Peggy Notebaert Museum
 | For 166 years, the Nature Museum has been connecting Chicagoans to nature and science  
 
Dr. Andrea Kramer, Senior Director of Restoration Ecology, Chicago Botanic Garden
 | This world-renowned living museum builds healthier communities through urban agriculture, plant conservation research, and showcases the beauty of horticulture
 
 
Dr. Trent Ford, Illinois State Climatologist 
| The state's leading authority on weather and climate data, maps, and information for government agencies, policymakers, and all citizens.
﻿
 
 
SESSION 2: 
3:10PM-3:50PM 
 
 
Mike Reardon, CEO, Triwater Holdings 
| Founder of Fortune 500 company U.S. Filter Corporation, which he grew to more than $5.5 billion in revenue; Former CEO of Culligan International, a 14,000 person global water treatment company
 
Margaret Frisbie, CEO, Friends of the Chicago River 
| 
Leads the only organization exclusively dedicated to improving and protecting the Chicago River system
 
Howard Learner, CEO, Environmental Law & Policy Center 
| Founded and oversees the Midwest's premier environmental legal advocacy and nationally influential eco-business innovation organization
 
Dr. Melissa Youngquist, Researcher, Shedd Aquarium
 | Member of the freshwater research team who focuses on how invasive species affect terrestrial and aquatic habitats 
 
 
Karine Rouge, CEO, Municipal Water, Veolia North America
 | Leads the municipal water teams which form the leading private water player, serving 28 million people in the US. 
 
 
 
SESSION 3: 
3:50PM-4:30PM 
 
 
Thomas Jonas, Founder and CEO, Nature's Fynd
 | Chicago's only food industry unicorn startup; raised $500 million from Bill Gates, Jeff Bezos, Al Gore and others to revolutionize how we consume protein
 
Mitch Harkenrider, Director of Strategy & Business Development, Canopy Farm Management 
| Launched in close partnership with the Savanna Institute, a non-profit research and education organization focused on tree-based regenerative agriculture
 
Matt Wechler, Award-winning Filmmaker and Creative Director of Hourglass Films
 | His stories focus on social and environmental injustice as well as the sustainability of our planet
 
Julia Stamberger, CEO, The Planting Hope Company
 | Publicly-traded startup known for its unique plant-based and planet-friendly food and beverage brands; recently acquired Argo Tea 
 
 
SESSION 4: 4
:40PM-5:20PM 
 
 
Amy Francetic, Co-founder, Buoyant Ventures
Founding CEO of the Clean Energy Trust
 | Amy leads this $80 million venture fund in Chicago that invests in digital climate solutions; Founded and led Energize Ventures, a $165 million venture fund that invests in digital energy technologies
 
Brian Imus, Executive Director, Illinois Green Alliance 
|
 
Leads this member-driven nonprofit that promotes green buildings and communities that give people better, brighter, and healthier places to live, work and learn.
 
Vik Vikrant, Chief Sustainability Officer, Accenture North America
 | 
Vik has advised companies for 20+ years on managing their organizations more successfully through sustainability, digital transformation and strategic partnerships
 
Francis Wang, CEO, Nanograf 
| Under his leadership, NanoGraf raised $65 million in venture funding in 2023, one of the year's 10 largest battery VC rounds. Francis has over 25 years of experience in energy storage and clean energy innovation, commercialization, and manufacturing.
 
Sri Deivasigamani, CEO, Intellihot 
| Founded and leads this company, backed by $65 million in capital, that combines AI with leading-edge technology to revolutionize the HVAC and plumbing industry
 
 
SESSION 5: 
Cocktail Reception 
 
Network with hundreds of attendees and discover how to collaborate with exhibiting organizations that are at the forefront of combating climate change
 
Held in in the beautiful Grand Ballroom at the School of the Art Institute of Chicago 
﻿
(112 S. Michigan Ave.) 
 
 
 
 
Thank you to our Climate Change Initiative Sponsors:
Reven Fellars, Joanna Bratt, Bess Celio, 
﻿
Benjamin Lumpkin, Mycocycle

subject: Empowering Growth: SAP's Learning Transformation with Pluralsight!
body:
SAP began engaging with Pluralsight in 2015 to upskill employees ahead of its transition to cloud-native architecture. But the partnership didn’t stop there.
 
SAP Employees Grow, Upskill with Pluralsight's Learning Platform
SAP began engaging with Pluralsight in 2015 to upskill employees ahead of its transition to cloud-native architecture. But the partnership didn’t stop there. SAP leaders knew they would also need to train their global workforce on technical topics related to the product change. In 2018, SAP’s workforce completed fewer than 3,000 courses. 
 
Just four years later, in 2022, they saw almost 28,000 course completions, and collectively, SAP employees learned for more than 75,000 hours on Pluralsight in 2023. The continued enthusiasm for Pluralsight’s content subsequently led SAP to open access to its entire development department, with plans to further expand this year.
DOWNLOAD NOW
 
SPONSORED BY:
 
BetterWork Media Group, 1 E. Erie Street, Suite 525, Unit 2025, Chicago, IL 60611

subject: Meet the Winners of Out & Equal's 2024 LATAM Forum Excellence Awards!
body:
You don't often get email from hello@outandequal.org. 
Learn why this is important
 
 
 
Out & Equal Announces Winners of the 2024 LATAM Forum Excellence Awards
The Awards Celebrate the Leaders and Luminaries Driving LGBTQI+ Workplace Inclusion Across Latin America
At its 
2024 LATAM Forum in Brazil
, Out & Equal proudly announced the winners of its Excellence Awards. Each year, these awards recognize and celebrate individuals, executive leaders, companies, and employee resource groups (ERGs) who are leading the way with bold and innovative advancements toward workplace inclusion for LGBTQI+ people in Latin America.
“Recognition and representation matter,” said Erin Uritus (she/her), CEO of Out & Equal.
“Inclusion and belonging are the right things to do and are smart business practices. It is why it is essential that we elevate the individuals and organizations who are driving meaningful change, as they are illuminating a path forward for us all. Congratulations to this year’s honorees. We look forward to celebrating your ongoing progress and to seeing others follow your example.”
Winners were announced across several categories:
Executive Leader Excellence Award
 
Sara Goretti Elias Ferreira (She/Her)
 
Senior Consultant | SGO SC&E Sustainability, Climate & Equity 
Leader | Diversity, Equity & Inclusion LGBT+ Brasil, Deloitte
 
Latin American LGBTQI+ Workplace Advocate Excellence Award
 
 
Luana Gimenez (She/Her) 
Manager, Equality Recruiting & Global VP Outforce, Salesforce
Diego Alejandro Vargas Roa (He/Him)
 
Credit and Collection Chief, Ingredion Mexico
 
Employee Resource Group Excellence Award
 
 
Pride at SAP
Pride at JPMorgan Chase & Co.
 
Employee Resource Group Rising Star Award
 
PRISM at Avanade
 
Brasil Workplace Excellence Award
 
PwC Brasil
 
Latin America Workplace Excellence Award
 
Ingredion Mexico
The 2024 Out & Equal LATAM Excellence Awards were presented during a special ceremony that concluded the 2024 LATAM Forum, a day-long event dedicated to advancing LGBTQI+ workplace equity, where leaders, practitioners, and changemakers alike gather for informative sessions, engaging conversations, and opportunities to discuss cutting-edge and innovative DEIB strategies.

This is the consulting industry's largest and most in-depth survey assessing the profession's best working environments based on employee satisfaction.
For 23 years Consulting Magazine has presented The Best Firms to Work For, rankings, showcasing those companies whose policies and practices support their investment and commitment to keep their employees happy, engaged and professionally fulfilled. 
The survey ranks employee satisfaction in the following categories:
Culture
Career Development
Client Engagement
Compensation & Benefits
Firm Leadership
Rankings are then separated into two groups: small firms, consisting of between 20 and 250 billable consultants; and large firms, consisting of 251 or more billable consultants. Rankings are based on responses to survey questions taken by a firm's consultants. 
There is a minimum number of responses required to qualify.

subject: Accelerating Learning: How SAP Maximized Learning Hours with Pluralsight
body:
SAP began engaging with Pluralsight in 2015 to upskill employees ahead of its transition to cloud-native architecture. But the partnership didn’t stop there.
May 1, 2024 | 
Subscribe
 
 
SAP Employees Grow, Upskill with Pluralsight's Learning Platform
SAP began engaging with Pluralsight in 2015 to upskill employees ahead of its transition to cloud-native architecture. But the partnership didn’t stop there. SAP leaders knew they would also need to train their global workforce on technical topics related to the product change. In 2018, SAP’s workforce completed fewer than 3,000 courses. 
 
Just four years later, in 2022, they saw almost 28,000 course completions, and collectively, SAP employees learned for more than 75,000 hours on Pluralsight in 2023. The continued enthusiasm for Pluralsight’s content subsequently led SAP to open access to its entire development department, with plans to further expand this year.

subject: SAP Employees Grow, Upskill with Pluralsight's Learning Platform
body:
SAP began engaging with Pluralsight in 2015 to upskill employees ahead of its transition to cloud-native architecture. But the partnership didn’t stop there.
April 23, 2024 | 
Subscribe
 
 
SAP Employees Grow, Upskill with Pluralsight's Learning Platform
SAP began engaging with Pluralsight in 2015 to upskill employees ahead of its transition to cloud-native architecture. But the partnership didn’t stop there. SAP leaders knew they would also need to train their global workforce on technical topics related to the product change. In 2018, SAP’s workforce completed fewer than 3,000 courses. 
 
Just four years later, in 2022, they saw almost 28,000 course completions, and collectively, SAP employees learned for more than 75,000 hours on Pluralsight in 2023. The continued enthusiasm for Pluralsight’s content subsequently led SAP to open access to its entire development department, with plans to further expand this year.
DOWNLOAD NOW

subject: 🚀 April Edition: Community, Content, and Transform 2025
body:
You don't often get email from updates@transform.us. 
Learn why this is important
Stay connected with this month's top community events and grab your Transform 2025 tickets at the lowest price available
 
Hi Hannah,
Welcome to the April issue of the Insider newsletter! We're excited to bring you helpful resources, insightful content, and not-to-be-missed events tailored just for our community. Whether you're looking to engage with new ideas, connect with peers, or find inspiration, we've got you covered.
 
Also, a friendly reminder for those planning to join us at Transform 2025—early bird tickets are currently available at the lowest prices you'll see all year. It's the perfect opportunity to 
secure your spot 
and save. Don't wait too long, as these rates won't last!
AWARDS SPOTLIGHT
 
Discover how 
Progress Residential 
won the Talent Strategy of the Year Award by fostering the next generation of skilled trades talent and strengthening community ties with their Workforce Development Program. 
Read more.
WHAT'S TRENDING ON THE BLOG 
 
 
 
Explore 
Coco Brown
's dynamic journey as a 4x founder revolutionizing HR and shaping the impactful Athena Alliance.
Read More.
Discover insights from 
Adam Weber
, author of 'Lead Like a Human', as he shares his journey to authentic leadership and transforming workplace culture.
Read More.
See how 
John Baldino
 thinks a solid HR tech stack revolutionizes recruitment, onboarding, and talent management in today's business world.
Read More.
TRANSFORM IMPACT
At Transform 2024, this community demonstrated our collective power to change the world. So many of you shared interview tips and career advice in support of Year Up students as they launch their careers, but our impact doesn’t stop there! 
Join us for virtual volunteering with Year Up, where we’ll help young people develop their professional skills. 
Sign up to volunteer virtually here.

: Beyond Quotas: Achieving True Diversity And Inclusion Through Thoughtful Hiring Practices

subject: Future-Proofing Your Organization: Unpacking AI's Role in Learning
body:
Join GP Strategies’ Head of Strategy, Andrew Joly and Principal Consultant, Geoff Bloom as they unpack what learners and businesses need to prepare for tomorrow.
View in browser
 
April 16, 2024 | 
Subscribe
 
 
Four Foundations for Future Success: Building Your Modern Learning Organization Today
Thurs, May 16, 2024 at 11 a.m. CT
VIRTUAL • INTERACTIVE • NO-COST 
Organizations are facing enormous pressure in an increasingly uncertain and disruptive business climate. To remain competitive, companies need to identify and respond to these challenges through a combination of people, technology, skills and performance behavior. Artificial Intelligence (AI) is already playing a defining role in learning, and organizations need to factor this into their learning strategies now to remain successful.  
Join GP Strategies’ Head of Strategy, Andrew Joly and Principal Consultant, Geoff Bloom as they unpack what learners and businesses need to prepare for tomorrow. They will present the four foundations for delivering the learning organization of the future.

subject: [On Demand] The Future of Talent Management
body:
You don't often get email from noreply=talentmgt.com@bf54x.hs-send.com. 
Learn why this is important
Watch this event focused on moving toward a skills-based talent management approach, including how to leverage data-driven approaches to track and measure skill development, optimize team dynamics and create an agile organization poised for success in a fast-changing business landscape
April 8, 2024 | 
Subscribe
 
 
A Transformative, Skills-Based Approach to Talent Management
ON DEMAND
VIRTUAL • INTERACTIVE • NO COST
Talent management is on a transformative journey to align with the demands of the 21st-century workplace. Identifying, acquiring, developing and retaining talent based on skills assessments and real-world competencies, as opposed to focusing solely on traditional job titles and qualifications, is a crucial element of this contemporary paradigm shift.
 
Watch this event focused on moving toward a skills-based talent management approach, including how to leverage data-driven approaches to track and measure skill development, optimize team dynamics and create an agile organization poised for success in a fast-changing business landscape. Our panel of talent professionals discuss how they are modernizing their talent management strategies and driving organizational excellence by harnessing the power of skills and abilities in their workforces.
WATCH NOW
 
MEET THE EXPERTS
 
MODERATOR
Kara Schillaci
Vice President, Talent Management & Transformation
Rexel

subject: Illuminating the Way to the 2024 Out & Equal Workplace Summit
body:
You don't often get email from hello@outandequal.org. 
Learn why this is important
Out & Equal’s April 2024 Newsletter
 
 
 
The Power of Community and Convening: Illuminating the Path Forward and Driv﻿ing Meaningful Change
It was just a week ago that we kicked off the
 
2024 Out & Equal Leadership Forum
, a convening focused on and dedicated to inclusive leadership and amplifying the change agent within each of us. As I interacted with the hundreds of attendees and took in as much content as possible, I couldn’t help but be inspired 
and
 introspective.
Leadership Forum was filled with rich discussions, insightful learning sessions on topics of LGBTQ+ workplace inclusion, and plenty of opportunity to connect and build relationships with attendees from our Partner community. Beyond that, our focus on bolstering individuals’ capabilities to become better changes agents means that we have truly unleashed a new cohort of professionals who will return to their workplaces better equipped to do this important work at a time it’s needed most.
I have been filled with pride at what the team re-imagined for this event (previously known as the Executive Forum) and am reminded of the importance of community and the power it holds—especially in times of uncertainty and when illumination and clarity is required to cut effectively through the disinformation and noise. While there were many moments that stayed with me, I want to share a few highlights.
Number One
. In one of our mainstage discussions, we released findings from a new Out & Equal report titled,
 
Talent on the Move-Where Do We Go From Here?
 
This research, which was made possible by funding from the Wells Fargo Foundation, examines how the changing US legislative landscape and the surge in anti-LGBTQ+ bills are impacting the LGBTQ+ workforce experience and the actionable steps employers can take to effectively respond.
Here are a few of the topline findings:
 
The report’s findings kicked off critical discussions about the current moment we find ourselves in, why the LGBTQ+ community needs action paired with authentic allyship, and how businesses and their leaders have been and must become changemakers driving greater LGBTQ+ inclusion in the workplace.
Number Two
. At Out & Equal, we know that the LGBTQ+ community is not a monolith. It’s intersectional and comprised of groups and individuals with varying experiences and needs. And unless all are recognized and prioritized in workplace inclusion and belonging efforts, our movement toward greater and lasting workplace equity cannot and will not succeed.
As part of our work, we are aiming to support employers in leveraging the 
full
 talents of the LGBTQ+ workforce particularly, transgender and nonbinary leaders. It’s why heading into Leadership Forum, we also released 
Where the Margins Meet the Corner Office: Five Leadership Insights from Transgender and Nonbinary Leaders
.
The key takeaway: When transgender and nonbinary leaders are genuinely supported and encouraged to bring the fullness of their expertise, identities, and life experiences to their executive roles, they unlock a wealth of opportunities and advantages for their organizations.
Throughout Leadership Forum, the insights highlighted in this body of work drove meaningful discussions and conversations about the future of work, the value of difference and diversity, and the importance of creating workplace cultures rich in inclusion and belonging so all individuals can bring their authentic selves to work, contribute to their fullest potential, and thrive.
﻿Number Three. 
Our “Light Up the Night” themed Momentum closing reception reminded me that even in the most challenging of times, our movement is filled with light, joy, and strength. As individuals and as a community, we can never forget our resilience or the power we possess. Nor can we lose touch with our ability to create a brighter future for ourselves and the world.
By convening and building community, we can share learnings, have the difficult conversations, and discuss how we can continue to advance and expand the movement to ensure we’re widening the path behind us with each interaction, and so much more. We can be reminded of our power and how we are an unstoppable, growing, and radiant force.
And while Leadership Forum has concluded, I am filled with energy and looking forward to the convenings that lie ahead from our Global Impact Forums this spring, to summer Pride celebrations, and the 2024 Workplace Summit in the fall.
I’ll see you there!
 
 
 
 
 
 
We are in a moment when the voices and actions of a few are attempting to dim the light and progress of an entire movement. And while it may seem overwhelming, we must remember our potential, our strength, and our value. In times of adversity, doubt, and challenge, Queer joy and resilience will always outshine and persevere.
Each one of us possesses this light inside of us that when nurtured and joined by others is magnified. It becomes a beacon of hope, connection, truth, and safety. Every day in our workplaces, LGBTQ+ people–and their allies–work relentlessly to illuminate paths toward inclusion and belonging.
And through the Out & Equal Workplace Summit, we will harness, nurture, and grow that light. We will remind our collective community and the world of the brilliance and power we—the LGBTQ+ community and our allies—hold. We will remind them that we are an unstoppable, radiant force.
Workplace Summit
, 
th
e largest LGBTQ+ workplace inclusion event in the world, is an Out & Equal Partner exclusive e
vent. Learn more about 
becoming a Partner
.
 
Act Now: Submit Your Learning Session Proposal for the 2024 Out & Equal Workplace Summit
Programming—from mainstage plenaries to learning sessions—at Out & Equal’s Workplace Summit not only celebrates diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging but provides a platform for best practice and leading-edge content sharing, meaningful discussions, and tangible solutions-oriented actions to advance LGBTQ+ rights and well-being. By fostering an environment of empathy, collaboration, and allyship, our impactful programming—that in 2023 consisted of 100+ mainstage events, panels, and interactive workshops over 4 days—inspires positive change within the workforce and beyond.
 
Put your best foot forward! With only 90 workshop sessions available, and more than 400 submitting organizations, our learning sessions represent the very best in emerging trends and strategies. Lead with your most compelling work in LGBTQ+ workplace belonging, policy, and advocacy.
The deadline to submit proposals is Friday, May 24.
Submit Your Learning Session Proposal
 
More information regarding registration will be announced in the coming weeks.
 
 
Recognition and Representation Matter: 
Submit your Nomination for the Outie Awards Now!
 
Since its inception more than 20 years ago, Out & Equal has recognized more than 100 individuals, organizations and workplace initiatives, and Employee Resource Groups across a range of categories whose work is proven to have advanced LGBTQ+ workplace equity and belonging for all. Our finalists each year are role models, having demonstrated replicable inclusive leadership efforts in their organizations and beyond.
The deadline to nominate is 
Wednesday, July 10
. The Outie Awards are presented to winners at the annual 
Out & Equal Workplace Summit
, elevating the award-winners’ profile as an LGBTQ+ inclusion champion and/or organization.
Submit a Nomination
 
 
 
 
 
Driving Impact Across the Globe: Register Now for Out & Equal’s Global Forums
Out & Equal has a rich history of convening with measurable and lasting impact. From our annual signature events such as
 
Workplace Summit
 and 
Leadership Forum
, to our 
Global Forums
 and 
regional convenings, our gatherings have always been, and continue to be, designed to bring together renowned thought leaders, key workplace stakeholders, and influencers to solve the most pressing issues facing—and create innovative opportunities to advance—LGBTQI+ workplace inclusion.
We are thrilled to be offering multiple in-person, Partner-exclusive gatherings around the world in the coming weeks in Latin America (LATAM), the American South, and Asia-Pacific (APAC).
These events will bring together executives, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, & Belonging and HR practitioners, ERG leaders, workplace inclusion changemakers, and other influencers to partake in trailblazing discussions and workshops, peer-to-peer education on innovative best practices, and networking with leaders actively making change within each region.
Together, in these spaces, we will continue working towards creating workplaces and workplace cultures where LGBTQ+ employees and allies belong, thrive, and contribute to greater impact.
Learn more about each of our upcoming, Partner-exclusive events below
 
May 9, 2024
Registration is now open!
Submit a nomination for the LATAM Forum Excellence Awards!
 
June 6, 2024 
﻿
Presented by Airbus
Registration is now open!
 
July 16, 2024
Registration will open in the coming weeks!
 
 
 
 
Welcome to Our New Partners! 
At Out & Equal, we work with the world's leading and most influential companies—and the inclusive leaders in these organizations—to advance LGBTQ+ representation, equity, inclusion, and belonging in the workplace. 
We’re proud to welcome
 Avantor Sciences 
and 
BlackRock
 as our newest members of the Out & Equal Partner Community.
 
 
 
 
Join the Out & Equal Community
 
Becoming an Out & Equal Partner will supercharge your LGBTQ+ workplace inclusion progress. We look forward to having you join us in the movement! Find out how by clicking the link below. 
Partnering in the Business of Belonging™
Learn More
 
 
FOLLOW US
  
  
  
  
 
Out & Equal
 | 
1111 Broadway
, 
3rd Floor
, 
Oakland, CA 94607

Everyone, no matter their age, has something to teach and something to learn. Ageless Innovators bridges the generations through reciprocal mentoring to share experiences, skills, and knowledge. Everyone in Ageless Innovators is a mentor and a mentee!
Ageless Innovators was co-founded in 2019 by Chicago Innovation and The Village Chicago, with a generous grant from RRF Foundation for Aging. It is Chicago's first intergenerational co-mentoring program.

intimate panels and events with industry leaders on cohort specific topics

Nominations are Now Open for the 2024 Best Firms to Work For
This is the consulting industry’s largest and most in-depth survey assessing the profession's best working environments based on employee satisfaction.
For 23 years Consulting Magazine has presented The Best Firms to Work For, rankings, showcasing those companies whose policies and practices support their investment and commitment to keep their employees happy, engaged and professionally fulfilled.
The survey ranks employee satisfaction in the following categories:
Culture
Career Development
Client Engagement
Compensation & Benefits
Firm Leadership
Rankings are then separated into two groups: small firms, consisting of between 20 and 250 billable consultants; and large firms, consisting of 251 or more billable consultants. Rankings are based on responses to survey questions taken by a firm's consultants. 
There is a minimum number of responses required to qualify.
To be honored as one of the top firms to work for globally, complete the survey before the deadline closes on 
May 23, 2024
.

body:
Feel the impact of talent shortages? Join our webinar for insights into upskilling strategies to bridge these gaps effectively.
 
Upskilling: Your Golden Ticket To Closing the Talent Gap
Weds, Apr. 3, 2024 at 1 p.m. CT
VIRTUAL • INTERACTIVE • NO-COST 
Are talent shortages and skills gaps 
impacting your organization's growth
? Join us for an insightful webinar where we'll delve into the critical topic of

.

subject: 👀 Inside Look: Award Winners, Exclusive Transform Recaps, Pics, and More...
body:
You don't often get email from updates@transform.us. 
Learn why this is important
Meet the Transform 2024 Award Winners, Introducing Transform Plus, Check out the Highlights, and Be the first in line for Transform 2025.
 
Hi Hannah!
 
Last week's Transform 2024 was truly inspiring and energizing as we connected with our vibrant community. Over 50,000 connections were made by close to 3,000 people leaders, investors, founders, and changemakers from over 30 countries. In short, Transform 2024 was our biggest and most impactful event yet!
 
In this issue, we'll spotlight:
Transform 2024 Award Winners
Announcing Transform Plus
Transform 2024 Highlights
Be the first to know about Transform 2025
 
The Transform Awards ceremony at Transform 2024 was an unforgettable experience that truly stood out, bringing the entire community to its feet with excitement and energy! Emcee AJ Thomas and Queen Cora electrified the audience with themed awards music and an original song, "Changemaker's Anthem", to honor the Transform 10 Award Winners.
 
"Changemakers light the path,
Visions bold, break the glass.
Every corner ‘cross the sphere,
Bringing hope, casting out fear."
 
Congratulations to all the winners (and finalists) for being pivotal changemakers and driving forward the innovation for the now and next of work.
 
The Transform 10 Award Winners
Reema Batnagar
, Pixar Animation Studios, 
Mahima Chawla
, Cocoon, 
Lybra Clemons
, Former Twilio, 
Jose Cong
, Humane, Inc., 
Ted Deutch
, American Jewish Committee, 
Mita Mallick
, Carta, 
Rebecca Port PhD
, 10x Genomics, 
James Reinhart
, thredUP, 
Marcus Sawyerr
, EQ.app, 
Pat Wadors
, UKG
 
Category Award Winners
The Innovators: Transformative Tech of the Year
ShiftMed
Team Builder: Connected Culture of the Year
Mixbook
Inclusion Champion: DEI Initiative of the Year
Guild
Difference Maker: Social Impact Initiative of the Year
Georgia United Credit Union Foundation
Space Pioneer: Workspace Design of the Year
Seismic
People Activator: Employee Experience of the Year
Mixbook
Team Magnet: Talent Strategy of the Year
Progress Residential
Rewards Trailblazer: Total Rewards Strategy of the Year
Compt
Wellness Advocate: Wellbeing Program of the Year
Datadog
People Accelerator: L&D Program of the Year
Guild
Mission Messenger: Employer Brand of the Year
Duolingo
Data Master: People Reporting & Insights of the Year
Merck & Co
Power Pair: Executive Partnership of the Year
Reformation
Read More About the Winners
 
Transform Plus
 
We are excited to introduce 
Transform Plus
, our new member-only online community platform. Transform Plus is our newest initiative, designed to enhance your experience and bring the world of Transform together year-round. As a community-built and community-driven space, it offers a unique opportunity to engage, share, and learn together. 
 
If you did not attend Transform 2024, there are two ways you can join. Request an invitation from a colleague or friend who attended or 
join the waitlist now.
 We are excited to see how we build our community together.
Transform 2024 Highlights
 
Transform 2024 was an unforgettable experience and we are already anticipating gathering together for Transform 2025! Thank you to our media partner 
Charter
 for their 
daily recaps
. Here are some of their top takeaways:
AI's dual role in enhancing hiring quality and work life is underscored by discussions on its ethical use and the effort to mitigate bias and automation anxiety.
The emphasis on cost-effective worker wellness strategies underlines the importance of health equity and supporting women's wellness through all life stages.
Insights into advancing diversity, equity, and inclusion despite political and legal challenges, highlighting the continued need to foster inclusive workplaces
The focus on skilling and career development across generations, and the importance of constructive workplace communication, especially in an election year.
The variations in hybrid and remote work approaches are mind-boggling. Swift Medical in Toronto, for example, has been hybrid, but now is going fully remote, according to Cerys Cook, Chief People Officer. “Our team is distributed globally and we don't want to create an inequitable experience for people."
Don't miss out! 
Watch the replay
 of Charter's Transform 2024 Key Takeaways Recap if you missed the live recording.
Secure Your Spot: Join the Notification List
Be the first to experience the magic of Transform 2025 on March 17-19, 2025, at Wynn Las Vegas! Get on the list now to be notified when Transform 2025 registration opens so you can guarantee your spot to experience unparalleled community connections, groundbreaking conversations, and innovative discoveries. The earlier you register, the more you save - bonus!
Be First in Line
 
Thank You to Our Sponsors
 
Transform 2024 would not have been possible without the generous support of our sponsoring companies. 
A special thank you to our 
Title Sponsors: Lattice, Modern Health, Sana, Sequoia, Sparrow, and Transcarent. 
View all Sponsors.
 
We look forward to continuing our conversations, connections, and journey with you! 
 
Warm wishes,
Samara Jaffe
Co-Founder & General Manager
Transform
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Transform Media LLC, 1850 Gateway Drive, Suite 700, San Mateo, CA 94404
