subject: Register for the 2024 Top 50 Event! 🥂 - Fair360
body:
You don't often get email from noreply-newsletter@fair360.com. 
Learn why this is important
 
TOP 50 EVENT
 
Register for the 2024 Top 50 Event
Registration is now open for Fair360's Top 50 event, which will be held on May 13 at The Glasshouse in New York, NY. The theme of this year's event, "Bridging DEI & Strategic Business," will provide industry leaders with the tools they need to incorporate workplace fairness into a holistic business strategy that drives operational success and fosters greater workplace inclusion.
 
Don't miss the opportunity to learn, connect with DEI professionals and see the unveiling of the 2024 Top 50 Companies list at the premiere event for workplace fairness in corporate America!
Register Now
 
FAIRNESS FOCUS
 
March 21 is World Down Syndrome Day. The observance has been officially recognized by the United Nations since 2012, choosing the twenty-first day of the third month of the year as the designated date to represent the triplication of the twenty-first chromosome which causes Down syndrome.
 
People with Down syndrome and other intellectual disabilities often face stereotypes at work that pose challenges to their professional success. Employers may assume that they aren't capable of succeeding in a given role, or that they will need additional help to complete daily tasks. The theme of World Down Syndrome Day 2024 is "End the Stereotypes," which aims to highlight the unique capabilities of each person with Down syndrome, dispelling unfounded biases in the process.
 
FAIR360 FACTS:
  
5.5% of philanthropic donations at Top 10 companies are directed toward organizations that support people with disabilities.
 
Disability awareness training is mandatory for some portion of the workforce at 80% of Top 10 companies.
 
90% of Top 10 companies have an internship co-op program that targets people with disabilities.
 
RELATED FAIR360 CONTENT:
 
Meeting in a Box: National Disability Employment Awareness Month – Advancing Access and Equity
 
9 Characteristics of Leading Companies for Disability Employment
  
 
Webinar: Disability Etiquette in the Workplace
CULTURAL AWARENESS
 
Women’s History Month and Its Origins in March
In 1978, the school district of Sonoma, CA, initiated Women’s History Week, aiming to challenge stereotypes about women’s roles and abilities. The event coincided with International Women’s Day, held the week of March 8. As the movement gained traction, communities across the country started to embrace the celebration of Women’s History Month.
Read Full Article
 
MOST POPULAR CONTENT
Meeting in a Box: AAPI Heritage Month 2024
Key Strategies for Accommodating Employees During Ramadan
Corporate DEI Initiatives Don’t Discriminate Against White Men
IN CASE YOU MISSED IT
 
How Leaders Can Drive Employee Engagement and Retention
In conversations about how to drive employee engagement and retention, high-level leaders often overlook their role in talent management. There is seldom discussion about how boards and C-suite leaders can support talent’s desire to stay with an organization.
 
Employees view leadership as a key component in organizational stability and understanding the mission of the company and their individual roles. With the ripple effects of the Great Resignation still being felt in 2024, let’s look at some actions that drive employee retention and engagement.
Read Full Article

subject: The Employers' Guide to Supporting Mental Health at Work - Fair360
body:
You don't often get email from noreply-newsletter@fair360.com. 
Learn why this is important
 
QUOTE OF THE DAY
“Individually, we are one drop. Together, we are an ocean.” 
– Ryunosuke Satoro
Today's Topics: 
Meeting in a Box: Mental Health Awareness Month May 2024
Fairness Focus: Deaf History Month
Save the Date: Top 50 Event
Most Popular Content
In Case You Missed It: International Women's Day
MEETING IN A BOX
 
Mental Health Awareness Month 2024
May is Mental Health Awareness Month. It’s a time to recognize and confront mental health concerns in today’s rapidly changing workplace landscape. This Meeting in a Box emphasizes the essential role employers have in cultivating healthy and supportive work environments. It also examines industry leaders’ mental health programs and emergency support mechanisms, mental health facts and figures and five turning points in mental health awareness.
Read More
 
FAIRNESS FOCUS
 
March 13 marks the beginning of Deaf History Month. On this date in 1988, Gallaudet University, the first higher education institution for the deaf and hard of hearing, hired its first deaf president. Deaf History Month ends on April 15, a date chosen to commemorate the day that America's first public school for the deaf was opened in 1817.
 
Deaf and hard-of-hearing employees often face systemic barriers to success at work. Leaders seeking to cultivate a fair workplace should be attentive to the accommodations that employees with this disability require to work effectively, leveraging Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and soliciting feedback from team members to empower deaf employees to take control of their own career trajectory.
 
FAIR360 FACTS:
  
4% of the total workforce at Top 10 companies has a disability
 
All Top 10 Companies have an ERG for employees with disabilities
 
30% of Top 10 companies require people with disabilities to be represented in interview panels
 
RELATED FAIR360 CONTENT:
 
What It Means To Be a Disability Ally
 
Equality & Equity: The Intersection of Civil and Disability Rights
  
 
Meeting in a Box: Disability Employment Awareness Month
TOP 50 EVENT
 
Fair360's Annual Top 50 Event
As public perception shifts regarding DEI and ESG initiatives, the value of such efforts must be communicated in the language of business. Demonstrating the operational success of workplace diversity will ensure DEI's continued relevance well into the future.
The theme of this year's Top 50 event, held at The Glasshouse in New York, NY on May 13, will focus on making the business case for workplace fairness. Keep up with the latest updates on our "Events" page.
View Event Details
 
MOST POPULAR CONTENT
Meeting in a Box: AAPI Heritage Month 2024
Key Strategies for Accommodating Employees During Ramadan
Corporate DEI Initiatives Don’t Discriminate Against White Men
IN CASE YOU MISSED IT
 
International Women’s Day: Celebrating Achievements and Inspiring Inclusion
International Women’s Day is celebrated annually on March 8 to commemorate the cultural, political and socioeconomic achievements of women around the world.
The holiday also marks the start of Women’s History Month. This article explores the history of International Women's Day, why it matters today more than ever and what you can do to celebrate it while continuing to help make significant and lasting improvements in the lives of all women.
Read Full Article

SPONSOR INFO
Nominations are Now Open for the 2024 Best Firms to Work For
This is the consulting industry’s largest and most in-depth survey assessing the profession's best working environments based on employee satisfaction.
For 23 years Consulting Magazine has presented The Best Firms to Work For, rankings, showcasing those companies whose policies and practices support their investment and commitment to keep their employees happy, engaged and professionally fulfilled.
The survey ranks employee satisfaction in the following categories:
Culture
Career Development
Client Engagement
Compensation & Benefits
Firm Leadership
Rankings are then separated into two groups: small firms, consisting of between 20 and 250 billable consultants; and large firms, consisting of 251 or more billable consultants. Rankings are based on responses to survey questions taken by a firm's consultants. 
There is a minimum number of responses required to qualify.

body:

Then we invite you to join Ageless Innovators!
Over 
430
 
have participated to date
 
Hi Ashton,
Applications are now open
 for the 12th cohort of 
Ageless Innovators
, running July – December 2024. The deadline to apply is end of day 
Friday, April 26th.
Everyone, no matter their age, has something to teach and something to learn. Ageless Innovators bridges the generations through reciprocal mentoring to share experiences, skills, and knowledge. Everyone in Ageless Innovators is a mentor and a mentee!
Ageless Innovators was co-founded in 2019 by Chicago Innovation and The Village Chicago, with a generous grant from RRF Foundation for Aging. It is Chicago's first intergenerational co-mentoring program.
 
 
 
APPLY TODAY!
 
 
CALLING ALL PEOPLE SEEKING:
EXPERTISE: 
Learn from the insights of a different generation
 
PURPOSE: 
Give back and help your co-mentor reach their goals
 
﻿
COMMUNITY: 
Get access to a Chicago Innovation Membership during your 6-month cohort ($200 value) and a membership to the Village Chicago ($540 value)
 
TAKE PART IN MONTHLY EVENTS: 
LARGE-SCALE: 
Chicago Innovation community events with up to 750 participants

subject: BIG REVEAL for what's new at Transform 2024 + 10 Reasons Why You Shouldn't Miss Next Week
body:
You don't often get email from updates@transform.us. 
Learn why this is important
Transform 2024 starts next Monday, March 11 and there are so many reasons why you should be there. Check out why.
 
Hi, Hannah!
 
Welcome to our final Insider before our biggest and best Transform takes place on Monday, March 11th.
 
If you haven't joined our incredible lineup of people leaders, investors, and entrepreneurs shaping the future of work, 
there's still time.
Announcing our Transform 2024 Emcee!
 
We are absolutely thrilled to reveal that AJ Thomas, a powerhouse of talent in the HR and Future of Work space, renowned for her creativity, captivated us with her singing at Transform last year, and is a also a talented author, will be our 
first-ever emcee for Transform 2024
! Prepare to be dazzled as AJ brings her unique energy and flair to the stage.
10 Reasons Not To Miss Transform 2024
Join your people.
 Connect, learn, and be inspired by people-first leaders who are changing the now and next of work.
Unmatched Value.
 You'll walk away with new relationships and resources, a fresh understanding of the direction the workforce is heading in, and insights into the technology leading the way.
The world around us is changing. 
The way the world views work is changing rapidly - from the rise of AI, to conversations about remote work, changing dynamics in employer-employee relationships, healthcare innovation, and more.
Thought-provoking Keynotes. 
Transform is bringing together some of the most influential people like Chelsea Clinton, Josh Bersin, and many more! Hear dynamic keynotes, fireside chats, and panel conversations from hundreds of leaders discussing factors impacting the workforce.
See our award-winning changemakers.
 Get ready for innovation to take center stage at our Transform Awards Community Celebration! We'll celebrate the groundbreaking companies and visionary leaders who are setting new standards, pushing boundaries, and redefining what's possible. 
Be front row when we unveil exciting news. 
On March 12th, the Transform team will unveil a surprise that will change the way our community interacts, learns and drives the world of work forward. Trust us, you won't want to miss it!
Connect with a global community.
 Transform attendees make up a diverse, inclusive group of innovators from 30+ countries across the globe.
Explore the latest tech through live demos
. Get straight to the source and learn about innovation happening across the ecosystem from companies like Gabbi, Parsley360, Quarter, Upflex, Payactiv, Yohana, and more! 
Party with Flo Rida.
 Bring your boots with the fur to close out Transform 2024 at an exclusive after-party with your peers (and new friends) and hear an epic performance by world-famous Flo Rida!
Office Hours. 
Get unprecedented access and 1-on-1 meetings with investors like Menlo Ventures, ServiceNow, Workday Ventures,
 
M13, Acadian Ventures, SemperVirens, and more!
Join Transform's Global Community 
 
The Transform Global Ambassadorship Program is moving forward, full steam! We are creating Transform Global Chapters to expand our footprint and foster amazing conversations and innovations with local business and HR leaders. We have chapters in 40+ cities representing all regions in the world. The most recent Transform Global Chapter events include Toronto, London, Sydney, Madrid, Istanbul, and Kuala Lumpur! 
 
Are you an experienced HR leader and community builder outside the United States? Join us!
Learn More
 
Thank You to Our Sponsors
 
Transform 2024 would not be possible without the generous support of our sponsoring companies. 
A special thank you to our 
Title Sponsors: Lattice, Modern Health, Sana, Sequoia, Sparrow, and Transcarent. 
View all Sponsors.
 
There's still time!
 Be sure to grab your ticket now
.
 
Looking forward to seeing you soon.
 
Warm wishes,
Samara Jaffe
Co-Founder & General Manager
Transform
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Transform Media LLC, 1850 Gateway Drive, Suite 700, San Mateo, CA 94404

subject: Firsts Are Essential. Seconds Are Critical. Movements Must Be Intentional.
body:
You don't often get email from hello@outandequal.org. 
Learn why this is important
Out & Equal’s March 2024 Newsletter
 
 
 
Firsts Are Essential. Seconds Are Critical. Movements Must Be Intentional.
Leadership. Personally, and as the CEO of 
Out & Equal
, 
an organization dedicated to advancing LGBTQ+ workplace equity and inclusion, I am always thinking about what leadership means, how it’s identified, how it’s nurtured, and about who gets chosen (or overlooked) to be elevated to that status or level
.
And now, with Women’s History Month underway, International Women’s Day approaching (March 8th), and 
Out & Equal’s 2024 Leadership Forum
 just a few weeks away (March 25-27) all set against a backdrop of continued anti-LGBTQ+ efforts and legislation—
leadership is a topic that has taken on added heft and implications
. 
Let’s look at some statistics:
An 
article from Axios
 referencing an analysis from Bloomberg poignantly states, “Women only hold 8.2% of CEO roles at large companies.”
 
Data from 
Women in the Workplace
, a comprehensive research report conducted by McKinsey and Lean In, finds that, “Women represent roughly one in four C-suite leaders, and women of color just one in 16.”
 
And when we aim to examine LGBTQ+ women in leadership roles, the data is even harder to come by. But what is available does highlight some of the challenges LGBTQ+ women face more broadly in the workplace. 
Again, citing 
Women in the Workplace
 and their analysis of intersectional experiences:
 
1 in 5 LGBTQ+ women have been mistaken for someone more junior.
1 in 3 LGBTQ+ women say others get credit for their ideas.
2 in 5 LGBTQ+ women say their judgement is questioned.
1 in 3 LGBTQ+ women say a senior coworker has advocated on their behalf for a raise.
The facts above are a stark reminder that all women have an uphill climb to achieving equity in the workplace. These challenges and barriers are even more acute for women who are in marginalized and overlooked communities such as Queer women, transgender women, and women of color
.
Looking at the transgender community as an example, more than seven in ten (71%) transgender respondents in the
 
Experiences of the Lavender Ceiling
, 
a report Out & Equal developed in partnership with Korn Ferry to spotlight the progress challenges facing out LGBTQ+ leaders at work, reported gender identity and expression as the primary source of bias they’ve experienced in the workplace, compared to 15% of cisgender respondents. And when looking at LGBTQ+ representation more broadly, that same report noted that nearly half (49%) of survey respondents don’t view their company’s C-suite as representative of the LGBTQ+ community at all.
I am a bisexual, pansexual, and Queer woman. I am a CEO who has navigated the challenges experienced by women and Queer people in the workplace. I am a first for Out & Equal
.
And as I commence my seventh year as CEO of this organization, I am reflecting on my own journey to this role and recognizing the importance and responsibility of advancing movement-making impact by realizing not only firsts, but ensuring seconds, thirds, and beyond are more than achievable, but the norm
.
Let’s examine this further.
Firsts are essential. 
You have to get through the door and secure a seat at the table. Once you do, how you leverage that experience and earned influence to create sustainable change and build a wider pathway of inclusion and belonging really matters. Firsts can easily be viewed as a checked box and lauded as a victory and assumption that the work of equity, inclusion, and belonging are finished. That could not be further from the truth. When a first is achieved, the work must be accelerated
.
 
Seconds are critical. 
Just because a first is achieved, does not mean a second is guaranteed. Leaders and organizations must be intentional to ensure a continued commitment to and investment in pathways of leadership advancement for all—pathways inclusive of historically marginalized and overlooked communities
.
 
Movements must be intentional. 
First and seconds are foundational to create movement-making impact. How so? They begin to change hearts and minds, set new expectations, and establish a new normality. It’s a reverberating effect that allows individuals to see what is possible for themselves and for others, elevates and empowers new voices, creates opportunities for those who have been overlooked for too long, and unlocks innovation for workplaces and the societies they serve. And as these firsts and seconds grow into a movement, we must always remember to be intentional in our thought process, approach, and decision making. Is our movement inclusive? Are we building a wider pathway that brings everyone along? Are we approaching solutions with an intersectional lens? How are allies and individuals in positions of power leveraging their spheres of influence to elevate and empower historically marginalized and overlooked communities? These are all critical elements to building a movement that is inclusive, intentional, and impactful in meaningful ways.
 
So, as we look towards the future and creating cultures rich in inclusion and belonging, let’s acknowledge the challenges all women particularly Queer women, transgender women, and women of color have and continue to face. Let’s be sure we’re investing in their future and growth. Let’s make sure we’re laying the groundwork not for just firsts, but seconds, thirds, and beyond!
 
 
 
 
Recognizing, Honoring, and Celebrating Transgender Day of 
Visibility
 
Now, more than ever before, visibility and recognition matter.
As transgender and nonbinary people face erasure, discrimination, and systemic attacks, allies and the broader LGBTQ+ community and movement have an obligation to stand up for and
alongside them authentically and intentionally, ensuring they are seen, heard, and protected,
while elevating their remarkable stories, which have shaped the world we live in.
 
From the everyday heroes to the trailblazers and icons, transgender and nonbinary people have pushed the cause of equality forward for all people and created a world that is rich in culture, art, and love.
On Transgender Day of Visibility and beyond, we encourage you to:
Speak up on behalf of transgender and nonbinary people and don’t let their stories be pushed aside, erased, coopted, and/or forgotten. Learn about who they are and 
how they have made our world a better, stronger place
.
 
Elevate and support transgender and nonbinary artists
. Listen to the music they have created that makes the world move and feel.
 
Read books by trans, nonbinary, and gender expansive authors. 
Here is a list
 
to get you started!
 
Resources to Ensure You’re Building Workspaces Rich in Inclusion and Belonging
Celebrating Transgender Day of Visibility Year-Round
Experiences of The Lavender Ceiling: Progress and Continued Challenges Facing out LGBTQ+ Leaders at Work
Global Toolkit for Change: Assessing LGBTQI+ Inclusion in Your Workplace
Your Story. Your Truth. Your Power
What’s Your Pronoun? Strategies for Inclusion in the Workplace
Examining Transgender and Nonbinary Inclusion: Content Worth Revisiting from the 2023 Out & Equal Workplace Summit
Trans and Nonbinary Leaders Visibility at Last, Challenges and Opportunities Ahead
Globalizing Trans Inclusion
Fostering Allyship with the Trans and Nonbinary Community in Latin America
Uncovering Culture: Are Your LGBTQ+ Employees Hiding Who They Really Are?
 
 
 
Convening for Impact: Plan Ahead with Out & Equal!
Out & Equal has a rich history of convening with measurable and lasting impact. From our annual signature events such as Workplace Summit and Leadership Forum, to our Global Forums and regional convenings, our gatherings have always been, and continue to be, designed to bring together renowned thought leaders, key workplace stakeholders, and influencers to solve the most pressing issues facing LGBTQI+ workplace inclusion.
We are thrilled to be offering multiple in-person, Partner-exclusive gatherings around the world in the coming weeks in Latin America (LATAM), the American South, and Asia-Pacific (APAC).
These events will bring together executives, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, & Belonging (DEIB) and HR practitioners, Employee Resource Group (ERG) leaders, workplace inclusion change-makers, and other influencers to partake in trailblazing discussions and workshops, peer-to-peer education on innovative best practices, and networking with leaders from across each region.
Together, in these spaces, we will continue working towards creating workplaces and workplace cultures where LGBTQI+ employees and allies belong, thrive, and contribute to greater impact—in the workplace and beyond.
Learn more about each of our upcoming, Partner-exclusive events below
 
May 9, 2024
﻿ 
Registration is now open!
 
June 6, 2024
﻿
 
Registration opens on Tuesday, April 2nd
 
July 16, 2024
Registration opens in April
 
 
 
 
Welcome to Our New Partners! 
At Out & Equal, we work with the world's leading and most influential companies—and the inclusive leaders in these organizations—to advance LGBTQ+ representation, equity, inclusion, and belonging in the workplace. 
We’re proud to welcome 
Constellation Brands
,
 Nielsen
, 
NORC
,
 Pitney Bowes
,
 Public Consulting Group
,
 The Nature Conservancy
, and 
Veeam
 as our newest members of the Out & Equal Partner Community. 
 
 
 
Join the Out & Equal Community
 
Becoming an Out & Equal Partner will supercharge your LGBTQ+ workplace inclusion progress. We look forward to having you join us in the movement! Find out how by clicking the link below. 
Partnering in the Business of Belonging™
Learn More
 
 
FOLLOW US

subject: 🎉 Celebrate AAPI Heritage Month 🎉 - Fair360
body:
You don't often get email from noreply-newsletter@fair360.com. 
Learn why this is important
 
QUOTE OF THE DAY
“When we listen and celebrate what is both common and different, we become a wiser, more inclusive and better organization.” 
– Pat Wadors
Today's Topics: 
Meeting in a Box: AAPI Heritage Month 2024
Fairness Focus
Top 50
Most Popular Content
In Case You Missed It
MEETING IN A BOX
 
AAPI Heritage Month 2024
May is Asian American and Pacific Islander Heritage Month (AAPI Heritage Month). It celebrates the strength, tenacity, resilience and contributions of Asian Americans. AAPI individuals are diverse, with different backgrounds, sexual orientations, identities and abilities. This month, we aim to celebrate all of them.
 
This Meeting in a Box is designed to serve as a valuable tool to continue your employees’ cultural competence education, open conversations about race and ethnicity and spotlight the accomplishments of the AAPI community.
Read Full Article
 
FAIRNESS FOCUS
 
 March 10 marks the first day of Ramadan, a month-long observance central to the Islamic faith and celebrated by 1.8 billion Muslims worldwide, 3.5 million of whom live in the United States. During the ninth month of the Islamic lunar calendar, many practicing Muslims engage in daily fasting, beginning at sunrise and ending with a celebratory meal at sundown.
 
Organizational leaders should be conscious of the physical, mental and emotional demands of the month of fasting and introspection on Muslim employees and prepare accommodations to meet employee needs. Flexible work schedules, cultural awareness training and onsite quiet rooms can help Muslim employees feel included at work without infringing on their ability to celebrate Ramadan.
 
FAIR360 FACTS:
  
30% of Top 10 companies have religious or interfaith Employee Resource Groups
 
90% Top 10 Companies offer religious understanding programs to employees
 
All Top 10 companies have committed to systemic efforts to promote cross-cultural competence
 
RELATED FAIR360 CONTENT:
 
Key Strategies for Accommodating Employees During Ramadan
 
How to Educate Teams on Different Religions and Cultures
  
 
Arab American Heritage Month: Celebrating Contributions, Addressing Challenges and Advancing Equity
TOP 50
 
Fair360's Annual Top 50 Event
As public perception shifts regarding DEI and ESG initiatives, the value of such efforts must be communicated in the language of business. Demonstrating the operational success of workplace diversity will ensure DEI's continued relevance well into the future.
The theme of this year's Top 50 event, held at The Glasshouse in New York, NY on May 13, will focus on making the business case for workplace fairness. Keep up with the latest updates on our "Events" page.
View Event Details
 
MOST POPULAR CONTENT
Corporate DEI Initiatives Don’t Discriminate Against White Men
The Keys to Allyship: How Organizations Can Cultivate a Workforce of Allies
How Leaders Can Drive Employee Engagement and Retention
IN CASE YOU MISSED IT
 
Supporting Workers with ADHD in the Workplace
Approximately 15% to 20% of the world’s population is neurodivergent. ADHD, dyslexia or autism spectrum disorder (ASD) are examples of neurodivergent conditions. Despite the prevalence of such conditions, support in the workplace is often lacking. According to experts, education and awareness are among the best practices companies can implement to create an inclusive culture for neurodiverse workers.
Read Full Article

Nominations are Now Open for the 2024 Best Firms to Work For
This is the consulting industry’s largest and most in-depth survey assessing the profession's best working environments based on employee satisfaction.
For 23 years Consulting Magazine has presented The Best Firms to Work For, rankings, showcasing those companies whose policies and practices support their investment and commitment to keep their employees happy, engaged and professionally fulfilled.
The survey ranks employee satisfaction in the following categories:
Culture
Career Development
Client Engagement
Compensation & Benefits
Firm Leadership
Rankings are then separated into two groups: small firms, consisting of between 20 and 250 billable consultants; and large firms, consisting of 251 or more billable consultants. Rankings are based on responses to survey questions taken by a firm's consultants.

A Transformative, Skills-Based Approach to Talent Management
TODAY
VIRTUAL • INTERACTIVE • NO COST
You can still join us for today’s event!
Talent Management’s Breakfast Club event, A Transformative, Skills-Based Approach to Talent Management, is today!
Talent management is on a transformative journey to align with the demands of the 21st century workplace. Identifying, acquiring, developing and retaining talent based on skills assessments and real-world competencies, as opposed to focusing solely on traditional job titles and qualifications, is a crucial element of this contemporary paradigm shift. Join Talent Management for this event focused on moving toward a skills-based talent management approach, including how to leverage data-driven approaches to track and measure skill development, optimize team dynamics and create an agile organization poised for success in a fast-changing business landscape. Our panel of talent professionals will discuss how they are modernizing their talent management strategies and driving organizational excellence by harnessing the power of skills and abilities in their workforces.

subject: Uncover Tool for Improving Employee Retention and Engagement! - Fair360
body:
You don't often get email from noreply-newsletter@fair360.com. 
Learn why this is important
 
QUOTE OF THE DAY
“Wisdom stems from personal accountability. We all make mistakes; own them ... learn from them. Don’t throw away the lesson by blaming others.” 
– Steve Maraboli
Today's Topics: 
How Leaders Can Drive Employee Engagement and Retention
Fairness Focus
Top 50 Survey
Webinar Recap
Most Popular Content
In Case You Missed It
 
LEADERSHIP ACCOUNTABILITY
 
How Leaders Can Drive Employee Engagement and Retention
In 2021, the volume of talent leaving the workforce voluntarily rose to such a level that it became known as the Great Resignation. In conversations about how to drive employee engagement and retention, high-level leaders often overlook their role in talent management. There is seldom discussion about how boards and C-suite leaders can support talent’s desire to stay with an organization.
Read Full Article
 
FAIRNESS FOCUS
 
March is Women's History Month, an extension of Women's History Week, originally conceived in 1982 as a weeklong celebration of the achievements of women and their contributions to American society. Five years later, in 1987, the National Women's History Project petitioned Congress to designate an entire month rather than a single week to commemorate women's accomplishments. The legislators obliged, passing Pub. L. 100-9 and officially declaring March as Women's History Month.
 
Although many organizations have taken strides toward gender parity in the decades since the resolution, there is still work to be done. Many industries, like construction, finance and STEM fields, still suffer from gender inequality. Organizations should make conscious efforts to combat gendered bias in the workplace and create advancement opportunities for women to continue making progress toward full gender inclusion.
 
FAIR360 FACTS:
  
44% of the total workforce at Top 10 companies is made up of women
 
39% of senior managers at Top 10 companies are women
 
90% of Top 10 companies have committed to achieving gender parity in management by a target date
 
RELATED FAIR360 CONTENT:
 
Women’s History Month 2024: Inspiring the Next Generation
 
How the Broken Career Ladder Holds Back Women in Leadership
  
 
Empowering Women of Color in the Workplace: Strategies for Success
TOP 50 SURVEY
 
Why Top 50?
 
Workforce demographics are changing, impacting how companies attract and retain talent. Since 2001, Fair360, formerly DiversityInc, has provided companies with human capital data to manage and understand that change with the 
Top 50 Companies Survey
.
Every company that completes a Top 50 submission receives a free report card. The report card assesses companies' performance versus all competitors in six areas, including leadership accountability and talent programs. 
 
To be considered for a spot on the Top 50 Companies list, complete the survey by 
March 1, 2024
. Click on the link below to learn more about participating.
Take the Survey

Watch the Recap

subject: ⏰ Final Call: Ticket Prices Go Up Tomorrow - Secure Your Spot Now
body:
You don't often get email from updates@transform.us. 
Learn why this is important
Connect with Amazon, Pepsi, SKIMS, and more. From Queen Cora's performance to the big winner reveals, join us on March 12th for the Transform Awards Celebration, exclusive keynotes, and the last chance to save before prices go up tomorrow, Friday, Feb 23!
 
Hi, Hannah!
 
Transform 2024 is just around the corner on March 11-13, and we couldn't be more excited about the incredible opportunity to meet in person! Imagine being part of an event where every moment is a chance to grow, every conversation could spark a brilliant idea, and every connection could lead to a lasting partnership. This is your chance to save $900 off the onsite price with your Insider-only savings, 
register now
 to save before tomorrow, Friday, February 23rd.
 
Keynote | Plenary Stage
When Brittany Pietsch, a former Cloudflare employee, shared her termination video publicly, it ignited widespread discussions on employer transparency and practices. Employees and employers are bound by an unwritten "contract" of trust and expectations, evolving over decades. Today, with multiple generations in the workforce, this contract is more nuanced than ever. Join this engaging conversation as we explore these dynamics, offering insights on how to find common ground in this evolving employer-employee relationship.
 
Get ready for innovation to take center stage at our Transform Awards Community Celebration! We'll celebrate the groundbreaking companies and visionary leaders who are setting new standards, pushing boundaries, and redefining what's possible. 
 
But that's not all – Transform is honored to welcome special guest 
Queen Cora Coleman
! She's an international, award-winning drummer, producer, DJ, author, speaker, philanthropist, visual artist, and entrepreneur who was with Prince for five 1/2 years, three years as band leader and drummer with Beyoncé, plus she was the only one to drum two of the top five highest-viewed Super Bowl Half Time Shows with both. You won't believe what we have waiting for you!
You're in Good Company
Transform stands out by bringing together an inspiring ecosystem of executive-level people leaders, entrepreneurs, and investors. We are excited to welcome attendees from 
Albertsons, Amazon, Bain Capital Ventures, Box, Cruise, DocuSign, GE, Goody, One Medical, Microsoft, PepsiCo, Pinterest, Pixar Animation Studios, Poshmark, SKIMS, and Tik Tok.
 
Begin networking with 
these companies 
and many more starting next week! 
 
Thank You to Our Sponsors
 
Transform 2024 would not be possible without the generous support of our sponsoring companies. 
A special thank you to our 
Title Sponsors: Lattice, Modern Health, Sana, Sequoia, Sparrow, and Transcarent. 
View all Sponsors.
 
Register now
 for the Insider-only special price of $1395 and save before 
prices increase tomorrow, Friday, February 23rd. 
Be sure to also
 
reserve your room
 at Wynn Las Vegas at our special rate, before they are gone!
 
Look forward to seeing you in March!
 
Warm wishes,
Samara Jaffe
Co-Founder & General Manager
Transform

subject: 📣 Announcing the 2024 Top 50 Event! 📣 - Fair360
body:
You don't often get email from noreply-newsletter@fair360.com. 
Learn why this is important
 
QUOTE OF THE DAY
“Equality is the soul of liberty; there is, in fact, no liberty without it.” 
– Frances Wright
Today's Topics: 
Fair360's 2024 Top 50 Event
Fairness Focus
Top 50 Survey
Webinar Recap
Most Popular Content
In Case You Missed It
 
TOP 50
 
Announcing Fair360's 2024 Top 50 Event
As public perception shifts regarding DEI and ESG initiatives, the value of such efforts must be communicated in the language of business. Demonstrating the operational success of workplace diversity will ensure DEI's continued relevance well into the future.
 
The theme of this year's Top 50 event, held at The Glasshouse in New York, NY on May 13, will focus on making the business case for workplace fairness. Learn more by reading a letter from our Founder and Chairman, Luke Visconti.
Read Full Announcement
 
FAIRNESS FOCUS
 
In 2007, the United Nations General Assembly officially designated February 20 as the World Day of Social Justice, claiming that "social development and social justice cannot be attained in the absence of peace and security, or in the absence of respect for all human rights and fundamental freedoms." The day serves as a reminder of the continued need for global efforts to support inclusion and equity in all corners of society.
 
Organizations can further social justice in the workplace through fairness practices that advance opportunities for underrepresented talent and promote equal treatment of all employees. They can also support external philanthropic partners and provide employees opportunities to volunteer for their chosen cause, advancing social equality in the company itself and in society at large.
 
FAIR360 FACTS:
  
Top 10 companies donate an average of 2% of gross revenue to philanthropic partners annually
 
100% of Top 10 companies provide employees with time off for volunteering
 
100% of Top 10 companies have committed to addressing equal opportunities for women, ethnic minorities and segmented populations
 
RELATED FAIR360 CONTENT:
 
How the Social Justice Movement Is Showing Up in the Workplace
 
How Top Companies for LGBTQ+ Workers Embrace Equality, Inclusion
  
 
Racial Equity: The Importance for Business and the Economy
TOP 50 SURVEY
 
Why Top 50?
 
Workforce demographics are changing, impacting how companies attract and retain talent. Since 2001, Fair360, formerly DiversityInc, has provided companies with human capital data to manage and understand that change with the 
Top 50 Companies Survey
.
Every company that completes a Top 50 submission receives a free report card. The report card assesses companies' performance versus all competitors in six areas, including leadership accountability and talent programs. 
 
To be considered for a spot on the Top 50 Companies list, complete the survey by March 1, 2024. Click on the link below to learn more about participating.
Take the Survey
 
WEBINAR RECAP
 
The Fair360 Top 50 Survey provides comparative human capital data that companies can use to ensure a fair and inclusive workplace. You can view a recap of our latest survey prep webinar to glean insights into how to efficiently and accurately complete the Top 50 Survey before the March 1st deadline.
Watch the Recap
 
MOST POPULAR CONTENT
Black History Month 2024: Empowering Minds and Elevating Voices
Women’s History Month 2024: Inspiring the Next Generation
Key Strategies for Accommodating Employees During Ramadan
IN CASE YOU MISSED IT
 
Corporate DEI Initiatives Don’t Discriminate Against White Men
Contrary to claims of discrimination, research from Fair360 reveals that corporate DEI initiatives do not disadvantage white men. Through the examination of Fairness Representation Ratios, High Potential Fairness Ratios and Highest-Paid 10% Fairness Ratios, this article provides evidence that white men experience more fairness in the workplace than men of color and women. This research underscores the importance of evidence-based discourse in shaping equitable workplace practices and fostering inclusive environments.
Read Full Article

subject: Counting Down: Join Execs From Lattice, Menlo Ventures, HSBC, and More...
body:
You don't often get email from updates@transform.us. 
Learn why this is important
CPO-CEO Partnerships Demystified, Office Hours with Menlo Ventures, Workday Ventures, M13, and more, plus Price increase on Friday, Feb. 23rd.
 
Hi, Hannah!
 
As we approach Transform 2024 on March 11-13, the value of coming together in person to share, learn, and connect has never been clearer. You will experience transformative moments, engage in meaningful conversations, reconnect and build new relationships, and gain insights that will redefine your perspective and approach to the now and next of work. 
Prices increase next Friday, February 23,
 don't wait to 
purchase your ticket and save 
with the Insider-only special price of $1395. 
 
Tuesday, March 12th | Plenary Stage
If you're a Chief People Officer looking to strengthen your partnership with your CEO, you're not alone. Only 27% of people leaders think they have a good connection with their CEO. Join 
Lattice's CEO, Sarah Franklin, and CPO, Cara Brennan Allamano, 
as they
 share their secrets behind their successful partnership and offer practical advice on building a bond of trust that not only enhances your strategic position within the C-suite but also drives superior business results. 
 
Are you a Founder looking to get face time with some of today's top VCs? Stop by to connect with a curated group of investors at Transform 2024 Office Hours. No appointment is necessary. Just find the investor you want to meet and visit their “office”. 
J.P. Sanday, 
Menlo Ventures
Matt Hoffman, 
M13
Jason Corsello, 
Acadian Ventures
Eugene Lee, 
OMERS Ventures
Virginie Raphael, 
FullCircle
Rilwan Meeran, 
American Student Assistance (ASA)
Barbry McGann, 
Workday Ventures
Justin Wexler, 
WndrCo
Nicholas Shapiro, 
UPMC Enterprises
Raquel Scott, 
SemperVirens Venture Capital
And more!
 
Tuesday, March 12th  | Plenary Stage
Hear this remarkable true story of opposites – a cowboy and a banker – whose unlikely partnership not only shaped their paths but also left an indelible mark on their community. Discover the magic that unfolds when wisdom meets curiosity, and experience firsthand the profound influence of mentorship in unlocking hidden potential and igniting a passion for lifelong learning.
 
Thank You to Our Sponsors
 
Transform 2024 would not be possible without the generous support of our sponsoring companies. 
A special thank you to our 
Title Sponsors: Lattice, Modern Health, Sana, Sequoia, and Sparrow. 
View all Sponsors.
 
Register now
 for the Insider-only special price of $1395 and save before 
prices increase next Friday, February 23rd. 
Be sure to also
 
reserve your room
 at Wynn Las Vegas at our special rate, before they are gone!
 
Look forward to seeing you in March!
 
Warm wishes,
Samara Jaffe
Co-Founder & General Manager
Transform
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Transform Media LLC, 1850 Gateway Drive, Suite 700, San Mateo, CA 94404

subject: Closing soon. Your input is important!
body:
You can complete the 2023 State of Learning & Development survey by clicking the “START NOW” button below.
 
Dear Ashton,
 
The State of Learning and Development Survey will be closing soon and input from all organizations (publicly-held, privately-held, non-profit, education, government – small to large) is needed to tell the full story and benefit the most recipients. Your contribution is an important part.
 
You can complete the 2023 State of Learning & Development Survey by clicking the “
START NOW
”
 button below.
 
In its sixteenth year - the annual report has helped readers track where learning and development: has been; is now; and forecasts how it will contribute to growing an organization.
 
Protections and Benefits
All responses are held anonymous and confidential and will not be shared with any third parties.
Responders receive the 2023 State of Learning & Development Research Brief containing top-line results of key trends and learning.
Responders receive an Amazon gift card.
Responders are eligible to receive the full 2023 report at a 50% savings.
Completing the survey doesn’t take long and may be the most beneficial thing you can do for your organization so far this year. Click and 
complete your survey today.
START NOW

subject: Become a Virtual Judge for the 2024 Illinois Student Invention Convention
body:
You don't often get email from nicole@chicagoinnovation.ccsend.com. 
Learn why this is important
 
 
 
 
 
Become a Virtual J﻿udge
 
SIGN-UP
 
Provide feedback and encouragement to the 
top 150 K-8th grade student inventors in Illinois
 
﻿by serving as a 
Virtual Judge
 for the 
﻿2024 Illinois Student Invention Convention!
 
Details
Review and score 3-8 student invention projects asynchronously between 
March 29th-April 5th
.
 
Have the option to meet with students online to ask questions & share feedback on 
Saturday, April 6th 
from
 10am-12pm.
 
 
Sign-up to Judge!
 
A 
brief training video
 and further instructions will be sent to all judges in 
mid March.
If you are a ISIC Mentor & already opted into judging, you do NOT need to sign-up again. 
 
 
 
"
As a judge,I was honored to take part in the growth and development of amazing young people in Illinois. 
Their ideas, creativity, and thoughtful presentations helped fuel my own inner child.
 We should all stay curious and lean into innovation. I hope my feedback and encouragement added to the excitement for these students and I can't wait to return!
" 
~Former Judge
HELP US PICK THIS YEAR'S WINNERS!
 
 
Know someone who may be interested?
Forward them this email and invite them to join you as a judge!
Questions? 
Please reach out to 
nicole@chicagoinnovation.com
 or reply to this email.
 
THANK YOU TO OUR SPONSORS:
 
 
Chicago Innovation
 | 
2001 N Halsted
,

, 
Chicago, IL 60614

subject: Recognizing and Harnessing the Power of Intersectionality
body:
You don't often get email from hello@outandequal.org. 
Learn why this is important
Out & Equal’s February 2024 Newsletter
 
 
 
A MOVEMENT IS NOT A MONOLITH: 
Recognizing and Harnessing the Power of Intersectionality 
February is Black History Month—an annual recognition of the legacy, sacrifices, contributions, and achievements of Black people, which span and influence all aspects of our society, including our workplaces and workplace cultures. 
And as we honor and celebrate Black History—a history that includes Black, Queer people—we must understand the importance of introspection.
 It's critical we recognize the unique, and near insurmountable, challenges faced by Black, Queer people in the workplace and beyond. 
Challenges like the systemic barriers that can block opportunity and equal justice. Challenges to being safe in one’s own community.
We have lost too many Black, Queer people to ignorance, intolerance, and hate. It’s not just a loss to our community and movement, but to the world. 
And despite the challenges, the risks, and the loss, trailblazers, icons, and everyday individuals have pushed forward to advance causes, communities, and movements. They have done this in the face of adversities that other people have not, do not, and will not face.  
It’s a reminder of the immense resilience of this community, and that of our allies. Organizations cannot and must not overlook the Black, Queer community. They have shaped societies and culture as we know it, and their contributions will only continue to drive meaningful change that help organizations, communities, and society thrive.  
Organizations and individuals all have a role to play. It’s why in this edition of our newsletter, we’ll be providing actionable, solution-oriented advice to those asking, what can I do?  
At Out & Equal, we’re committed to advancing the community and achieving our mission by understanding the experiences of all of the communities that make up our movement.  
Our society is becoming more diverse. It is the nature of the world as it is and will continue to be. I am committed to being a continuous learner and active listener. I am dedicated to leading a team of continuous learners and active listeners. I am committed to being an authentic and intentional ally. I am on a forever journey and am inspired knowing you all are with me.  
I look forward to continuing to work with our Partner community and our Board, which includes our newly-elected Board Chair, Allyn L. Shaw (he/him), in advancing those ideals and priorities.  
As CEO, that is my responsibility and my commitment to leveraging my sphere of influence to drive real, lasting change. 
 
Erin Uritus (she/her)
CEO of Out & Equal 
 
 
The Way Forward Is Through Introspection and Intentional, Inclusive Action
Organizations can do their part by implementing processes, policies, and programs that advance key pillars of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI), but without creating the cultural conditions and behavioral norms to truly advance belonging for all, we will consistently fail to reap the full benefits that DEIB promises and continuously leave behind those communities that have been historically marginalized, underserved, and overlooked. 
While this is not an exhaustive list, here are a few actions that individuals can take to drive change within themselves and their organizations.  
Recognize 
your own biases
—unconscious or other.
Everyone has biases. We must be curious about what motivates our behaviors. In addition to self-reflection, we should actively seek out and listen to feedback we receive from others about how our behavior impacts them. We must take the time to reflect on what we learn and work to address those biases we may discover.
Acknowledge that in most organizations, meritocracy is a myth.
Claims of it are great, but we know that not everyone in the workplace has the same experience. 
People of color face a unique set of challenges and barriers
 that can prevent career advancement, pay equity, and the opportunity to be in a space that allows them to contribute fully in the workplace, belong, and thrive. Recognizing and acknowledging those systemic workplace barriers is essential and is the first step toward eradicating them.
Hold yourself accountable and do the work to become an inclusive leader.
Allyship must go beyond the performative, and silence/inactivity is complicit in maintaining an inequitable status quo. It requires a journey of self-discovery, seeking out knowledge, and doing your research.  
For example, ask if your organization offers LGBTQ+ inclusive leadership training or manages LGBTQ+ Employee Resource Groups.
 If they do, be active in those discussions and sessions, and be sure to share your learnings and insights with your team, colleagues, and managers. If not, advocate for them by highlighting the value leading with inclusion and belonging brings to an organization.
 
And if you’re asking, “is my workplace an inclusive one?,” leverage resources like Out & Equal’s 
Global Toolkit for Change
 to find out!
 
 
Examining Inclusion & Intersectionality 
Ensuring the success of our larger movement, requires raising up historically overlooked and marginalized voices.  
To learn more about intersectionality in the workplace, check out the content and videos within the featured sessions highlighted in Out & Equal’s, “
Practitioners for Change: Intersectionality Learning Series Resources
.” 
 
Watch Related Content from Out & Equal's Workplace Summit through the years:
Intentionally Intersectional
, 
2023
 
Creating Belonging Wherever You Are
, 
2023
 
A Conversation With... American Actor and Singer, Tituss Burgess, and Theresita Richard, Chief People and Culture Officer, Patagonia
,
 
2022
 
The Moment We're In: A Dialogue between Jane Coaston, host of "The Argument" from the New York Times, and Pri Bertucci, CEO of [Diversity BBox]
,
 
2021
 
 
 
Elevating Black, Queer Voices of the Movement
We find ourselves in a moment where individuals and institutions are actively erasing the contributions of the Black, Queer community from the history books. One of the most impactful ways we can all combat that is to elevate and support Black, Queer voices, artists, business owners, stories, and people. 
From the trailblazers and icons like Marsha P. Johnson, James Baldwin, Bessie Smith, and Bayard Rustin, to the everyday individuals displaying acts of courage, this community has done so much to advance the cause of equity and equality for all.  
This month and beyond, we encourage you to: 
 
Learn
 about those who have set the path for so many, and don’t let their stories be forgotten.  
 
Read more books by Black, Queer authors. Here are two lists to get you started. 
Must-Read Books by Black, Queer Authors
25 Black, Queer Books to Honor Protests and Pride Month
 
Listen to music
 by people of color from the LGBTQ+ community.  
 
 
 
Getting to Know Our New Board Chair
As we celebrate Black History Month, discuss the importance and power of intersectionality, and have meaningful conversations on the value of leading with inclusion and belonging, we connected with Allyn L. Shaw, our new Board Chair, and he shared his thoughts on inclusive leadership, intentional allyship, the value of belonging, and his vision for Out & Equal.  
Read More
 
 
Introducing Our New Executive Committee
 
VICE CHAIR OF THE BOARD
Rolddy Leyva 
(he/him)
Splunk
 
SECRETARY OF THE BOARD
﻿
Jennifer Henderson 
(she/her)
TD Bank Group
 
 
TREASURER OF THE BOARD
﻿
Jose “Pepe” Estrada 
(he/him)
Walmart
 
BOARD NOMINATION & GOVERNANCE CHAIR
﻿
Rustin Richburg
(he/him)
L.E.K. Consulting
 
 
Out & Equal Across the Globe 
Across the globe, Out & Equal is committed to advancing “The Business of Belonging”—LGBTQ+ inclusive programs, policies, and cultures rich with inclusive leadership at all levels. It’s both the right thing to do and smart business practice. 
Advancing LGBTQI+ Workplace Inclusion in APAC
Recently, the Out & Equal team traveled to the Philippines and Japan—where with local organizations and our Partners at JPMorgan Chase and Dow—we led and engaged in important discussions on the LGBTQ+ workplace experience, the value of belonging and inclusion, and the challenges and opportunities facing DEIB practitioners. 
So, how can we advance LGBTQI+ workplace inclusion in APAC and beyond? Deena Fidas (she/her), Managing Director and Chief Program and Partnerships Officer at Out & Equal, shares her insights here.
Read the Blog Recap
 
Resource: India’s Marriage Equality Loss and Its Impact on the Business Community
Following India’s five-judge Constitution bench ruling in a 3-2 decision against marriage equality, Out & Equal, in partnership with 
Pride Circle
, developed a report outlining how businesses can continue to play an integral role in advancing LGBTQI+ inclusion in India and throughout the region.  
Read the Report
 
 
 
Become a more LGBTQ+ Inclusive Change Agent by Attending Out & Equal’s 2024 Leadership Forum, a Partner-exclusive event!
﻿
Over the past 15 years, Out & Equal has convened more than 3,000 executives, ascending leaders, practitioners, and allies through a one-of-a-kind, Partner-exclusive gathering to engage in networking and learning opportunities.
In a moment when the LGBTQ+ community needs, deserves, and demands progress in measurable and lasting ways, we are elevating our agenda and refining our program tracks to engage and empower change agents at all levels and drive LGBTQ+ equity forward.
It is why Executive Forum has been fully reimagined for 2024 as Leadership Forum. 
Registration closes on Friday, March 1. 
Learn More
 
 
 
Welcome to Our New Partners! 
At Out & Equal, we work with the world's leading and most influential companies—and the 
inclusive leaders these organizations—to advance LGBTQ+ representation, equity, inclusion, and belonging in the workplace. 
We’re proud to welcome Global Payments, Nasdaq, and Reinsurance Group of America Enterprise Services Company (RGA) as our newest members of the Out & Equal Partner Community. 
 
 
 
Join the Out & Equal Community
 
Becoming an Out & Equal Partner will supercharge your LGBTQ+ workplace inclusion progress. We look forward to having you join us in the movement! Find out how by clicking the link below. 
Partnering in the Business of Belonging™
Learn More

"I’m excited and honored to welcome in a new era for our Board of Directors. subject: Cultivate a Workforce of Allies!  - Fair360
body:
You don't often get email from noreply-newsletter@fair360.com. 
Learn why this is important
 
QUOTE OF THE DAY
“Those who are happiest are those who do the most for others.” 
– Booker T. Washington
Today's Topics: 
The Keys to Allyship
This Week in Fairness
Top 50 Survey
Next Webinar - February 7
Most Popular Content
In Case You Missed It
 
ALLYSHIP
 
The Keys to Allyship: How Organizations Can Cultivate a Workforce of Allies
With the reinvigoration of social justice movements over the past several years, allyship has become a central talking point for people within corporate diversity circles and those looking to do more to support their colleagues from oppressed communities.
 
This article defines allyship best practices to help organizations support an inclusive workplace for all people.
Read Full Article
 
THIS WEEK IN FAIRNESS
 
On February 5, 1993, President Bill Clinton signed the Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) into law. The law guaranteed parents the right to take up to 12 weeks of job-protected parental leave to allow new parents to bond with and care for a newborn or adopted child.
 
The FMLA represents both a significant moment in the history of workers' rights and the progress still to be made. The FMLA only guarantees unpaid leave. It is also only available to workers who have been employed for at least 12 months. The complicated nature of the FMLA demonstrates the need for businesses to proactively protect the parental rights of their employees, even when such protections are not required by law.
 
BUREAU OF LABOR STATISTICS FACTS:
  
In 91.2% of families with children under the age of 18, at least one parent is employed.
 
In 69% of families maintained by the mother with children under the age of six, the mother is employed.
 
Of fathers responsible for families with children under six, 86.7% are actively engaged in the workforce.
 
RELATED FAIR360 CONTENT:
 
Why Don’t More Fathers Take Paternity Leave?
 
Beyond Maternity Leave: Prioritizing the Health and Well-being of Pregnant Workers
  
 
Meeting in a Box: Supporting Parents in a Post-COVID World
TOP 50 SURVEY
 
Why Top 50?
 
Workforce demographics are changing, impacting how companies attract and retain talent. Since 2001, Fair360, formerly DiversityInc, has provided companies with human capital data to manage and understand that change with the 
Top 50 Companies Survey
.
Every company that completes a Top 50 submission receives a free report card. The report card assesses companies' performance versus all competitors in six areas, including leadership accountability and talent programs. 
 
To be considered for a spot on the Top 50 Companies list, complete the survey by March 1, 2024. Click on the link below to learn more about participating.
Take the Survey
 
UPCOMING WEBINAR
 
The Fair360 Top 50 Survey provides comparative human capital data that companies can use to ensure a fair and inclusive workplace. This webinar will offer tips for filling out the survey and will explain changes to the survey for 2024.
 
Register at the link below!
Register
 
MOST POPULAR CONTENT
Black History Month 2024: Empowering Minds and Elevating Voices
Corporate DEI Initiatives Don’t Discriminate Against White Men
Keys to Successful ERG Structure, Retention and Recruitment
IN CASE YOU MISSED IT
 
Navigating the Transition: How Top Companies Prioritize Veteran Employment
Roughly 200,000 service members transition out of the military each year, with 77% looking for full-time employment. Organizations prioritizing veterans have the unique opportunity to help this group of job seekers navigate the civilian workforce. Fair360’s 2023 Top 50 Companies for Veterans are among the best-in-class in supporting veterans in the workplace

subject: Out & Equal Announces New Board Leadership and Appoints Two New Board Members
body:
You don't often get email from hello@outandequal.org. 
Learn why this is important
 
 
Celebrating a New Era of Leadership for Out & Equal’s Board of Directors 
At the start of 2024, Out & Equal proudly welcomed new members to its distinguished Board of Directors and elected new Executive Committee officers. 
"I’m excited and honored to welcome in a new era for our Board of Directors. As our community and movement face a unique set of challenges, I’m grateful to our Board, their commitment to advancing LGBTQ+ equity and belonging, and the expertise and leadership they bring. Together, with fresh perspectives and energy, we will continue to push forward, drive meaningful change, and show that the future of business is belonging.” 
—Erin Uritus (she/her), CEO of Out & Equal
Collectively, our new Executive Committee officers have proudly served on the Out & Equal Board for several years. They are dynamic, innovative, and forward-thinking leaders who bring expertise and insights that will drive Out & Equal’s impact to even higher heights. 
Please join us in congratulating:
 
CHAIR OF THE BOARD
Allyn L. Shaw 
(he/him)

Wells Fargo

Rolddy Leyva

Walmart
In addition to electing new leadership of our Board, we were also proud to appoint two new members who joined at the start of the year. These respected leaders will bring their unique perspectives and experiences to propel Out & Equal forward. 
 
Please join us in congratulating and welcoming: 
 
Moriaki (Mori) Kida 
(he/him) 
Chairperson and CEO 
﻿
EY Japan
 
 
Dr. Kimberly Myers
(she/her)

Deloitte
And while we welcomed new leadership and faces to our Board, we did say “farewell but not goodbye” to several members as they reached their respective term limits. 
We want to express our deepest gratitude for their tireless efforts, service, and dedication to Out & Equal, our mission, and vision. We are grateful for their stewardship of our organization and commitment to bringing learning and best practices back to their workplaces.

subject: Learn to Overcome Underrepresentation in Leadership  - Fair360
body:
You don't often get email from noreply-newsletter@fair360.com. 
Learn why this is important
 
QUOTE OF THE DAY
“It is not our differences that divide us. It is our inability to recognize, accept and celebrate those differences.” 
– Audre Lorde
Today's Topics: 
Why a Board of Directors May Struggle with Representation
Fairness Focus
Top 50 Survey
Next Webinar - February 7
Most Popular Content
In Case You Missed It
 
LEADERSHIP ACCOUNTABILITY
 
Why a Board of Directors May Struggle with Representation
Although many organizations are making conscious strides to improve workplace fairness, boards of directors still face inequalities in representation. Organizations that want to move the needle on board representation must look beyond the board itself. The barriers to board equity and inclusion begin much further down the management chain. They must also examine their internal processes for promotion and advancement.
Read Full Article
 
FAIRNESS FOCUS
 
February marks Black History Month in America, a time to recognize not only the extraordinary achievements of Black Americans but also to commemorate the history of oppression and the challenges Black Americans still face on the road to inclusion and equality.
 
In 1926, Harvard historian Carter G. Woodson and minister Jesse E. Moorland sponsored what was at the time called "National Negro History Week" to promote research and education in matters of Black history. The second week of February was chosen to align with the birthday of Frederick Douglass. Decades later, after the Civil Rights Movement, President Gerald Ford designated February as Black History Month, and it has been celebrated as such every year since.
 
FAIR360 FACTS:
  
4.6% of the top earners at Top 10 companies are Black employees 
 
Black employees are 10.5% of the overall workforce at Top 10 companies   
 
All Top 10 companies have a formal recruiting relationship with at least one historically black college or university (HBCU)
 
RELATED FAIR360 CONTENT:
 
Black History Month: Empowering Minds and Elevating Voices
 
The Man Behind Black History Month
  
 
By the Numbers: Black Americans and SCOTUS 
TOP 50 SURVEY
 
Why Top 50?
 
Workforce demographics are changing, impacting how companies attract and retain talent. Since 2001, Fair360, formerly DiversityInc, has provided companies with human capital data to manage and understand that change with the 
Top 50 Companies Survey
.
Every company that completes a Top 50 submission receives a free report card. The report card assesses companies' performance versus all competitors in six areas, including leadership accountability and talent programs. 
 
To be considered for a spot on the Top 50 Companies list, complete the survey by March 1, 2024. Click on the link below to learn more about participating.
Take the Survey
 
UPCOMING WEBINAR
 
The Fair360 Top 50 Survey provides comparative human capital data that companies can use to ensure a fair and inclusive workplace. This webinar will offer tips for filling out the survey and will explain changes to the survey for 2024.
 
Register at the link below!
Register
 
MOST POPULAR CONTENT
Meeting in a Box: Women’s History Month: Inspiring the Next Generation
How Companies Can Attract and Retain Underrepresented Groups 
Mentorship: By the Numbers 
IN CASE YOU MISSED IT
 
Driving Fairness in Shifting Times: Strategies for Leadership and Management
Leadership and management effectiveness are critical to navigating changing workplace dynamics. As organizations continue to evolve, leaders are challenged to adapt their approaches, foster inclusive environments and consider demographic shifts in senior management.
Read Full Article

January 24, 2024 |

A Transformative, Skills-Based Approach to Talent Management
Weds, Feb. 28, 2024
VIRTUAL • INTERACTIVE • NO COST
Meet the first panelist for the Feb. 28 Breakfast Club, Amy Tenney Curren, Esq., senior director of attorney learning and development at Morrison Foerster LLP. Join us at “
A Transformative, Skills-Based Approach to Talent Management
” for a discussion on how talent management professionals are modernizing their strategies and driving organizational success through the power of skills and abilities in their workforces.
 
With a background as a former law firm partner, law professor, assistant dean and director of a government training institute, Amy Tenney Curren has extensive experiences in the realm of learning and development. She is an expert in professional learning and accountability, adult learning theory and faculty development and curricular and competency development. subject: Learn How to Help Your CDO Improve Workplace Fairness  - Fair360
body:
You don't often get email from noreply-newsletter@fair360.com. 
Learn why this is important
 
QUOTE OF THE DAY
“Management is about arranging and telling. Leadership is about nurturing and enhancing.”
– Tom Peters
Today's Topics: 
How to Set Your CDO Up for Success
Fairness Focus
Top 50 Survey
Next Webinar - February 7
Most Popular Content
In Case You Missed It
 
LEADERSHIP ACCOUNTABILITY
 
How to Set Your CDO Up for Success
The Chief Diversity Officer (CDO), Chief Equity Officer or Chief Human Resources Officer are executive leaders tasked with overseeing company fairness efforts.
 
Unfortunately, for some companies, the declining prevalence of those positions, the decreased scope of responsibilities, disconnects between the CDO and the rest of the executive team, as well as a lack of essential financial resources can make their roles difficult. 
Read Full Article
 
FAIRNESS FOCUS
 
The National Day of Racial Healing is observed annually on the Tuesday following Martin Luther King Jr. Day in the United States. The observance focuses on fostering understanding and addressing racial divisions, inequity and injustice in our society. 
 
FAIR360 FACTS:
  
100% of Top 10 companies have committed to educating employees on anti-racism 
 
90% of Top 10 companies have committed to achieving a proportional racial representation in management by a specific time frame   
 
2029 is the target year Top 10 companies have set to achieve proportional racial representation in management  
 
RELATED FAIR360 CONTENT:
 
Martin Luther King Jr. and the Labor Movement
 
Colorism: A Barrier to Equity and Inclusion
  
 
Why Tokenism Won’t Solve Your DEI Issues
 
TOP 50 SURVEY
 
Why Top 50?
 
Workforce demographics are changing, impacting how companies attract and retain talent. Since 2001, Fair360, formerly DiversityInc, has provided companies with human capital data to manage and understand that change with the 
Top 50 Companies Survey
.
Every company that completes a Top 50 submission receives a free report card. The report card assesses companies' performance versus all competitors in six areas, including leadership accountability and talent programs. 
 
To be considered for a spot on the Top 50 Companies list, complete the survey by March 1, 2024. Click on the link below to learn more about participating.
Take the Survey
 
UPCOMING WEBINAR
 
The Fair360 Top 50 Survey provides comparative human capital data that companies can use to ensure a fair and inclusive workplace. This webinar will offer tips for filling out the survey and will explain changes to the survey for 2024.
 
Register at the link below!
Register
 
MOST POPULAR CONTENT
Corporate DEI Initiatives Don't Discriminate Against White Men
Black History Month: Empowering Minds and Elevating Voices
2024 Trends in Workplace Fairness
IN CASE YOU MISSED IT
 
Top 50 Companies’ Workplace Fairness Priorities
Every year, as part of the Fair360 Top 50 Companies survey, organizations are invited to share their workplace fairness priorities for the upcoming year. These commitments help shape the direction of future organizational strategies for cultivating better inclusion in the workplace. 
Read Full Article

We appreciate your feedback. Click the image below.

subject: A New Way to Lead: Unveiling the Blueprint for Compassionate Leadership
body:
Discover the keys to fostering an environment where your team not only survives but thrives. 
 
The Modern Leadership Toolkit: Empathy With Accountability
 
In a world marked by unprecedented challenges, the need for compassionate leadership has never been more crucial. Navigating change requires a unique blend of empathy and accountability, and our recent 2023 Breakfast Club event delved deep into the strategies that empower leaders to strike this delicate balance.
 
Discover the keys to fostering an environment where your team not only survives but thrives. Our discussion centered around the indispensable role empathy plays in understanding your team, complemented by the importance of maintaining accountability. By setting clear boundaries, leaders can create a workspace where employees flourish.
 
You can now access the insightful conversation at your convenience. Tune in to the on-demand version of the 2023 Breakfast Club event, "
The Modern Leadership Toolkit: Empathy With Accountability
," and learn how empathy and accountability form the backbone of the modern leadership toolkit.

subject: New Year, New Opportunities for Inclusive Leadership
body:
You don't often get email from hello@outandequal.org. 
Learn why this is important
Out & Equal’s January 2024 Newsletter
 
 
 
The turn of the calendar is always a great time to think through how we can be more intentional and impactful in the work we do, the workplaces and community we build, and the opportunities we create for all individuals to thrive. It's fortuitous that as we enter a new year, we also celebrate 
Mentoring Month
.
﻿
At the start of last year, we highlighted the value of mentorship, coaching, and sponsorship, which included:
Increased potential for advancement for those being mentored, coached, or sponsored, especially those who have been historically overlooked and/or marginalized like women, people of color, and members of the LGBTQ+ community.
New and diverse perspectives for those serving as mentors, coaches, or sponsors.
Individuals bringing their authentic selves to work, feeling invested in the company, working towards their fullest potential, and advancing the company’s mission and impact.
And while what we outlined around intentional, inclusive leadership and the value of mentorship, coaching, sponsorship, and allyship continues to hold true, this is the year these inclusive leadership efforts must be supercharged. In research conducted by Out & Equal, we found that 
only 10% of LGBTQ+ people
 
report that their organizations have an LGBTQ+-specific mentorship program.
Companies, and leaders across all levels in an organization, have an immense opportunity to play an even more active role in developing robust mentorship programs, directed at all talent existing within their organizations and with an intersectional approach in mind.
2023 was a difficult one for the global LGBTQ+ community. For example, in the United States 
more than 500 anti-LGBTQ+ bills
 were introduced, while in Uganda, 
extreme anti-LGBTQ+ legislation became law
. 
And while there were victories in 2023
, we know these challenges will only continue in 2024 and our community cannot go it alone.
Now, more than ever before, we need companies to double down on their commitment to:
creating cultures rich with inclusion,
Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEIB) efforts, and
being intentional, authentic allies.
Not only is it the right thing to do, 
it is smart business too
.
Out & Equal will always remain committed to advancing inclusion and equity for LGBTQ+ people in the workplace and beyond. We will always remain committed to supporting and create change agents within organizations. We will always remain committed to “
The Business of Belonging
.”
This year, we need allies and leaders to do the same.
Let’s move forward, united in a shared belief and reaffirmation that diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging are powerful values and ideals. We should not hide from them or issue apologies for upholding them. But rather, we must continue to embrace them as they strengthen us as individuals and teams, and help us create stronger organizations, communities, and societies.
Erin Uritus (she/her)
CEO, Out & Equal
 
Progress Cannot Pause: Supercharge and Propel Your DEIB Strategy This Year By Leveraging Out & Equal Resources
﻿
As an organization dedicated to creating LGBTQ+ inclusive workplaces and advancing LGBTQ+ equity across societies broadly, we have a wealth of resources to assist you in your journey including:
Reports
 to help better understand the challenges facing LGBTQ+ people in the workplace and the power of being out at work.
 
Comprehensive guides that provide solutions-oriented, actionable steps on important topics like our 
Global Toolkit for Change
.
 
Resources that outline
 how to support individuals in sharing their unique experiences in the workplace while helping to transform organizations into more inclusive environments for all.
 
Our team has and is continuing the work to develop a robust and diverse library of resources right at your fingertips, including:
Bi+ Inclusion at Work
Nonbinary Inclusion in the Workplace
Transgender Visibility
And much more!
Additionally, 
The Global Hub
, which is exclusive to the Out & Equal Partner community, serves as a resource-sharing platform where organizations can exchange best practices and industry insights related to inclusion and belonging in the workplace.
Don't miss out on new and developing opportunities to build a more equitable, inclusive, and innovative workplace in 2024. In addition, Out & Equal Partners have exclusive access to powerful learning workshops with our Learning & Development team. It’s time to solidify your place in the Business of Belonging
™
!
Find about more about our learning & development offerings:
Contact Us Today
 
 
 
Become a more LGBTQ+ Inclusive Change Agent by Attending Out & Equal’s 2024 Leadership Forum, a Partner-exclusive event!
﻿
Over the past 15 years, Out & Equal has convened more than 3,000 executives, ascending leaders, practitioners, and allies through a one-of-a-kind, Partner-exclusive gathering to engage in networking and learning opportunities.
In a moment when the LGBTQ+ community needs, deserves, and demands progress in measurable and lasting ways, we are elevating our agenda and refining our program tracks to engage and empower change agents at all levels and drive LGBTQ+ equity forward.
It is why Executive Forum has been fully reimagined for 2024 as Leadership Forum. 
Registration closes on Friday, March 1. 
Learn More
 
 
 
Welcome to Our New Partners!
At Out & Equal, we work with the world's leading and most influential companies—and the
inclusive leaders these organizations—to advance LGBTQ+ representation, equity, inclusion, and belonging in the workplace.
﻿
We’re proud to welcome 
Alliant Insurance Services
, 
Assurant, Inc.
, 
BASF
, 
Horizon Blue Cross Blue Shield of New Jersey
, and 
Salesforce
 as our newest members of the Out & Equal Partner Community.
 
 
 
Join the Out & Equal Community
 
Becoming an Out & Equal Partner will supercharge your LGBTQ+ workplace inclusion progress. We look forward to having you join us in the movement! Find out how by clicking the link below. 
Partnering in the Business of Belonging™
Learn More
 
 
 
FOLLOW US

 |

3rd Floor
, 
Oakland, CA 94607
