subject: Learn Leadership Strategies that Drive Workplace Fairness  - Fair360
body:
You don't often get email from noreply-newsletter@fair360.com. 
Learn why this is important
 
QUOTE OF THE DAY
“Accountability is the difference between a good leader and a great leader.” 
– D.A. Abrams
Today's Topics: 
Driving Fairness in Shifting Times: Strategies for Leadership and Management
Fairness Focus
Top 50 Survey
Next Webinar - January 10
Most Popular Content
In Case You Missed It
 
LEADERSHIP ACCOUNTABILITY
 
Driving Fairness in Shifting Times: Strategies for Leadership and Management
Leadership and management effectiveness are critical to navigating changing workplace dynamics. As organizations continue to evolve, leaders will be challenged to adapt their approaches, foster inclusive environments and consider demographic shifts in senior management. 
Read Full Article
 
FAIRNESS FOCUS
 
January 11 is International Parity at Work Day. The global day of action promotes equitable treatment for everyone in the workplace, regardless of race, country of origin, gender or sexual orientation.  
 
FAIR360 FACTS: 
 
100% of Top 10 companies have systemic efforts to: 
Detect and correct pay inequity  
Combat unconscious bias  
Promote cross-cultural competence  
Educate employees on anti-racism 
100% of Top 10 companies have made specific commitments to address:  
Equal opportunities for women 
Equal opportunities for ethnically diverse populations  
Increasing opportunities for segmented populations (LGBTQ+, people with disabilities, veterans)  
Health and safety of the general workforce 
 
RELATED FAIR360 CONTENT: 
 
 
Corporate DEI Initiatives Don’t Discriminate Against White Men
 
 
Mastering Equity: Traits of Successful Executive Fairness Committees
 
 
4 Ways Employers Can Support Pay Equity
TOP 50 SURVEY
 
Why Top 50?
 
Workforce demographics are changing, impacting how companies attract and retain talent. Since 2001, Fair360, formerly DiversityInc, has provided companies with human capital data to manage and understand that change with the 
Top 50 Companies Survey
.
Every company that completes a submission receives a free report card. The report card assesses companies' performance versus all competitors in six areas, including leadership accountability and talent programs. 
 
To be considered for a spot on the Top 50 Companies list, complete the survey by March 1, 2024. Click on the link below to learn more about participating.
Take the Survey
 
Register
 
UPCOMING WEBINAR
 
The Fair360 Top 50 Survey provides comparative human capital data that companies can use to ensure a fair and inclusive workplace. This webinar will offer tips for filling out the survey and will explain changes to the survey for 2024.
 
Register at the link below!
MOST POPULAR CONTENT
2024 Trends in Workplace Fairness 
Black History Month: Empowering Minds and Elevating Voices
Inclusive Impressions: A Look Back at 2023
IN CASE YOU MISSED IT
 
Unveiling the Dynamics of High Potentials in Organizations
High-potential employees are team members who consistently perform at a more advanced level and show potential for future leadership roles. These individuals play a pivotal role in shaping the trajectory of organizations. Fair360’s annual Top 50 survey meticulously analyzes how effectively companies identify and nurture high-potential talent. 
Read Full Article

Weren’t able to join our Oct. 26 breakfast club live? You can watch it any time on the 2023 Breakfast Club website on demand!
 
Differentiated Development: Rethinking Inclusion in Learning
 
We often think too small when it comes to our development offerings. We think, as leaders, we are the ones best positioned to choose the people who have the potential to become great leaders. But many of the traditional methodologies used to select leaders are very subjective.
 
In an increasingly diverse environment, leadership looks different depending on who you are, and there are many different styles of leadership, which can be very impactful when tapped into. As we look to develop new methodologies to help identify next leaders and who is in the pipeline for succession planning, we might consider looking to industries outside L&D for inspiration (e.g., open enrollment for health benefits). Ultimately, organizations will benefit from having as many people as possible who are truly invested in developing themselves.
 
Democratization of development is important. How can organizations move away from the concept of one-size-fits-all development and rethink inclusion in learning and talent approaches?
 
You can watch the Oct. 26 breakfast club and every previous event at the link below!

subject: Find Out What Trends Are Shaping Workplaces in 2024! – Fair360
body:
You don't often get email from noreply-newsletter@fair360.com. 
Learn why this is important
 
QUOTE OF THE DAY
“New year is the glittering light to brighten the dream-lined pathway of the future.” 
– Munia Khan
Today's Topics: 
2024 Trends in Workplace Fairness
Fairness Focus
Top 50 Survey
Most Popular Content
In Case You Missed It
 
BEST PRACTICES
 
2024 Trends in Workplace Fairness 
Workplace fairness is an ongoing effort that must be periodically reevaluated. Changes in the workforce, economy and society can affect how a company operates as the needs of its employees evolve.   
 
Fair360 compiled research and spoke with experts to understand some trends shaping workplaces in 2024. 
Read Full Article
 
FAIRNESS FOCUS
 
January is National Mentoring Month, an observance celebrating the power and impact of mentorship. Mentorship month also serves as a reminder of the invaluable guidance, knowledge-sharing and support that mentors provide to mentees, shaping careers, nurturing talent and driving success.  
 
FAIR360 FACTS:  
100% of Top 10 companies offer formal and informal mentoring programs. 
 
80% of Top 10 companies monitor representation and/or test for bias in their mentoring programs.  
 
90% of Top 10 companies’ Level 2, Level 3 and Level 4 management new hires are assigned a mentor/sponsor as part of the onboarding process. 
 
 
RELATED FAIR360 CONTENT: 
 
Making Mentorship Work: The Benefits for Women and Minorities 
 
Meaningful Mentorship: How Intentional Programs Drive Retention and Development 
 
 
Career Advice: Sean Palacio – Getting the Most Out of Mentor/Mentee Relationships 
TOP 50 SURVEY
 
Why Top 50?
 
Workforce demographics are changing, impacting how companies attract and retain talent. Since 2001, Fair360, formerly DiversityInc, has provided companies with human capital data to manage and understand that change with the 
Top 50 Companies survey
.
 
Every company that completes a submission receives a free report card. The report card assesses companies' performance versus all competitors in six areas, including leadership accountability and talent programs. 
 
To be considered for a spot on the Top 50 Companies list, complete the survey by March 1, 2024. Click on the link below to learn more about participating.
Take the Survey
 
MOST POPULAR CONTENT
Meeting in a Box: Black History Month – Empowering Minds and Elevating Voices
Keys to Successful ERG Structure, Retention and Recruitment
Unveiling the Dynamics of High Potentials in Organizations
IN CASE YOU MISSED IT
 
By the Numbers: Black Americans and SCOTUS  
In June 2023, SCOTUS ruled that race-conscious decisions in admissions programs at colleges and universities were unconstitutional. The Brookings Institution said state bans on race-conscious admissions suggest that Black and Hispanic enrollment could drop 10% at selective colleges in the U.S. as a result of the ruling.  
 
Only time will tell the impact of the recent Supreme Court decision on Black college enrollment. In this By the Numbers report, Fair360 examines the history of SCOTUS and its relationship to Black Americans to situate this court ruling in a historical context. 
Read Full Article

subject: ❄️ Happy Holidays - Wishing You a Transformative Season ✨
body:
You don't often get email from updates@transform.us. 
Learn why this is important
See what's trending on the Transform blog, Chip Conley talks about Midlife, must-have Community resources,  and more...
 
Hi, Hannah!
 
For our last newsletter of 2023, we're excited to spotlight new content, community resources, and other key highlights that continue to shape our journey together.
 
We look forward to a transformative new year and gathering in person on March 11-13, 2024 at Wynn Las Vegas. If you haven't already, 
sign up now.
 
 
In this issue, we'll spotlight:
An Upcoming Virtual Conversation on Redefining Midlife
What's Trending on the Blog and 
Community Resources 
Who's Speaking at Transform 2024
And more!
 
Redefining Midlife: From Crisis to Chrysalis. 
In Conversation with Chip Conley
 
Midlife is often misunderstood and labeled as a challenging phase, but this life stage can actually be likened to a chrysalis—a transformative period where profound self-discovery unfolds. Imagine if we were to reframe the natural progression of midlife as a time when we redefine success, grow comfortable in our skin, and feel part of a bigger purpose.
Join us for this special virtual conversation on January 10, 2024, from 2 PM - 3 PM Pacific Time with Chip Conley, in advance of his book release for 
Learning to Love Midlife.
 
Learn why life gets better with age and how to shift your perspective and find joy, purpose, and success in the years ahead.
Save Your Seat

subject: [On Demand] Unconventional Approaches to Leadership Development
body:
You can watch the Oct 26 Breakfast club and every previous event at the link below!
View in browser
 
 
Weren’t able to join our Oct. 26 breakfast club live? You can watch it any time on the 2023 Breakfast Club website on demand!
 
Differentiated Development: Rethinking Inclusion in Learning
 
In our pursuit of identifying future leaders, traditional methods can be limiting. Leadership styles vary, and embracing diversity is crucial. To innovate, we can draw inspiration from unconventional industries. The democratization of development, moving away from one-size-fits-all approaches, is key for inclusive learning and talent strategies.
 
The Experts Weigh-In:
Dr. Adaora Otiji, CPTD, ADC - chief learning officer, DC Department of Health
Suparna Kapoor - deputy general manager, human resources, Hindustan Aeronautics Limited
Raghu Krishnaiah - chief operating officer, University of Phoenix
Tondra Richardson - director of student diversity & inclusion for the Office of Educational Equity, University of Phoenix

subject: DEI Initiatives Do Not Discriminate Against White Men   - Fair360
body:
You don't often get email from noreply-newsletter@fair360.com. 
Learn why this is important
 
QUOTE OF THE DAY
“Change is the end result of all true learning.” 
– Leo Buscaglia
Today's Topics: 
DEI Initiatives Don't Discriminate Against White Men
This Week in Fairness
Top 50 Survey
Next Webinar - December 20
Most Popular Content
In Case You Missed It
 
TALENT
 
Corporate DEI Initiatives Don’t Discriminate Against White Men
Throughout history, marginalized groups have faced discrimination and limited access to equitable opportunities, while white men have occupied positions of power and privilege.
 
Despite this historical advantage, notable legal cases have asserted that DEI initiatives have unfairly impacted white men.
 
Fair360 conducted a deep dive into our data to determine if workplace fairness efforts have adversely affected white men. Our analysis revealed that corporate DEI initiatives do not discriminate against white men. Click below for more insights!
Read Full Article
 
THIS WEEK IN FAIRNESS
 
In 2005, the United Nations (UN) declared December 20 as International Human Solidarity Day. The observance emphasizes the importance of working together to address global challenges and promote the well-being of all people. 
  
The UN says everyone can play a role in making this world a better place:  
 
“To promote human solidarity, it is important to actively engage in your community and get involved in different activities and events. This means helping out and supporting causes that help people who are in need. By doing this, we can bring people from different backgrounds together and help them understand each other better. It’s also important to support local projects that help address homelessness, education, and health. In this way, we show compassion for our community members, making sure every individual is cared for.”   
 
RELATED FAIR360 CONTENT: 
 
Businesses Examine Race, Food Insecurity and Implications for the Workforce 
 
Race, Homelessness and the Role of Corporate Social Responsibility 
 
Unbanked and Unstable: The Financial Dilemma for Low-Income and Communities of Color  
 
TOP 50 SURVEY
 
Why Top 50?
 
Workforce demographics are changing, impacting how companies attract and retain talent. Since 2001, Fair360, formerly DiversityInc, has provided companies with human capital data to manage and understand that change with the 
Top 50 Companies survey
.
 
Every company that completes a submission receives a free report card. The report card assesses companies' performance versus all competitors in six areas, including leadership accountability and talent programs. 
 
To be considered for a spot on the Top 50 Companies list, complete the survey by March 1, 2024. Click on the link below to learn more about participating.
Take the Survey
 
UPCOMING WEBINAR
 
The Fair360 Top 50 Survey provides comparative human capital data that companies can use to ensure a fair and inclusive workplace. This webinar will offer tips for filling out the survey and will explain changes to the survey for 2024.
 
Register at the link below!
Register
 
MOST POPULAR CONTENT
5 December Holidays to Inclusively Celebrate in the Workplace
Navigating DEI’s Challenging Environment and Setting Goals for 2024
Inclusive Impressions – Meeting in a Box: A Look Back at 2023
IN CASE YOU MISSED IT
 
Top 50 Companies’ Workplace Fairness Priorities
Every year, as part of the Fair360 Top 50 Companies survey, organizations are invited to share their workplace fairness priorities for the upcoming year. These commitments help shape the direction of future organizational strategies for cultivating better inclusion in the workplace. 
Read Full Article

subject: Discover the Power of Authenticity at Work!  - Fair360
body:
You don't often get email from noreply-newsletter@fair360.com. 
Learn why this is important
 
QUOTE OF THE DAY
“If everyone is moving forward together, then success takes care of itself.” 
–Henry Ford
Today's Topics: 
Career Advice
Fairness Flashback 
Top 50 Survey
Next Webinar - December 13
Most Popular Content
In Case You Missed It
Upcoming Webinar
CAREER ADVICE
 
Career Advice: Erich Spencer – The Importance of Being Authentic
 
Are you finding it difficult to rise up the leadership ranks?
 
In this week’s installment of our Career Advice video series, Erich Spencer, Senior Director of Global Inclusion Diversity and Equity and Guide Business Partners at Medtronic (
No. 2
 on Fair360 2023 Top 50 Companies for Diversity list) discussed how authenticity can help employees grow as leaders.
 
WATCH
 
FAIRNESS FLASHBACK
 
On Dec. 12, 2015, the Paris Agreement was signed. The international treaty includes pledges from 195 parties to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and work together to adapt to the impacts of climate change.  
 
Companies have aligned their Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) goals to the agreement, which took effect on Nov. 4, 2016. Today, all of the top 100 U.S. companies provide ESG disclosures, according to KPMG (
No. 6
 on the Fair360 2023 Top 50 Companies list). 
 
Fair360 Facts:
  
100% of Top 10 companies annually review their ESG goals 
 
100% of Top 10 companies say ESG is a core management issue  
 
100% of Top 10 companies communicate ESG internally and externally in the company’s purpose and core values  
 
RELATED FAIR360 CONTENT: 
 
 
‘Woke’ Capitalism Backlash: Navigating the ESG Landscape 
 
Building a Narrative to Tell Your ESG Story 
 
ESG: A New Era of Trust, Transparency and Reliability 
TOP 50 SURVEY
 
Why Top 50?
 
Workforce demographics are changing, impacting how companies attract and retain talent. Since 2001, Fair360, formerly DiversityInc, has provided companies with human capital data to manage and understand that change with the 
Top 50 Companies survey
.
 
Every company that completes a submission receives a free report card. The report card assesses companies' performance versus all competitors in six areas, including leadership accountability and talent programs. 
 
To be considered for a spot on the Top 50 Companies list, complete the survey by March 1, 2024. Click on the link below to learn more about participating.
Take the Survey
 
UPCOMING WEBINAR
 
Executive fairness councils are central to driving success in achieving a company's workplace fairness goals. In this webinar, we'll examine data from the Top 50 Companies survey to understand what features define successful fairness councils and how they interact with organizational initiatives.
 
Learn more by registering for the webinar at the link below!
Register
 
MOST POPULAR CONTENT
5 December Holidays to Inclusively Celebrate in the Workplace
Unlocking the Power of ERGs
Inclusive Impressions – Meeting in a Box: A Look Back at 2023
IN CASE YOU MISSED IT
 
How the Broken Career Ladder Holds Back Women in Leadership
Despite near 50/50 representation between men and women in the total workforce at Fair360 Top 50 companies in 2023, women in leadership roles are noticeably underrepresented. Barriers to promotion and a high turnover rate represent a broken career ladder that limits the opportunities for women in leadership. 
Read Full Article
 
UPCOMING WEBINARS
Dec 20, 2023 | 2024 Top 50 Survey Prep
This webinar will provide tips for completing the Top 50 survey and insights into what's new in 2024.

We appreciate your feedback. Click the image below.

subject: Integrate Your Professional Goals and Company Mission - Fair360
body:
QUOTE OF THE DAY
“Cooperation is the thorough conviction that nobody can get there unless everybody gets there.”
–Virginia Burden
Today's Topics: 
Career Advice
This Week in Fairness 
Top 50 Survey
Next Webinar - December 13
Most Popular Content
In Case You Missed It
Upcoming Webinar
CAREER ADVICE
 
Career Advice: Jean Santana: Aligning Goals with a Company’s Mission
 
In this week’s installment of our Career Advice video series, Linda Bell, Head of Content at Fair360, spoke with Jean Santana, Senior Director, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion Strategy & External Reputation Management at Eli Lilly and Company (No. 5 on the Fair360 2023 Top 50 Companies for Diversity list).
 
Santana spoke about how a company's mission can energize workers and help them expand their careers.
WATCH
 
THIS WEEK IN FAIRNESS
 
The International Volunteer Day for Economic and Social Development, or International Volunteer Day (IVD), is held each year on December 5. The observance, mandated by the UN General Assembly, recognizes the contributions of volunteer organizations and volunteers worldwide.   
  
Fair360 Facts:
  
The overall workforce of the Top 50 companies spent 91,979 total hours volunteering.  
 
Ninety-eight percent of Top 50 companies share information with employees on how they can take action on the issues that matter to them. 
  
RELATED FAIR360 CONTENT: 
 
Empowerment Through Engagement: Creating a Path for Employee Volunteerism
  
 
Corporate Philanthropy: Aligning Business Goals With Giving Back 
 
National Volunteer Month: How Companies Can Connect Employees With Volunteer Opportunities
 
TOP 50 SURVEY
 
Why Top 50?
 
Workforce demographics are changing, impacting how companies attract and retain talent. Since 2001, Fair360, formerly DiversityInc, has provided companies with human capital data to manage and understand that change with the 
Top 50 Companies survey
.
 
Every company that completes a submission receives a free report card. The report card assesses companies' performance versus all competitors in six areas, including leadership accountability and talent programs. 
 
To be considered for a spot on the Top 50 Companies list, complete the survey by March 1, 2024. Click on the link below to learn more about participating.
Take the Survey
 
UPCOMING WEBINAR
 
Executive fairness councils are central to driving success in achieving a company's workplace fairness goals. In this webinar, we'll examine data from the Top 50 Companies survey to understand what features define successful fairness councils and how they interact with organizational initiatives.
 
Learn more by registering for the webinar at the link below!
Register
 
MOST POPULAR CONTENT
Meeting in a Box: Exploring Interfaith Inclusion as Part of Company Culture
Keys to Successful ERG Structure, Retention and Recruitment
Tying Executive Compensation to DEI Goals: Putting Money Where Your Mouth Is
IN CASE YOU MISSED IT
 
Navigating the Transition: How Top Companies Prioritize Veteran Employment
Roughly 200,000 service members transition out of the military each year, with 77% looking for full-time employment. Organizations prioritizing veterans have the unique opportunity to help this group of job seekers navigate the civilian workforce.  
Read Full Article
 
UPCOMING WEBINARS
Dec 20, 2023 | 2024 Top 50 Survey Prep
This webinar will provide tips for completing the Top 50 survey and insights into what's new in 2024.
Did you enjoy today's email?
We appreciate your feedback. Click the image below.
You can also email Linda Bell, our Head of Content, at lbell@fair360.com.  
 
Fair360, 3300 S. Dixie Highway, Suite 1-125, West Palm Beach, FL 33405, www.fair360.com

subject: [WATCH NOW]  Rethinking Inclusion in Learning
body:
You can watch the Oct 26 Breakfast club and every previous event at the link below!
View in browser
 
 
Weren’t able to join our Oct. 26 breakfast club live? You can watch it any time on the 2023 Breakfast Club website on demand!
 
Differentiated Development: Rethinking Inclusion in Learning
 
In our pursuit of identifying future leaders, traditional methods can be limiting. Leadership styles vary, and embracing diversity is crucial. To innovate, we can draw inspiration from unconventional industries. The democratization of development, moving away from one-size-fits-all approaches, is key for inclusive learning and talent strategies.
 
The Experts Weigh-In:
Dr. Adaora Otiji, CPTD, ADC - chief learning officer, DC Department of Health
Suparna Kapoor - deputy general manager, human resources, Hindustan Aeronautics Limited
Raghu Krishnaiah - chief operating officer, University of Phoenix
Tondra Richardson - director of student diversity & inclusion for the Office of Educational Equity, University of Phoenix
(Moderator) David DeFilippo, Ed.D. - principal coach and consultant, DeFilippo Leadership Inc.

’s 
Rising Stars Awards 2024
 submission deadline and this is your chance to nominate!
This year’s awards has individual and team & firm categories to showcase the phenomenal achievements of your company and colleagues. Categories include:
Individual Categories
Excellence in Client Service
 
This category highlights the candidate’s dedication to client service through relationship practices, and/or innovation in working with and serving clients of the firm.
Excellence in Leadership
This award showcases the “above-and-beyond” attitude towards leadership including examples of the nominee’s record as a superior leader, administrator, influencer, innovator and mentor among peers, co-workers and clients.
Excellence in Strategy Consulting
This category is for candidates who are innovating the industry through unique concepts, new/revised or rejuvenated operational practices services and products and rescued or completely new constructs brought to bear in the marketplace or office.
Team & Firm Categories
Recruiting and Retention Programs
 
The requirements for acquiring and keeping valuable individuals are becoming more and more complex, and have risen far beyond just pay and traditional benefits. This award is for firms that have created and successfully implemented an outstanding recruiting and retention program.
Mentoring and Enrichment Programs
Personal and professional growth for employees is one of vital importance to prevent a stagnating workforce and dissatisfied or unmotivated workers. This category showcases successful programs that have energized and elevated employee engagement.

Luke Tanen, President and CEO, Chicago Innovation

Founded by Pushkala Subramanian. 
 
 
 
Created Ageism Awareness Day in the U.S., an opportunity to draw attention to the existence and impact of ageism in our society and how we can reframe aging in our communities.

subject: [On Demand] Embracing Inclusive Learning Strategies
body:
You can watch the Oct 26 Breakfast club and every previous event at the link below!
View in browser
 
 
Weren’t able to join our Oct. 26 breakfast club live? You can watch it any time on the 2023 Breakfast Club website on demand!
 
Differentiated Development: Rethinking Inclusion in Learning
 
We often think too small when it comes to our development offerings. We think, as leaders, we are the ones best positioned to choose the people who have the potential to become great leaders. But many of the traditional methodologies used to select leaders are very subjective.
 
In an increasingly diverse environment, leadership looks different depending on who you are, and there are many different styles of leadership, which can be very impactful when tapped into. As we look to develop new methodologies to help identify next leaders and who is in the pipeline for succession planning, we might consider looking to industries outside L&D for inspiration (e.g., open enrollment for health benefits). Ultimately, organizations will benefit from having as many people as possible who are truly invested in developing themselves.
 
Democratization of development is important. How can organizations move away from the concept of one-size-fits-all development and rethink inclusion in learning and talent approaches?
 
The Experts Weigh-In:
Dr. Adaora Otiji, CPTD, ADC - chief learning officer, DC Department of Health
Suparna Kapoor - deputy general manager, human resources, Hindustan Aeronautics Limited
Raghu Krishnaiah - chief operating officer, University of Phoenix
Tondra Richardson - director of student diversity & inclusion for the Office of Educational Equity, University of Phoenix
(Moderator) David DeFilippo, Ed.D. - principal coach and consultant, DeFilippo Leadership Inc.
You can watch the Oct. 26 breakfast club and every previous event at the link below!

FAIRNESS FOCUS
 
National Native American Heritage Day is observed on November 24, the day after Thanksgiving. The observance honors and celebrates the traditions, contributions and achievements of the Native American people. 
 
The cultures, identities and governments of Native Americans were once seen as a threat to the United States. They were pressured to assimilate and forced from their ancestral homelands, causing lasting damage to Native American communities.  
 
Fair360 Fact:
  
Native American/Alaskan Natives make up 0.7% of the workforce of Top 50 Companies

Joining the conversation of our metrics-centric Breakfast Club on Dec. 13 is Gaurish Wagh, Global Talent Management Lead - Credit Suisse AG. 
 
Gaurish Wagh
 is a learning and development professional, an international storyteller, master facilitator and egalitarian with over 23 years of diverse experience in talent management, learning solution design, leadership development, IT and sales. He is an electronics engineer, ex-ISB and a certified Brain Bench Scholar in Linguistics. Gaurish is deeply interested in learning about and introducing new technologies like AI and ML in curating cutting-edge learning ecosystems. He is on a personal mission to enable organizations and educational institutions to build cultural agility and emotional intelligence for a better future. Gaurish has worked with organizations like Accenture, Sodexo and Credit Suisse. He is an avid traveler, voracious reader, writer and loves history, culture, art, music, theater, physics, quantum and interstellar travel. He is a pet parent and a tea connoisseur.

subject: 'Woke' ESG Backlash - How to Navigate the Complex Landscape - Fair360
body:
QUOTE OF THE DAY
“Every individual matters. Every individual has a role to play. Every individual makes a difference.” 
–Jane Goodall
Today's Topics: 
‘Woke’ Capitalism Backlash: Navigating the ESG Landscape
This Week in History 
In Case You Missed It
Most Popular Content 
Top 50 Survey
Upcoming Webinars
ENVIRONMENTAL, SOCIAL AND GOVERNANCE
 
‘Woke’ Capitalism Backlash: Navigating the ESG Landscape
 
Environmental, social and governance (ESG) investing is nothing new. Socially responsible investing has existed for centuries. But the terms used to describe ESG – “woke” capitalism, “woke” ESG and “woke” investing are more recent.
 
The modern ESG concept dates to the mid-2000s. A 
landmark report
 produced in 2005 by the United Nations in cooperation with the financial industry changed everything. The 40+ page document stated that factoring ESG into investments would benefit companies and make good business sense.   
 
Almost 20 years later, ESG is in the crosshairs.  
 
To read the full article, subscribe to Fair360 Enterprise.
Read Full Article
 
THIS WEEK IN FAIRNESS
 
Transgender Awareness Week, celebrated between November 13 – 19, helps increase understanding and awareness about transgender people and the issues the community faces.  
 
The week-long observance takes place before Transgender Day of Remembrance on November 20. The day honors the memory of the transgender people whose lives were lost in acts of anti-transgender violence.  
 
Fair360 Fact:
 100% of the Top 10 and Top 50 companies have resource groups for employees who identify as LGBTQ+ individuals.  
 
RELATED FAIR360 CONTENT:  
 
Webinar Recap: Transitions at Work - How to Support Transgender Employees 
 
How Top Companies for LGBTQ+ Workers Embrace Equality, Inclusion
  
 
Guide to Onboarding and Supporting Transgender Employees
  
IN CASE YOU MISSED IT
 
Research Roundup: Cutting Edge Research on Women of Color in the Workplace
 
At Fair360’s 2023 6th annual Women of Color and Their Allies event, leading academic researchers shared insights on the experiences of women of color at work and how to create environments that enable them to thrive. 
 
The five presentations discussed intersectional invisibility, perceptions of risk versus perceptions of opportunity and action versus inaction for allies of women of color in the workplace. 
Read Full Article

subject: Making the Most of End of Year
body:
Out & Equal’s November 2023 Newsletter
 
 
Making the Most of End of Year
As we near the end of the calendar year, workplaces are buzzing. Many of us are tying up goals, submitting and finalizing budgets, and gearing up for the year to come.
Transition periods like these offer us those important moments to collect, analyze, and understand what we have accomplished, what we have lost, and how we take the triumphs and challenges of the past year into the development of strategies, approaches, and plans of action for the future.
It’s an opportunity to “Collect, Reflect, Innovate, and Act.”
Collect:
 Commit to learning. Seek out new information from diverse perspectives and voices.
 
Reflect: 
Take time to analyze what worked, what did not, and what should be continued in the year ahead.
 
Refine & Innovate:
 Reflection often leads to innovation. While it may be exciting to promote a “fail fast” culture in organizations, we must remember to emphasize the value of learning between activities. That is where the deep learning is and is where
—
through humility and inclusive collaboration—the magic happens. 
Act:
 Awareness is essential, but insufficient without action. Put your enhanced ideas into practice and remember to track performance along the way!
 
At Out & Equal we understand that systems and processes built with inclusion, like the "Collect, Reflect, Innovate, and Act" model above, produce better outcomes. We hope it helps your year-end close out be more inclusive and more innovative as a result. That's the business of Out & Equal. 
That’s the Business of Belonging™! 
 
 
Recognizing Transgender Awareness Month
Let’s celebrate and uplift the transgender community and honor and remember those we have lost.
Despite the false narratives that suggest transgender people don’t or shouldn’t exist, we know that the transgender community has 
always
 been here and has left an indelible mark not only on our community and movement, but on our culture and society at large. Anti-transgender legislation and rhetoric has amplified the narratives and the real, tangible challenges being experienced by transgender people both in and out of the workplace, and have made this a time when active, intentional, and authentic allyship matters more than ever before.
To aid in developing the active ally in all of us, Out & Equal has created 
resources
 to help organizations build more inclusive workspaces and cultures where transgender and nonbinary individuals are valued and are as sought-after as any talent and, can be their authentic selves and thrive.
To our transgender friends, we see you, we are relentlessly here for you, and we would be incomplete as a society without you. Always remember your uniqueness and your power.
We're honored to feature these beautiful and inspiring words from Alok’s "Allow Yourself To Be Beautiful" speech, delivered at our 2023 Workplace Summit.
 
 
 
Final Reflections on the Impact of the 2023 Workplace 
Summit 
In her opening remarks at Workplace Summit, Erin Uritus, Out & Equal CEO, declared, "We are united in strength and fortitude. We are OUT. And we will not rest until we are all EQUAL.”
Summit is, and has been for more than two decades, a transformative experience. It's a convening that informs, energizes, unifies, and galvanizes. It's a place where Queer joy, authenticity, and belonging are recognized, elevated, and celebrated. It is a place for deep reflection and collaboration, and from that, unstoppable innovation.
As we look back at our 2023 Workplace Summit, we are inspired, we are proud, and we are ready to keep pushing forward.
Learn more about the impact of Workplace Summit
 
 
 
 
Out & Equal Releases New Resources and Insights
Necessary Change: Achieving Full LGBTQI+ Workplace Inclusion in Argentina. 
While Argentina has been a notable leader in advancing equal rights and protections for the LGBTQI+ community, laws and policies alone do not guarantee full equity, inclusion, and opportunity. It’s why, in a first-of- its-kind report and survey, Out & Equal, in partnership with Argentina’s LGBTQI+ Chamber of Commerce (CCGLAR), examined the state of LGBTQI+ inclusion in the Argentinian workplace and provided employers a guide to assess their Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging efforts and the practical ways to make concrete change.
Read the Report Here
 
 
Disappointed But Not Defeated: 
Last month, India’s Supreme Court made a decision to not acknowledge marriage equality. While we mourn this missed opportunity to advance equality for the LGBTQI+ community in India, we remain hopeful, resolute, and committed to our mission. 
An article published by 
The New York Times
 titled, “
India’s Top Court Rejects Gay Marriage, While Voicing Sympathy
,” notes some rays of hope within the ruling. They include:
expanding the definition of discrimination to certain fundamental protections for Queer citizens, including the right to access goods and services without prejudice;
legalizing marriage between transgender couples, with the caveat that one partner identifies as male, and the other; and
the establishment of an expert committee that is focused on protecting the rights of India’s LGBTQI+ community.
Learn more about the ruling, what it means, and the road ahead in this blog post penned by Akriti Rana, MPA (she/her), Manager, Global Impact Programs (APAC) at Out & Equal:
Read Akriti's Blog Post Here
 
 
"Hispanic, Latinx, Latine, Latino, or Chicano? When it comes to labeling ourselves, there is no one correct answer."
 Gabriel de la Cruz Soler (he/ él), Senior Manager of Global Impact Programs (LatAm) at Out & Equal and Founder of the NGO Presente (Peru) poignantly takes us step by step through the historical and cultural significance of the language and labeling conversation that impacts so many.
Read Gabriel's Blog Post Here
 
 
 
Representation and Recognition Matter. 
The Washington Business Journal named Erin Uritus, Out & Equal CEO, a 2023 LGBTQ+ Business Award Honoree. Congratulations to our amazing CEO and to all the honorees who are working to advance LGBTQ+ representation, inclusion, and equity in the workplace, and beyond.
See the full list of honorees 
here
.
 
﻿Last month, in celebration of Atlanta Pride, we teamed up with the Atlanta’s Mayor’s Office for an Out & Equal-hosted reception celebrating LGTBQ+ resilience, joy, and love. It was both an honor and inspiration to have 100 members of our Partner community join with allies and friends to kick off Atlanta Pride.
 
 
The rising tide lifts all boats. Our movement can only move forward and success can only be achieved if, as a peer set, we are working in parallel and collaboratively across our focus areas. It’s why leaders and team members from Out & Equal were excited to attend this year’s Human Rights Campaign National Dinner where, this nation’s highest-ranking leaders, President Joe Biden and Dr. Jill Biden, among many others, reaffirmed their support and commitment to the LGBTQ+ community.
 
 
SAVE THE DATE
Out & Equal's Leadership Forum
Monday, March 25
—
Thursday, March 28, 2024
MGM National Harbor, Maryland
 
Join us as Out & Equal’s Executive Forum evolves into Leadership Forum.
Over the past decade, Out & Equal has convened more than 3,000 executives, ascending leaders, practitioners, and allies through this one-of-a-kind, Partner-exclusive gathering.
To learn more about joining the Out & Equal Partner community and this Partner exclusive event, please reach out to 
partnerships@outandequal.org
.

Out Now:
 
Risk-Free Innovation,

We are thrilled to share some exciting news with our community of innovators. Recently, we unveiled a new book that redefines the way we approach innovation, and it's tailor-made for all of you — our 40,000-strong Chicago Innovation family.
🚀 
Introducing "Risk Free Innovation: 10 Ways to Manage Uncertainty"

Authored by renowned innovation experts Tom Kuczmarski and Jake Sherman, this book is more than just a read 
–
 it's your playbook for navigating the uncertain terrain of innovation with confidence.
In today's hyper-paced business world, innovation isn't optional; it's imperative. We've poured 40 years of collective innovation experience into this book, distilling the best-kept secrets into 
a simple, ten-step formula
. Examples of Risk-Reducers include:
Think Strategically, Then Tactically
Rely on Problems, Not Ideas
Build a Balanced Portfolio
Build Failure Into the Financials 
From entrepreneurs to executives, educators to lifelong learners, "Risk Free Innovation" is your playbook to innovating in the face of risk.﻿
Inside, you'll discover:
🌐 The science of innovation, demystified and made accessible
📖 A robust framework to manage uncertainty effectively
💼 Strategies for cultivating an innovative culture
🔗 Real-world case studies and downloadable templates to turn knowledge into action
Risk-Free Innovation is a valuable resource for anyone who wants to learn how to innovate more effectively and manage the risks involved. It is also a must-read for business leaders, entrepreneurs, and students of innovation.

Between remote and in-office workers and an ever-changing world, gauging and measuring the success of your learning programs is more important than ever. Joining Chief Learning Officer’s panel of experts for our Dec. 13 Breakfast Club, 
Metrics Matter… Now More Than Ever
, is Akkshada Maniyan of Innova Solutions. 
 
Akkshada Maniyan
 is the head of global L&OD at Innova Solutions. In her role, Akkshada set up the learning function from the ground up and leads the development, design and execution of learning solutions and programs across all global locations.
 
Akkshada has myriad skills and 18-plus years in the industry, executive coaching certification from Columbia University and global experience working with clients across various in
dustries and companies including Deloitte, Amazon, GlobalFoundries and IBM.
 
Akkshada is a key driver of Innova Solutions’ growth with proven expertise in executive coaching, mentoring and learning development. ​​​​​​​Under her leadership, Innova has developed a robust curriculum focused on learning solutions, talent development and leadership programs along with a set of core behaviors to guide its 50,000 professionals spread across the globe.
​​​​​​
Outside of work, Akkshada is passionate about giving back and has volunteered more than 2,000 hours of pro-bono career coaching to women and girls.

body:
QUOTE OF THE DAY
“As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.” 
–John F. Kennedy
Today's Topics: 
Career Advice

CAREER ADVICE
 
Career Advice: Natasha Miller Williams – Do This to Land Your Next Position
 
In this week’s installment of our Career Advice video series, Linda Bell, Head of Content at Fair360, spoke with Natasha Miller Williams, CEO and Founder of Work Hearter Consulting. Miller Williams, the former Vice President and Head of Diversity and Inclusion at Ferrara, spoke about the crucial action we all should take in the workplace to grow our careers.
WATCH
 
THIS WEEK IN HISTORY
 
On November 11, 1919, Veterans Day originated as “Armistice Day,” the first anniversary of the end of World War I.  
 
Why November 11? The date is significant because the armistice went into effect at the 11th hour of the 11th day of the 11th month, signifying the end of the conflict. 
 
Through an act of Congress, November 11 became a legal holiday in 1938. Sixteen years later, "Armistice" was changed to "Veterans,” and November 11 became a day to honor American veterans of all wars. 
 
Fair360 Fact:
 100% of Hall of Fame Companies have recruiting practices targeting Veterans and members of the military.

subject: Oct. 26 Breakfast Club: Available On-Demand Now!
body:
You can watch the Oct 26 Breakfast club and every previous event at the link below!
View in browser
 
 
Weren’t able to join our Oct. 26 breakfast club live? You can watch it any time on the 2023 Breakfast Club website on demand!
 
Differentiated Development: Rethinking Inclusion in Learning
 
We often think too small when it comes to our development offerings. We think, as leaders, we are the ones best positioned to choose the people who have the potential to become great leaders. But many of the traditional methodologies used to select leaders are very subjective.
 
In an increasingly diverse environment, leadership looks different depending on who you are, and there are many different styles of leadership, which can be very impactful when tapped into. As we look to develop new methodologies to help identify next leaders and who is in the pipeline for succession planning, we might consider looking to industries outside L&D for inspiration (e.g., open enrollment for health benefits). Ultimately, organizations will benefit from having as many people as possible who are truly invested in developing themselves.
 
Democratization of development is important. How can organizations move away from the concept of one-size-fits-all development and rethink inclusion in learning and talent approaches?
 
The Experts Weigh-In:
Dr. Adaora Otiji, CPTD, ADC - chief learning officer, DC Department of Health
Suparna Kapoor - deputy general manager, human resources, Hindustan Aeronautics Limited
Raghu Krishnaiah - chief operating officer, University of Phoenix
Tondra Richardson - director of student diversity & inclusion for the Office of Educational Equity, University of Phoenix
(Moderator) David DeFilippo, Ed.D. - principal coach and consultant, DeFilippo Leadership Inc.

subject: Dec. 13 Breakfast Club - Metrics Matter … Now, More Than Ever
body:
The next edition of Chief Learning Officer’s Breakfast Club series, Metrics Matter … Now, More Than Ever, will be held on Wednesday, Dec. 13.
View in browser
 
 
The next edition of Chief Learning Officer’s Breakfast Club series, 
Metrics Matter … Now, More Than Ever
, will be held on 
Weds
, Dec 13
. Now in its 18th year, BetterWork Media Group’s (BMG) Breakfast Club series continues to strengthen the link between learning and development and business strategy by connecting learning leaders, practitioners and innovators over breakfast.
Metrics Matter … Now, More Than Ever
 
In today’s remote and hybrid workplaces, measuring the effectiveness of your learning strategy and solutions has never been more important. Today’s landscape requires measurement efforts that allow analysis of peak performance, effective delivery modes and what programs are having the biggest impact.
 
Join CLO for this deep dive into how learning measurement strategy can provide key input to leadership decisions on learning and development, and what metrics we should be using to assess the effectiveness of learning strategy and solutions.
Each mini-event lasts about two hours and consists of a 60-minute panel discussion with L&D and talent practitioners, a 20-minute FASTtalk presentation and a 20-minute research segment, garnering real-time data from attendees and prompting discussion of the day’s themes, followed by closing remarks from me, Chief Learning Officer's editor-in-chief.
 
We hope that you can join us.
 
Ashley St. John
Founder, Chief Content Officer & Editor-in-Chief
BetterWork Media Group, parent company of Chief Learning Officer & Talent Management

subject: [On Demand] Mobilizing Talent for the Future
body:
What new strategies and tools are emerging for internal talent mobility and career pathing at this halfway point in 2023? And how are organizations using the ever-maturing talent marketplace to match employees’ existing skills with skills needed for aspirational roles or emerging roles of the future?
View in browser
 
 
Mobilizing Talent for the Future
 
Investing in internal talent mobility has been a growing trend, and the benefits are numerous: Efforts in this area can help organizations attract and retain talent, develop more diverse pipelines, fill open roles and bridge critical skill gaps amid the labor shortage. Autonomous career paths or “tracks,” career and leadership development opportunities and growth initiatives, knowledge, skill and resource sharing are all woven into a comprehensive internal talent mobility strategy.  
What new strategies and tools are emerging for internal talent mobility and career pathing at this halfway point in 2023? And how are organizations using the ever-maturing talent marketplace to match employees’ existing skills with skills needed for aspirational roles or emerging roles of the future?

subject: Nov 15 Breakfast Club: The Modern Leadership Toolkit: Empathy With Accountability
body:
Join us for this conversation on November 15 about how empathy, coupled with accountability, are essential components of the modern leadership toolkit, and how you can strive to develop the ideal balance among your workforce. 
 
Heightened levels of uncertainty, change and stress over the past few years have created the need for a new kind of leader — one who can lead with empathy while maintaining accountability.
Finding a balance between empathy and accountability is critical for creating a work environment where employees can flourish. This involves setting clear boundaries that everyone agrees on, which requires leaders to understand where their employees are coming from (the empathy piece of the puzzle).
Join us for this conversation
 on Nov. 15 about how empathy, coupled with accountability, are essential components of the modern leadership toolkit and how you can strive to develop the ideal balance among your workforce.

subject: The Hidden Power of Coachability in Leadership
body:
Watch 2023 Breakfast Club "Brick by Brick: Building a Coachability Culture" on demand!
View in browser
 
 
Brick by Brick: Building a Coachability Culture
 
Organizational investment in coaching has grown substantially in recent years, with good reason: Businesses need managers who can lead teams through change, stress and economic upheaval. And executive coaching can prepare leaders and leadership teams for transition and growth and help them level up their management skills.
 
However, a growing body of research indicates that focusing on coaching without coachability may prove costly. Highly coachable leaders have been found to foster greater levels of employee engagement and retention, and research shows highly coachable individuals achieve significantly higher levels of performance, agility and promotability.

Brick by Brick: Building a Coachability Culture
" on demand!

On November 2, 1983, President Ronald Reagan designated the third Monday in January as a federal holiday in observance of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

subject: You can still join us for today’s event!
body:
Chief Learning Officer’s next Breakfast Club event, Differentiated Development: Rethinking Inclusion in Learning, takes place today!
View in browser
 
 
You can still join us for today’s event!
 
Chief Learning Officer’s next Breakfast Club event, Differentiated Development: Rethinking Inclusion in Learning, takes place today!
 
We often think too small when it comes to our development offerings. We think, as leaders, we are the ones best positioned to choose the people who have the potential to become great leaders. But many of the traditional methodologies used to select leaders are very subjective. 
 
In an increasingly diverse environment, leadership looks different depending on who you are, and there are many different styles of leadership, which can be very impactful when tapped into. As we look to develop new methodologies to help identify next leaders and who is in the pipeline for succession planning, we might consider looking to industries outside L&D for inspiration (e.g., open enrollment for health benefits).
 
Democratization of development is important. How can organizations move away from the concept of one-size-fits-all development and rethink inclusion in learning and talent approaches?
 
Join the conversation lead by our panel of learning and development experts:
Dr. Adaora Otiji, CPTD, ADC - chief learning officer, DC Department of Health
Suparna Kapoor - deputy general manager, human resources, Hindustan Aeronautics Limited
Raghu Krishnaiah - chief operating officer, University of Phoenix
Tondra Richardson - director of student diversity & inclusion for the Office of Educational Equity, University of Phoenix
Moderator: David DeFilippo, Ed.D. - principal coach and consultant, DeFilippo Leadership Inc.

subject: Meet the Moderator for our Nov 15 Breakfast Club - Kevin Wilde of University of Minnesota
body:
Equip yourself with empathy and accountability at the next Talent Management Breakfast club event on Nov. 15. Kevin Wilde, Leadership Fellow at the University of Minnesota - Carlson School of Management leads the panel as Moderator!
 
Equip yourself with empathy and accountability at the next Talent Management Breakfast club event on Nov. 15. Kevin Wilde, leadership fellow at the University of Minnesota - Carlson School of Management, leads the panel as moderator!
 
Kevin Wilde
 serves as an Executive Leadership Fellow at the Carlson School of Management, University of Minnesota, where he teaches applied leadership in a number of graduate courses. His current research topics include leadership coachability, executive derailment and contemporary talent development. In 2015 he concluded a 34-year corporate career in leadership and talent development at General Electric and General Mills.  
 
During his time at General Mills, the organization was consistently recognized for its innovative development work, highlighted by Fortune’s No. 2 ranking as one of the best companies in the world at leadership development, No. 1 listing by Leadership Excellence magazine, No. 1 Global Learning Elite ranking and Training magazine’s “Hall of Fame” designation as a top company for employee development. In 2007, Chief Learning Officer magazine selected Kevin as CLO of the Year.
 
Register today for our Nov. 15 Breakfast Club event,

!

This year’s awards has new team & firm categories which recognizes firms who are making a profound difference for their employees, clients and future entrants to the profession. Categories include:

In an industry where winning the talent war is paramount to success, the ability to attract and retain the best people has never been so important. This award is for firms that have created and successfully implemented an outstanding recruiting and retention program.

subject: Today Only: Dive into Leadership Development Dos and Don'ts!
body:
42% of emerging leaders report they had inadequate or ineffective professional development prior to their first leadership role. 
 
Dos and Dont's of Leadership Development
Webinar Replay – TODAY, October 24, at 11 a.m CT
 
Forty-two percent of emerging leaders report they had inadequate or ineffective professional development prior to their first leadership role. 
 
In today’s landscape of multigenerational workforces, virtual offices and ever-evolving skills gaps — is your training doing enough to prepare your future leaders?
 
Join Dan Rust, vice president of global leadership and organizational development at InfoPro Learning and Matt Bradley, senior learning and development advisor at OpenSesame for a thought provoking discussion on the importance of providing comprehensive leadership development training and what current programs may be lacking.
 
This webinar will share data collected from five years of global surveys across nearly nine thousand emerging leaders and their direct reports — to give you valuable insights into the training you need and what most leadership development programs are missing.
 
In this webinar, you will learn: 
How to identify current leadership skill gaps.
Common training pitfalls to avoid.
What you need to equip emerging leaders with the necessary skills, knowledge and support to thrive, drive organizational success and employee satisfaction.
Strategies to get the most out of your training program.

subject: Watch our Mini Event Videos Any Time!
body:
Watch the latest Breakfast Clubs, Tapping Into Untapped Talent, AI and Machine Learning in HR: Transforming Talent Management Strategies, or any other past edition and make sure to register and catch our next event live!
 
The latest breakfast club event hosted by Talent Management is now available on the 2023 Breakfast Club website to watch any time, on-demand! 
 
Watch the latest Breakfast Clubs, 
Tapping Into Untapped Talent
, 
AI and Machine Learning in HR: Transforming Talent Management Strategies
, 
or any other past edition and make sure to register and 
catch our next event live!
Tapping Into Untapped Talent
 
2020 research
 from Accenture and Harvard Business School explores the phenomenon of “hidden workers,” or the millions of people who want to work and are actively seeking work, but who remain “hidden” from most businesses that would benefit from hiring them by the very processes those companies use to find talent. The research estimates there are more than 27 million hidden workers in the U.S. alone. They include caregivers, veterans, immigrants and refugees, people with physical disabilities, relocating partners and spouses, those with mental health or developmental/neurodiversity challenges, those from disadvantaged backgrounds or populations, people who were previously incarcerated and those lacking traditional qualifications.
 
As record lows in unemployment and the Great Resignation continue to limit workforce growth, how can organizations connect with this hidden talent, and what needs to change in existing hiring and recruitment practices?
WATCH NOW
 
AI and Machine Learning in HR: Transforming Talent Management Strategies
 
As the use of AI and machine learning becomes more prevalent in the workplace, it’s essential to understand how these new technologies can be leveraged to transform HR practices and support talent management strategies. Join Talent Management for an engaging conversation around the potential impact of AI and machine learning on HR functions such as employee development, employee engagement, career pathing and performance management. Our expert panelists will also explore how these technologies can help talent professionals gain deeper insights into identifying skills gaps within organizations, automating tasks, and ultimately making more informed decisions about their workforce.
WATCH NOW
 
Watch either of the above events on-demand now, or check out any of the
 
other topics
 
– also available at this time.

The Modern Leadership Toolkit: Empathy With Accountability
, is Abisola Ikegwuonu, direct of global talent at Accruent!
 
Abisola Ikegwuonu
 is an inspiring thought leader and strategic thinker with a passion for challenging the ways organizations think about talent management and development. Ikegwuonu prides herself on meeting people where they are, being an open book and being unapologetically authentic – attributes that have served her well in life and as a leader by helping her overcome negativity and succeed in corporate America. She has vast experience serving as a global HR leader and a demonstrated ability to solve problems by finding the intersection between people strategies and business outcomes.
 
Ikegwuonu is the director of global talent at Accruent. In her role, she is responsible for succession planning, learning and leadership development programs, performance management and culture and engagement.

subject: Are Your Leaders Ready for the Future? Find Out in Our Webinar Replay
body:
42% of emerging leaders report they had inadequate or ineffective professional development prior to their first leadership role. 
 
Dos and Dont's of Leadership Development
Webinar Replay – Tuesday, October 24, at 11 a.m CT
 
Forty-two percent of emerging leaders report they had inadequate or ineffective professional development prior to their first leadership role. 
 
In today’s landscape of multigenerational workforces, virtual offices and ever-evolving skills gaps — is your training doing enough to prepare your future leaders?
 
Join Dan Rust, vice president of global leadership and organizational development at InfoPro Learning and Matt Bradley, senior learning and development advisor at OpenSesame for a thought provoking discussion on the importance of providing comprehensive leadership development training and what current programs may be lacking.
 
This webinar will share data collected from five years of global surveys across nearly nine thousand emerging leaders and their direct reports — to give you valuable insights into the training you need and what most leadership development programs are missing.
 
In this webinar, you will learn: 
How to identify current leadership skill gaps.
Common training pitfalls to avoid.
What you need to equip emerging leaders with the necessary skills, knowledge and support to thrive, drive organizational success and employee satisfaction.
Strategies to get the most out of your training program.

body:
Hi Ashton,
Applications are open
 for the 11th cohort of 
Ageless Innovators
, running January – June 2024. The deadline to apply is end of day tomorrow, 
Tuesday, October 17th.
Everyone, no matter their age, has something to teach and something to learn. Ageless Innovators bridges the generations through reciprocal mentoring to share experiences, skills, and knowledge. Everyone in Ageless Innovators is a mentor and a mentee!
Ageless Innovators was co-founded in 2019 by Chicago Innovation and The Village Chicago, with a generous grant from RRF Foundation for Aging. It is Chicago's first intergenerational co-mentoring program.
 
 
 
APPLY TODAY!
 
 
CALLING ALL PEOPLE SEEKING:

Learn from the insights of a different generation
 
PURPOSE: 
Give back and help your co-mentor reach their goals

intimate panels and events with industry leaders on cohort specific topics

subject: Sneak Peek: What's Brewing for Transform 2024 & More
body:
Get an exclusive sneak peek into Transform 2024, spotlighting Compassion 2.0 Summit, Talent Partner Summit, plus prices increase October 20
 
 
Hi, Transform Insider!
 
We want to take a moment to recognize and acknowledge that there is a lot happening in the world around us. We come together as a community to support one another, leading with empathy and compassion. Our thoughts and hearts are with all of you - our friends, colleagues, partners, and families.
______________________________________________________________
 
We're excited to give you a 
sneak peek
 into what awaits you at Transform 2024. Get ready to embark on a journey of innovation, inspiration, and transformation!
 
In this issue, we'll spotlight:
Events happening at Transform
Who's Speaking?
Registration Prices
 increase NEXT WEEK, Friday, October 20!
Come Early and Stay Late
 
Join us early on Monday, March 11th for a lineup of pre-conference workshops and programming, and stay until the unforgettable after-party with Flo Rida on Wednesday, March 13th!
 
At Transform 2024, you can expect nothing short of groundbreaking content, thought-provoking discussions, and visionary insights that will reshape the way we think about the now and next of work. Whether you're a seasoned industry leader or an aspiring innovator, Transform 2024 promises a wealth of opportunities to fuel your curiosity and drive change. 
Here are two extraordinary events happening at Transform 2024: 
 
Talent Partner Summit
In partnership with 
VC Platform
, we are excited to expand our Talent Partner Summit for its 2nd year. This Talent Summit is designed to elevate the venture capital platform profession by connecting global leaders to influence strategy, ignite innovation, and shape the future of work and the venture capital industry at large. This Summit is offered exclusively to Talent and Operating Partners at VC and PE Firms.
 
Compassion 2.0 Summit: "Care is the Basis of Flourishing"
New to Transform
, we have partnered with Compassion 2.0 to explore the relationship between care and flourishing and investigate the Return on Investment frameworks for a Flourishing Culture. We will also review the "Elements of Flourishing." Leading the session will be the renowned 
Ann Rhoades from Jet Blue and Southwest Airlines
. Additionally, we will hear from several featured organizations on how they have implemented one or more of the Elemen
ts of Flourishing.
 This is open to all attendees and is a must-attend event! 
 
Prices Go Up in One Week!
Experience all that Transform 2024 has to offer before prices go up next Friday, October 20! 
We invite you to 
purchase your pass for the discounted price of $995
 which is 
specific to you as a Transform Insider. 
 
Passes are transferable and refundable, so there's 
no risk
 in locking in the special rate now.
Transform 2024: Meet the Speakers
We're excited to announce six incredible people-first leaders who are breaking the barriers within DEI, Community and Culture, People Leadership, and more!
Our speakers come from diverse backgrounds and companies including The Torin Ellis Brand, Menlo Security, PAFOW, Pagaya, Tanium, and WeightWatchers. Check out the entire list of Transform 2024 speakers 
here.
 
Torin Ellis
Principal
The Torin Ellis Brand
 
Kate Terrell
CHRO
Menlo Security
 
Al Adamsen
Founder & CEO
PAFOW
 
Tami Rosen
Chief People Officer
Pagaya
 
Anthony Walter
VP, Human Resources
Tanium
 
Tiffany Stevenson
Chief People Officer
WeightWatchers
Thank You to Our Generous Sponsors! 
Transform 2024 would not be possible without the generous support of our sponsoring companies. 
A special thank you to our 
Title Sponsors: Lattice, Modern Health, Sana Labs, Sequoia, and Sparrow. 
View all Sponsors.
 
If you are interested in sponsoring, please inquire 
here
 
for additional details.
 
Prices increase in one week, Friday, October 20th, so now's your time to
 grab your ticket
 and be part of it all! Lock in your special Insider rate now before it's too late. 
 
Let's continue to stand together, and learn from one another as a united community. 
Warm wishes,
Samara Jaffe
Co-Founder & General Manager
Transform
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Transform Media LLC, 1850 Gateway Drive, Suite 700, San Mateo, CA 94404

subject: Enhance Your Leadership Development Approach: Expert Insights
body:
42% of emerging leaders report they had inadequate or ineffective professional development prior to their first leadership role. 
 
Dos and Dont's of Leadership Development
Webinar Replay – Tuesday, October 24, at 11 a.m CT
 
Forty-two percent of emerging leaders report they had inadequate or ineffective professional development prior to their first leadership role. 
 
In today’s landscape of multigenerational workforces, virtual offices and ever-evolving skills gaps — is your training doing enough to prepare your future leaders?
 
Join Dan Rust, vice president of global leadership and organizational development at InfoPro Learning and Matt Bradley, senior learning and development advisor at OpenSesame for a thought provoking discussion on the importance of providing comprehensive leadership development training and what current programs may be lacking.
 
This webinar will share data collected from five years of global surveys across nearly nine thousand emerging leaders and their direct reports — to give you valuable insights into the training you need and what most leadership development programs are missing.
 
In this webinar, you will learn: 
How to identify current leadership skill gaps.
Common training pitfalls to avoid.
What you need to equip emerging leaders with the necessary skills, knowledge and support to thrive, drive organizational success and employee satisfaction.
Strategies to get the most out of your training program.

subject: 2023 CLO Breakfast Clubs On Demand: Where Learning Leaders Shape the Future of L&D
body:
You can now catch every past edition of CLO Breakfast Club anytime you like! Just head over to the on-demand section of the 2023 Breakfast Club site and check out these videos from our June and July events.
View in browser
 
 
For over 18 years, Chief Learning Officer has been bringing together learning leaders, practitioners and professionals from around the globe to discuss the most pressing issues in L&D over breakfast. 
 
You can now catch every past edition of CLO Breakfast Club anytime you like! Just head over to the on-demand section of the 2023 Breakfast Club site and check out these videos from our June and July events.
Brick by Brick: Building a Coachability Culture
 
Organizational investment in coaching has grown substantially in recent years, with good reason: Businesses need managers who can lead teams through change, stress and economic upheaval. And executive coaching can prepare leaders and leadership teams for transition and growth and help them level up their management skills.
 
However, a growing body of research indicates that focusing on coaching without coachability may prove costly. Highly coachable leaders have been found to foster greater levels of employee engagement and retention, and research shows highly coachable individuals achieve significantly higher levels of performance, agility and promotability. 
WATCH NOW
 
Mobilizing Talent for the Future
 
Investing in internal talent mobility has been a growing trend, and the benefits are numerous: Efforts in this area can help organizations attract and retain talent, develop more diverse pipelines, fill open roles and bridge critical skill gaps amid the labor shortage.  
 
What new strategies and tools are emerging for internal talent mobility and career pathing at this halfway point in 2023? And how are organizations using the ever-maturing talent marketplace to match employees’ existing skills with skills needed for aspirational roles or emerging roles of the future?
WATCH NOW
 
A Blueprint for a Skills-Based L&D Strategy
 
The latest industry research in learning and development nowadays points to a growing list of benefits of a skills-based approach — such as stronger and more equitable talent attraction, acquisition and retention strategies, a more agile workforce and being more well-equipped to address the goals and objectives of the business, to name a few.  
 
But first: How does your organization define skills? And, what comes next? 
WATCH NOW

subject: How to Transform Learning for the Modern Employee
body:
Learner expectations have shifted significantly in recent years. 
View in browser
 
 
What the Modern Learner Wants and Needs
 
Thursday, October 12, at 11:00 a.m CT
 
Learner expectations have shifted significantly in recent years. Employees expect to not only be fully supported in their roles but also in their careers. Organizations are now focusing on the employee experience and a full range of integrated talent strategies to drive commitment and performance in their people. 
 
In this webinar
, we will bring you our experience from partnering with hundreds of leading global organizations to benchmark the learning ecosystem that today's learners need and expect. We will follow learners from onboarding through their careers and show how we can support them in performing at their best.
 
Join Andrew Joly, head of strategy, and Ella Richardson, global head of consulting & experience design, as they share and discuss best practices in learning today, including a range of recent case studies and examples. 
 
Key areas we’ll explore include:
Getting the learner experience right
The push vs. pull balance
Networks and support

Critical moments of need

subject: The Next Talent Management Breakfast Club | The Modern Leadership Toolkit: Empathy With Accountability Nov. 15
body:
Heightened levels of uncertainty, change and stress over the past few years have created the need for a new kind of leader — one who can lead with empathy while maintaining accountability.
 
Talent Management (TM) hosts another edition of the Breakfast Club event series Wednesday, Nov. 15 entitled, 
The Modern Leadership Toolkit: Empathy With Accountability
. BetterWork Media Group’s (BMG) Breakfast Club series is now in its 18th year of connecting leaders over breakfast to strengthen the link between learning and development and business strategy.
The Modern Leadership Toolkit: Empathy With Accountability
 
Heightened levels of uncertainty, change and stress over the past few years have created the need for a new kind of leader — one who can lead with empathy while maintaining accountability.
 
Finding a balance between empathy and accountability is critical for creating a work environment where employees can flourish. This involves setting clear boundaries that everyone agrees on, which requires leaders to understand where their employees are coming from (the empathy piece of the puzzle).
 
Join us for this conversation about how empathy and accountability are essential components of the modern leadership toolkit, and how you can strive to develop the ideal balance among your workforce. 
Each mini-event lasts about two hours and consists of a 60-minute panel discussion with L&D and talent practitioners, a 20-minute FASTtalk presentation and a 20-minute research segment, garnering real-time data from attendees and prompting discussion of the day’s themes, followed by closing remarks from me, Talent Management’s Editor-in-dhief.
 
We hope that you can join us.
 
Ashley St. John
Founder, Chief Content Officer & Editor-in-Chief
BetterWork Media Group, parent company of Chief Learning Officer & Talent Management
