subject: Reflecting On Our History & Building Our Future
body:
Out & Equal’s October 2023 Newsletter
 
 
We Have Always Been and Will Always Be
 
LGBTQ+ History Month and National Coming Out Day (October 11) serve as important reminders of who we are as a community, the power and bravery we hold, and the Queer joy that drives us forward. 
We are grateful to the headline-making trailblazers, advocates, leaders, and the courageous people from all communities and walks of life who proudly and boldly came out to say we are here, we are valid, and we belong. 
As we reflect on the larger history of our community and celebrate the movement-making moments, let’s also be sure to acknowledge the significance of the everyday acts of authenticity and courage that have moved us all forward. 
We are a community that has shown we are unstoppable. And while the active efforts, across the United States and around the globe, to silence and erase LGBTQ+ people may frustrate and concern us, our community must always remember that our strength, beauty, and resilience is unrivaled. When faced with adversity, we have shown time and again that we will come back stronger than before.  
﻿
To those who are out and to those who are just beginning their journey, know that you are loved, valid, and seen.  
 
 
A Celebration of Strength, Resilience, and Unity
It was just three weeks ago that Out & Equal hosted our annual 
Workplace Summit
 within the Walt Disney World Resort in Orlando, FL. 
 
The largest LGBTQ+ workplace equity event in the world, this year’s Summit brought together-in-person and virtually-more than 5,000 executives, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEIB) practitioners, Employee Resource Group (ERG) leaders and members, and influencers for multi-day programming that included knowledge and best practice-sharing, workshops, special events, networking, and celebration.
Four days of programming curated by Out & Equal brought together influential thought leaders, global subject matter experts, and more than 300 Partner organizations inclusive of the world’s most notable Fortune 500 companies, for more than 90 panels and interactive workshops.
"Summit is a powerful and uniquely transformative experience, which serves as an opportunity to come together as a collective community, celebrate Queer joy and representation, reclaim the movement, and accelerate our work. It’s a platform to counter the noise and false narratives. It’s a reminder that we are not going anywhere, and that, while forces may attempt to exclude and erase us, we are here and always will be."
- Erin Uritus (she/her), Chief Executive Officer of Out & Equal
As Out & Equal commemorated its 25-year anniversary during Summit, we acknowledged the progress made during this period and the change still needed.
This year’s theme, “
We Are,” 
represented a reclamation and reissue of the LGBTQ+ community’s historic rallying cry of “
we’re here, we’re Queer…” 
and underscored the critical moment in which Summit took place. Through speeches, collaborative learning sessions, and engaging conversations, “We Are” served as a reminder of the strength, resilience, and unity of the LGBTQ+ community.
View Our Event Photos
 
 
 
Recognizing Impact & Elevating Role Models
 
For more than 20 years, 
the Outie Awards
 have recognized and celebrated individuals, organizational initiatives, and ERGs as role models for advancing equity and belonging for LGBTQ+ people in the workplace, and beyond.
At the Workplace Summit Closing Gala, Out & Equal announced this year’s Outie Award winners across six categories. They include individuals, ERGs, and corporate initiatives advocating, driving, and setting the standard for LGBTQ+ equity and DEIB practices.
Workplace Excellence
﻿
Micron Technology
 
Employee Resource Group (ERG) of the Year
﻿
Toyota-Spectrum
 
New Employee Resource Group (ERG) Chapter of the Year
﻿
Middlesex Health-MH+ PRIDE
 
LGBTQ+ Corporate Advocate of the Year
﻿
Amanda Simpson (she/her) 
Vice President Research and Technology, Airbus Americas
 
Ally Changemakers
Karla Arnaiz (she/her), 
Head of Talent & Career Development and DEI for Americas ex US, 
﻿
and Mexico HR, JPMorgan Chase & Co.
Lori Leszczynski (she/her), 
ERG Innovation & Growth Manager, General Motors
 
Global LGBTQ+ Advocate of the Year
Abhinav Shikhar (he/him), 
Regional Leader, Pride Inclusive Community (ERG), Cisco
Learn More About the Winners
 
 
We Need Your Insights and Experiences: Participate in a Survey Assessing the Impact of LGBTQ+-focused Legislation
Out & Equal is conducting a vital, national study to gauge the impact of recent legislation on the workplace experiences and career mobility of LGBTQ+ and allied workers.
The goal of the study is to:
Understand the national landscape of LGBTQ+-related laws.
Explore geopolitics’ influence on career advancement.
Measure workplace experiences in line with the national climate.
Propose solutions informed by your experiences.
Your responses will play a key role in Out & Equal's future materials & initiatives. If you spend more than 50% of your year working in the US, please participate and share within your networks.
Take the 10-Minute Survey!
 
 
Building Cultures of Belonging: New Research & Resources Focused on LGBTQ+ Talent, Retention, and Inclusion
Over the past several weeks and leading into Workplace Summit, Out & Equal released multiple thought leadership pieces. They included:
Experiences of The Lavender Ceiling: Progress and Continued Challenges Facing out LGBTQ+ Leaders at Work.
 
New research, developed in partnership with Korn Ferry, provides an explanation of “The Lavender Ceiling” and the organizational recommendations designed to reduce systemic bias, improve programs that support Queer leaders, and evolve their responses to increased anti-LGBTQ+ legislation.
 
Resources developed in partnership with Bank of America focused on Gen Z.
Cracking the Gen Z Code: Attracting and Retaining Gen Z’s LGBTQ+ Talent
. 
Designed to debunk and demystify misunderstandings and stereotypes about the LGBTQ+ community, the all-new talent acquisition resource leverages relevant statistics to create a clear roadmap for maximizing talent acquisition efforts.
 
You’re Here, You’re Queer, and You Need a Job: Mapping Your First Steps as an LGBTQ+ Gen Zer at Work
.
 Getting a first job and thriving at work is hard for anyone. Doing it as a young, Queer person brings about unique challenges and opportunities for change. The toolkit includes tips and strategies for understanding the professional world for those newly entering it.
 
 
About that B: Bi+ Inclusion at Work
. 
A new resource from Out & Equal co-authored by bi+ advocate Robyn Ochs, the path to bi+ inclusion is illuminated and mapped, with sections focusing on:
understanding the diversity of identities and experiences inside of bi+ spaces;
examining the specific challenges faced by bi+ individuals – and looking at why these challenges happen; and
providing effective, accessible, and clear guidance for organizations, ERGs, and individuals to be active allies to the bi+ community.
 
 
Uplifting & Recognizing the Beautiful Tapestry of the LGBTQ+ Community
In October, Out & Equal is proud to celebrate and honor:
LGBTQ+ History Month
 (October)
 
International Lesbian Day
 (October 8)
 
National Coming Out Day
 (October 11)
 
International Pronouns Day
 (October 21)
 
Asexual Awareness Week
 (October 22-October 28)
 
Intersex Awareness Day
 (October 26)
 
Out & Equal has an incredible library of resources dedicated to advancing LGBTQ+ equity and representation within the workplace, which can be found on 
our website
!
 
Learn More
Interested in becoming a Partner and joining the Out & Equal community? Reach out to 
partnerships@outandequal.org
 for more information.
 
 
 
  
  
  
  
  
 
 
Out & Equal
 | 
1111 Broadway
, 
3rd Floor
, 
Oakland, CA 94607

subject: Transforming Emerging Leaders: Dos and Don'ts of Development
body:
42% of emerging leaders report they had inadequate or ineffective professional development prior to their first leadership role. 
 
Dos and Dont's of Leadership Development
Tuesday, October 24, at 11 a.m CT
 
Forty-two percent of emerging leaders report they had inadequate or ineffective professional development prior to their first leadership role. 
 
In today’s landscape of multigenerational workforces, virtual offices and ever-evolving skills gaps — is your training doing enough to prepare your future leaders?
 
Join Dan Rust, vice president of global leadership and organizational development at InfoPro Learning and Matt Bradley, senior learning and development advisor at OpenSesame for a thought provoking discussion on the importance of providing comprehensive leadership development training and what current programs may be lacking.
 
This webinar will share data collected from five years of global surveys across nearly nine thousand emerging leaders and their direct reports — to give you valuable insights into the training you need and what most leadership development programs are missing.
 
In this webinar, you will learn: 
How to identify current leadership skill gaps.
Common training pitfalls to avoid.
What you need to equip emerging leaders with the necessary skills, knowledge and support to thrive, drive organizational success and employee satisfaction.
Strategies to get the most out of your training program.

body:

"I am no longer accepting the things I cannot change. I am changing the things I cannot accept." 
―Angela Davis
Today's Topics: 
Women of Color and Their Allies Event Recap
In Case You Missed It
Upcoming Webinars
-The Fair360 Staff
EVENT RECAP
 
2023 Women of Color and Their Allies
 
Fair360 and host sponsor RTX were joined by more than one thousand in-person and virtual attendees for the sixth annual Women of Color and Their Allies event near Washington, D.C., on September 21.
 
From research presentations to panels and fireside chats, “Navigating the Intersections of Workforce Equity” was the theme of this year’s event. Click below to watch full sessions and read article recaps.
Learn More
 
IN CASE YOU MISSED IT
 
The Power of Female Leadership: How to Demonstrate Inclusion
 
Want to build a more inclusive workplace? Look no further than your female leaders. Compared to male leaders at their level, women CEOs are more likely to foster inclusion, exhibit empathy and support employee career development and well-being, according to the LeanIn.org and McKinsey & Company’s Women in the Workplace 2022 report.
Read Full Article
 
  
Upcoming Webinars
Oct. 4, 2023 | Attracting and Retaining Latinx Talent
Our panelists will share insights on how to create a welcoming and inclusive workplace for Latinx employees, discuss the unique challenges they face and provide strategies for recruiting, retaining and promoting Latinx talent.
 
Oct. 11, 2023 | Equitable Experiences for Employees With Disabilities
In this session, we’ll hear from organizations and experts who have moved the needle on how people with disabilities are recruited, promoted and retained within their organizations.

This webinar will cover how workforce participation in ERGs is increasing at many companies, leading to new ways of structuring these groups.

subject: Unlock the Power of Coaching with These 5 Tips
body:
Coaching helps leaders and organizations achieve their goals faster and more reliably over time, and it can be deployed in a variety of ways to fit your organizational goals and budget.
View in browser
 
 
5 Things You Need To Know Before Purchasing a Coaching Platform
 
 
 
On Demand
 
“Coaching has risen as a ‘must-have’ for organizations in the last couple of years with 86 percent of organizational leaders agreeing that relationship-based approaches to leadership development, like coaching and mentoring, achieve better results than other forms of learning,” according to data from the Harvard Business Review Analytic Services report, Leveraging Coaching and Mentoring to Create More Effective Leaders. Coaching helps leaders and organizations achieve their goals faster and more reliably over time, and it can be deployed in a variety of ways to fit your organizational goals and budget. 
 
If you’re ready to invest in coaching for your organization or you’re expanding its benefits to more leaders, here’s what you need to know in order to define your strategy and successfully navigate the selection and purchase process for your organization.

body:

View in browser
 
 
Strategies for Upskilling Your Workforce
 
TOMORROW, September 27, at 11 a.m CT
 
Join David Wilson, the CEO, and founder of Fosway Group, as he provides expert insights into how companies can align their business strategy with their upskilling programs, and why it’s so important. subject: Today's News: Supporting Women of Color, Board of Director Fairness & More
body:
Quote of the day
“I learned early on about the real meaning of equity and inclusion, and that when those guiding principles are not met, they can have devastating effects on individuals, families and communities.”
—Lori Lightfoot
Today's Topics: 
Supporting Women of Color
In Case You Missed It
Upcoming Webinars
-The Fair360 Staff
BUSINESS
 
The Strategy Session: Shanda Hinton Discusses How RTX Targets Women of Color
 
In advance of our Women of Color and Their Allies (WOCA) event, which took place on September 21, Fair360 Head of Content Linda Bell sat down with Shanda Hinton, Chief Diversity Officer of RTX, who served as host sponsor of the event. Watch the interview to learn about the support companies can offer women of color in the workplace. Check back to Fair360 to view session recordings, article recaps and photos of the sixth annual WOCA event.
WATCH
 
IN CASE YOU MISSED IT
 
Ensuring Fairness in Your Board of Directors
 
Fairness in a corporation’s board of directors is vital to fostering inclusion, driving innovation and making informed business decisions. Companies can achieve equity by expanding the candidate pool, implementing effective succession planning and engaging stakeholders and shareholders. 
Read Full Article
 
  
Upcoming Webinars
Oct. 4, 2023 | Attracting and Retaining Latinx Talent
Our panelists will share insights on how to create a welcoming and inclusive workplace for Latinx employees, discuss the unique challenges they face and provide strategies for recruiting, retaining and promoting Latinx talent.
 
Oct. 11, 2023 | Equitable Experiences for Employees With Disabilities
In this session, we’ll hear from organizations and experts who have moved the needle on how people with disabilities are recruited, promoted and retained within their organizations.
 
Oct. 25, 2023 | Keys to Successful ERG Structure, Retention and Recruitment
This webinar will cover how workforce participation in ERGs is increasing at many companies, leading to new ways of structuring these groups.

subject: Unlocking the Potential of Modern Learners
body:
Learner expectations have shifted significantly in recent years. 
View in browser
 
 
What the Modern Learner Wants and Needs
 
Thursday, October 12, at 11:00 a.m CT
 
Learner expectations have shifted significantly in recent years. Employees expect to not only be fully supported in their roles but also in their careers. Organizations are now focusing on the employee experience and a full range of integrated talent strategies to drive commitment and performance in their people. 
 
In this webinar
, we will bring you our experience from partnering with hundreds of leading global organizations to benchmark the learning ecosystem that today's learners need and expect. We will follow learners from onboarding through their careers and show how we can support them in performing at their best.
 
Join Andrew Joly, head of strategy, and Ella Richardson, global head of consulting & experience design, as they share and discuss best practices in learning today, including a range of recent case studies and examples. 
 
Key areas we’ll explore include:
Getting the learner experience right
The push vs. pull balance
Networks and support
Where talent and learning meet
Critical moments of need
Learning in the flow of work
Register today
 to hear the latest thinking for empowering your people for future success.

subject: Our Latest Breakfast Club Events Are Now Available to Watch On-Demand
body:
Watch the latest Breakfast Clubs, Tapping Into Untapped Talent, AI and Machine Learning in HR: Transforming Talent Management Strategies, or any other past edition and make sure to register and catch our next event live!
 
The latest breakfast club event hosted by Talent Management is now available on the 2023 Breakfast Club website to watch any time, on-demand! 
 
Watch the latest Breakfast Clubs, 
Tapping Into Untapped Talent
, 
AI and Machine Learning in HR: Transforming Talent Management Strategies
, 
or any other past edition and make sure to register and 
catch our next event live!
Tapping Into Untapped Talent
 
2020 research
 from Accenture and Harvard Business School explores the phenomenon of “hidden workers,” or the millions of people who want to work and are actively seeking work, but who remain “hidden” from most businesses that would benefit from hiring them by the very processes those companies use to find talent. The research estimates there are more than 27 million hidden workers in the U.S. alone. They include caregivers, veterans, immigrants and refugees, people with physical disabilities, relocating partners and spouses, those with mental health or developmental/neurodiversity challenges, those from disadvantaged backgrounds or populations, people who were previously incarcerated and those lacking traditional qualifications.
 
As record lows in unemployment and the Great Resignation continue to limit workforce growth, how can organizations connect with this hidden talent, and what needs to change in existing hiring and recruitment practices?
WATCH NOW
 
AI and Machine Learning in HR: Transforming Talent Management Strategies
 
As the use of AI and machine learning becomes more prevalent in the workplace, it’s essential to understand how these new technologies can be leveraged to transform HR practices and support talent management strategies. Join Talent Management for an engaging conversation around the potential impact of AI and machine learning on HR functions such as employee development, employee engagement, career pathing and performance management. Our expert panelists will also explore how these technologies can help talent professionals gain deeper insights into identifying skills gaps within organizations, automating tasks, and ultimately making more informed decisions about their workforce.
WATCH NOW
 
Watch either of the above events on-demand now, or check out any of the
 
other topics
 
– also available at this time.

here

body:
Congrats to all of our 
344 Nominees
 for this year's 
Chicago Innovation Awards!
 
We were so proud to celebrate the 2023 Chicago Innovation Award nominees with over 500 people at our annual Nominee Celebration at the Lincoln Park Zoo's Pepper Family Wildlife Center on September 13th.
Click Here to View all Chicago Innovation Award Nominees
 
 
 
 
 
Monthly Poll Questions
 
 
 
This month, Chicago Innovation and the Serafin Power Poll team up!
 
Launched in 2020, the Serafin Power Poll is an interactive polling platform that surveys business, civic, media and political insiders to produce valuable insight into what some of the Chicago region's most influential citizens think about pressing civic issues. While it's not a scientific poll, it is a fascinating, non-partisan and strictly anonymous glimpse into the attitudes and opinions of those individuals who essentially run the city.

body:
Dr. Adaora Otiji, CLO - DC Department of Health, brings her human development expertise to the panel of learning leaders!
View in browser
 
 
Join Chief Learning Officer for our Oct. 26 Breakfast Club event, 
Differentiated Development: Rethinking Inclusion in Learning
. 
 
Dr. Adaora Otiji, CLO - DC Department of Health, brings her human development expertise to the panel of learning leaders!
 
Dr. Adaora Otiji-Spizler
 is a strategic people leader, transforming organizations through talent development, change management and human-centered human resources. She has a passion for developing people and organizations with 15-plus years of experience in building programs and leading change initiatives that help people succeed in their careers as well as in creating systems to quantify the impact of those programs and determine effectiveness. Adaora has led the design, delivery and operations of talent and organizational development programs with nonprofit and government organizations.
 
Register today to take part in our conversation on the move away from one-size-fits-all development and rethinking inclusion in learning and talent approaches.

subject: TODAY: 5 Things You Need To Know Before Purchasing a Coaching Platform
body:
Coaching helps leaders and organizations achieve their goals faster and more reliably over time, and it can be deployed in a variety of ways to fit your organizational goals and budget.
View in browser
 
 
5 Things You Need To Know Before Purchasing a Coaching Platform
 
 
 
TODAY, September 13, at 1 p.m CT
 
“Coaching has risen as a ‘must-have’ for organizations in the last couple of years with 86 percent of organizational leaders agreeing that relationship-based approaches to leadership development, like coaching and mentoring, achieve better results than other forms of learning,” according to data from the Harvard Business Review Analytic Services report, Leveraging Coaching and Mentoring to Create More Effective Leaders. Coaching helps leaders and organizations achieve their goals faster and more reliably over time, and it can be deployed in a variety of ways to fit your organizational goals and budget. 
 
If you’re ready to invest in coaching for your organization or you’re expanding its benefits to more leaders, here’s what you need to know in order to define your strategy and successfully navigate the selection and purchase process for your organization.
 
Register now to learn how to: 
Identify your goals and map them to organizational priorities
Outline your program
Make a winning business case for coaching
Understand your investment budget
Choose your solution partner

Ensuring Fairness in Your Board of Directors
 
Fairness in a corporation’s board of directors is vital to fostering inclusion, driving innovation and making informed business decisions. Companies can achieve equity by expanding the candidate pool, implementing effective succession planning and engaging stakeholders and shareholders.

CAREER ADVICE
 
Bruno Olvera: How to Leverage Employee Resource Groups to Grow Your Career
 
In this week’s installment of our Career Advice video series, Linda Bell, Head of Content at Fair360, formerly DiversityInc, interviewed Bruno Olvera, Senior Manager of Diversity Supplier Development at Stellantis. Olvera shared tips on how workers can grow their careers after a company merger and by tapping into employee resource groups.
 
WATCH

PPG to Invest $5 Million in Environmental Sustainability Education
 
PPG and the PPG Foundation have announced a commitment to invest $5 million in environmental sustainability education by 2030.
 
Through this commitment, the company will support the next generation of innovators with educational program funding. These programs will help educate on topics such as clean energy, climate change, energy efficiency and reforestation.

subject: Nominate for the first-ever Turn the Page on Age Awards
body:
Dear Ashton,
We are excited to announce the 
second annual Turn the Page on Age Awards
, which celebrate innovative individuals and organizations that are combating ageism, debunking commonly held myths about aging, and promoting positive narratives around getting older.
The awards shine a light on those that are shifting attitudes and behavior that foster more age-related empathy. Individuals of ALL ages, and organizations working to amplify opportunities for older adults to thrive, are encouraged to apply.
Awardees receive:
- Recognition at the annual Turn the Page on Age Awards ceremony in December
- Free one-year membership to The Village Chicago
- Free one-year membership to Chicago Innovation
- Highlighted on WBBM Newsradio
- Promotion leading up to the Turn the Page on Age Awards
There is no fee to nominate, and self-nominations are welcome. 
 
If you or anyone you know is engaged in work that is shifting attitudes and behavior by demonstrating that age diversity fosters creativity, productivity and improved outcomes, nominate by October 6th.
 
Individuals
 
Organizations
 
Nominate Today!
 
 
Nominations close on October 6th. Winners will be celebrated at the "Uniting Generations" event in December 2023.

Embracing the Skills-based Future by Operationalizing Your Skills Strategy
 
Tuesday, September 19, at 1 p.m CT
 
With the world of work rapidly and fundamentally shifting to a skills-focused lens, you must modernize your business model before necessity does it for you. Transforming into a skills-based organization (SBO) is a complicated, emerging process, but with the right tools and strategies, a little guidance and a future-focused mindset, you can leave your mark on the future of work.

subject: TODAY! Leverage Employees’ Star Power: Transforming Learning with a Social, Mobile-First Approach
body:
Discover how you can drive impactful change through surfacing bite-size insights in the palm of your workforce hand and by placing your employees at the heart of content creation and curation by creating internal “thinkfluencers” to ultimately go faster with skills transformation.
View in browser
 
 
Leverage Employees’ Star Power: Transforming Learning with a Social, Mobile-First Approach
 
Thursday, September 7, at 2 p.m ET
 
This session
 will explore the journey of transforming the learning experience for a large organization of 17,000 people. Keeping up with the speed of corporate transformation required Infor to assess its learning strategy from top to bottom. With the company historically rooted in traditional instructor-led training, e-learning and event-based learning, the ability to support upskilling and reskilling initiatives had stalled out.
 
From the decision-making process to influencing stakeholders and managing change, we will share insights and lessons learned along the way. 
Discover
 how you can drive impactful change through surfacing bite-size insights in the palm of your workforce hand and by placing your employees at the heart of content creation and curation by creating internal “thinkfluencers” to ultimately go faster with skills transformation.
 
Hear
 how the usage and adoption of targeted, personalized learning content exceeded all expectations and led to 100 percent completion rates with better data and insights into what employees wanted to learn along with what they needed to learn.
 
Learning objectives:
Breaking the cycle of formal learning for everything.
Understanding how “just-in-time” micro-learning is impactful to your workforce.
How to leverage the power of storytelling and bite-size insights from your internal experts and harness their star power to drive learning internally.
Track and measure learning consumption to the second and see what else employees are interested in learning as they wander into other prebuilt “thinkfluencer” content.

subject: The Benefits of Integrating Learning Across a Global Organization
body:
Hear challenges faced, such as lean teams, global time zones, internal obstacles and inconsistent uptake among brands, and the methods used to overcome these challenges, such as global communications, internal partnerships and training global facilitators.
View in browser
 
 
Power of One: Publicis Groupe’s Journey Toward Integrating Learning with Marcel Classes 
 
Tuesday, September 12, at 2 p.m ET
 
Join us
 to explore the journey of Marcel Classes, Publicis Groupe’s platform for all things learning. In this webinar, Carol Sinko, senior vice president and Marcel Classes global lead, and Stacey Richter-Levy, vice president of live learning delivery and strategy, will share their insights on how Marcel Classes has transformed the way learning is approached in a huge multicultural global organization through the aim of increasing participation, improving outcomes and reducing costs.
 
They will discuss their path from a holding company with siloed learning options to a “power of one” mentality, including the seismic shift in 2020 and how it has had an impact to date, as well as to the future outlook. Hear challenges faced, such as lean teams, global time zones, internal obstacles and inconsistent uptake among brands, and the methods used to overcome these challenges, such as global communications, internal partnerships and training global facilitators.
 
Learning objectives:
Gain insights on how Marcel Classes has evolved to achieve a “power of one” mentality and overcome siloed learning options.
Understand the challenges and benefits of integrating learning across a global organization.
Learn about the methods and strategies used to centralize learning with Marcel Classes, including global communications, internal partnerships and training global facilitators.
Discover the impact of Marcel Classes on improving learning outcomes, increasing participation and reducing costs.

subject: Representation Matters: Out & Equal’s September 2023 Newsletter
body:
Representation Matters
Across the board, representation matters.
It matters in the media we consume, the individuals we spotlight and celebrate, the research and insights that inform policy decisions and strategy, the workplaces we create, and the communities we build.
Representation is powerful. It ensures that, as a collective community, we move forward together. It reinforces that nothing is out of reach. It creates cultures of belonging where all individuals can thrive.
And with the 
Out & Equal Workplace Summit
 less than a week away, we are reminded that representation fosters innovation, drives bold ideas and thinking, and creates unstoppable movements.
 
Meet our Outie Award Finalists
For more than 20 years,
 
The Outie Awards
 
have recognized and celebrated individuals, organizational initiatives, and employee resource groups as role models for advancing equity and belonging for LGBTQ+ people in the workplace, and beyond.
This year’s finalists represent an impressive group of role models made up of individuals, ERGs, organizations, and LGBTQ+ inclusion initiatives advancing representation and equity in measurable ways.
Outie Award Winners will be announced at the Closing Gala of the Out & Equal 2023 Workplace Summit on Thursday, September 14.
 
Learn About the 2023 Outie Finalists
 
 
Spotlight: Research & Initiatives Advancing Representation & Inclusion
 
 
Visual language and representation matters. It’s why we
 
partnered with
 the Noun Project
 and other notable partners to launch a new collection of 30 icons dedicated to celebrating the LGBTQ+ community called, 
The Pride Icon Collection
. 
Read More
 
“The LGBTQ+ community is a diverse, multicultural community, but this is often not how we see the community reflected or portrayed in media. When representation is limited, it becomes “normal” to think you must present—act, dress, or look—a certain way to be representative of, and/or welcomed into a group and treated equitably. When greater, more diverse representation of the community is present and visible, the pressure to assimilate, hide, or cover aspects of one’s uniqueness is lessened, and the courage and confident to be one’s more authentic self increases.”
—Michael J. Chamberlain (he/him), Chief Marketing Officer, Out & Equal
 
In partnership with Windō
, Out & Equal released a report examining why transparency on LGBTQ+ Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEIB) efforts matter from a talent attraction and retention perspective.
Through this research, Windo tracks 13 notable LGBTQ+ Awards, Indices, and Recognitions, which align with Out & Equal’s vision of global workplaces where all people are equal, belong, and thrive.
Learn More
 
 
 
LGBTQ+ Financial Wellness
Traditional lending data often overlooks LGBTQ+ needs, leaving financial gaps and inequities. Let's change that! 
Experian and Out & Equal
 have partnered to empower the LGBTQ+ community financially.
This study* will help us understand the overall credit health of LGBTQ+ participants and reveal areas of success and inequity. The intention is to help companies, organizations, nonprofits, and others create programs and resources to help improve overall credit health and awareness for LGBTQ+ consumers. 
Participate in the study
 
* As a leading information services company, some of Experian’s chief priorities include protecting and ensuring the accuracy of consumer information. The integrity of our data is critical and aligns with efforts to advocate for financial inclusion for everyone.
 
 
Announcing the Launch of The Global Hub 3.0!
Out & Equal is proud to launch version 3.0 of 
The Global Hub
 at the upcoming Workplace Summit, featuring a fresh new look, enhanced functionality, and more content and content features.
The Global Hub, available exclusively to 
Out & Equal Partner organizations
, is the only resource of its kind developed to support internal change agents working in DEI, HR, and ERG leadership in their efforts to ensure progress toward workplace inclusion and belonging for LGBTQ+ talent.
 
 
At Out & Equal, we’re proud to acknowledge and celebrate the following:
Bi+ Visibility Week (September 16-September 23) & Bi+ Visibility Day (September 23): 
Out & Equal’s
 
Bi+ Visibility in the Workplace Resource
 helps fill in the gaps in information around Bi+ identities in the workplace and provides tangible action items for employers and individuals. 
And, during our Workplace Summit, we will be releasing additional resources in this space.
 
Latinx Heritage Month begins on Friday, September 15: 
The LGBTQ+ community is not a monolith, and as we acknowledge and celebrate Latinx History Month, it’s important we take an intersectional lens in our approach to representation, inclusion, and equity. Only when we acknowledge the unique experiences of the most historically marginalized and/or overlooked individuals and communities, can we truly advance equity for all. 
To learn more about intersectionality in the workplace, check out the content and videos within the featured sessions highlighted in Out & Equal’s, "
Practitioners for Change: Intersectionality Learning Series Resources
.
”
 
 
  
  
  
  
  
 
 
Out & Equal
 | 
1111 Broadway
, 
3rd Floor
, 
Oakland, CA 94607

subject: What the Modern Learner Wants and Needs
body:
Learner expectations have shifted significantly in recent years. 
View in browser
 
 
What the Modern Learner Wants and Needs
 
Thursday, October 12, at 11:00 a.m CT
 
Learner expectations have shifted significantly in recent years. Employees expect to not only be fully supported in their roles but also in their careers. Organizations are now focusing on the employee experience and a full range of integrated talent strategies to drive commitment and performance in their people. 
 
In this webinar
, we will bring you our experience from partnering with hundreds of leading global organizations to benchmark the learning ecosystem that today's learners need and expect. We will follow learners from onboarding through their careers and show how we can support them in performing at their best.
 
Join Andrew Joly, head of strategy, and Ella Richardson, global head of consulting & experience design, as they share and discuss best practices in learning today, including a range of recent case studies and examples. 
 
Key areas we’ll explore include:
Getting the learner experience right
The push vs. pull balance
Networks and support
Where talent and learning meet
Critical moments of need
Learning in the flow of work
Register today
 to hear the latest thinking for empowering your people for future success.

subject: Don’t Miss Today’s Breakfast Club Discussion!
body:
As record lows in unemployment and the Great Resignation continue to limit workforce growth, how can organizations connect with this hidden talent and what needs to change in existing recruitment practices?
 
You Can Still Join Us for Today’s Event!
 
Talent Management’s Breakfast Club event, Tapping Into Untapped Talent, is today!
 
2020 research from Accenture and Harvard Business School explores the phenomenon of “hidden workers,” or the millions of people who want to work and are actively seeking work, but who remain “hidden” from most businesses by the very processes those companies use to find talent. The research estimates there are more than 27 million hidden workers in the U.S. alone and includes caregivers, veterans, immigrants and refugees, people with physical disabilities, relocating partners and spouses, those with mental health or developmental/neurodiversity challenges, those from disadvantaged backgrounds or populations, people who were previously incarcerated and those lacking traditional qualifications.
 
As record lows in unemployment and the Great Resignation continue to limit workforce growth, how can organizations connect with this hidden talent and what needs to change in existing recruitment practices?
 
Register now
 to join today’s conversation with our panel of experts:
Kara Schillaci - vice president, talent development & transformation for Rexel
Sonia Malik - global program director, IBM SkillsBuild, Corporate Social Responsibility, IBM
Asrif Yusoff - head of leadership academy, PETRONAS Leadership Centre
The Talent Management Team

Partner Spotlight

CAREER ADVICE
 
Marion Brooks: The Biggest Mistake We’re Making in Our Careers
 
Unlock valuable insights for your career journey with Fair360's Career Advice video series! We're excited to announce this empowering resource is now free to all Fair360 readers.
 
This week's installment features Marion Brooks, VP & US Country Head, Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Novartis (a Fair360, formerly DiversityInc Hall of Fame company). Listen to his thoughts on taking advantage of opportunities to grow your career, building emotional intelligence and defining your brand.
WATCH
 
PARTNER SPOTLIGHT
 
On the Frontlines of Fairness: Jefferson Health’s JEDI Councils in Action
 
We spoke with Brenda Snipes, VP of Diversity at Jefferson Health, about the company's Equity, Diversity and Inclusion (JEDI) strategic initiatives and how they are improving employee, patient and partner experience.
 
“This work isn’t about blame. It is not about shame. It is not about cancellation. It is about teachable moments. It is about humility. It is about vulnerability. It is about learning, and it is about being able to meet people where they want to be met in order for us, especially in healthcare, to care for them. That’s what it’s about."

subject: Tackling the Environmental Health & Safety Challenges of a Remote Workforce - On Demand
body:
Employees working remotely create health and safety challenges for organizations, and the issue can be more acute in small to mid–sized organizations where it is common for one individual to wear several hats, including safety coordinator. 
View in browser
 
 
Tackling the Environmental Health & Safety Challenges of a Remote Workforce
 
On Demand
 
Employees working remotely create health and safety challenges for organizations, and the issue can be more acute in small to mid–sized organizations where it is common for one individual to wear several hats, including safety coordinator. With almost 92 million Americans working from home at least one day a week, companies struggle with how to keep employees working virtually safe, healthy and productive.
 
Join
 Andrea Foster-Mack, product director, EHS eLearning at Traliant, for a 45-minute webinar addressing how companies can effectively meet their responsibilities under OSHA to provide a healthy and safe work environment for employees working from home, coffee shops or on the move. Andrea will share best practices learned during her 17 years of combined EHS experience working with the Department of Labor, OSHA, CDC & US Senate/House subcommittees for safety and health. Learn valuable tips for empowering remote and hybrid employees to become safety advocates for themselves and co-workers.
 
The webinar will cover: 
Employer’s responsibilities under OSHA’s General Duty Clause for Remote Workers
Common EHS hazards for employees working remotely 
Building a safety culture  
Reimagining EHS strategies and training for a remote/hybrid workforce 
Empowering employees to become safety advocates 
Implementing Job Hazard Analysis 
Filing a workplace incident report
START WATCHING

subject: Webinar Next Week Featuring Cargill, Nemak & More
body:
Strategize & implement a global DEI strategy—register now!
 
 
AUGUST 30, 2023
 / 11:00 a.m. – 12:00 p.m. ET
 
Webinar Next Week: How to Implement a Global DEI Strategy on the Local Level
 
Hi Ashton,
Diversity and inclusion require a global strategy, but the strategy also needs to be tailored to each region. 
Join Catalyst and speakers from 
Cargill, Canadian Chamber of Commerce, and Nemak
 
next Wednesday, August 30 to gain critical insights on how to successfully strategize and implement a global DEI strategy locally. 
 
REGISTER NOW
 
 
This webinar is complimentary for Catalyst Supporters.
 For questions, please contact 
catalystevents@catalyst.org
.
 
SPEAKERS
 
Nisha Raj Coughlan
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Leader
Cargill (EMEA Region)
 
Candace Laing
Chair
Canadian Chamber of Commerce
 
Lorena Chavez
Global D&I and Talent Attraction Manager
Nemak
 
MODERATOR
 
Leela Wilson
Senior Vice President, Global Corporate Engagement
Catalyst
 
 
DISCUSSION TOPICS
 
 
How companies can tailor solutions for each region while ensuring company values remain consistent globally.
Opening space for effective insider-outsider partnerships. 
Identifying local change agents, their goals and strategies, and the specific obstacles to inclusion. 
Adopting a transversal approach: a global framework that shapes and guides the work, along with the flexibility and autonomy to adapt it locally.

subject: How Can We Cultivate an Environment in Which Employees Perform at Their Best?
body:
How can we cultivate an environment in which employees perform at their best?
View in browser
 
 
Using Neuroscience to Cultivate a High Performing Culture
 
 
 
Tuesday, September 12, at 11 a.m CT
 
How can we cultivate an environment in which employees perform at their best? How do policies impact employees’ mental health, job satisfaction and overall performance? What are the unintended consequences of policies designed to maximize performance? 
 
J
oin
 mental health practitioner Gretchen Yungen, industrial and organizational psychology professional Jessica Billiet and user experience design expert Amie Bergstrand for this session where we will explore the neuroscience behind high performing cultures. You will learn how policies and procedures impact your employees’ brains on a neurological level, the resulting behaviors, and the overall impact on performance. Our discussion will center around creating an environment where employees can thrive and the resulting impact on retention rates, culture and performance metrics.

Optum Rx, a UnitedHealth Group business, partnered with Florida Agricultural and Mechanical University (FAMU) to establish a scholarship for underrepresented pharmacy students. FAMU is a historically Black university (HBCU) in Tallahassee.
 
The scholarship aims to increase representation in the pharmacy field. The scholarship will fund up to $95,000 for more than 15 students at FAMU’s College of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences/Institute of Public Health.

subject: Manager Essentials: Providing Feedback to Develop Value-Based Behaviors
body:
A company’s values represent its guiding principles for doing business, achieving its mission, and reaching its goals.
                                                            
 
A company’s values represent its guiding principles for doing business, achieving its mission, and reaching its goals. 
While values should act as the foundation for how employees behave, it’s often not clear to them how best to embody their company’s values at work. 
Download our workbook
 to discover a three-pronged approach to using feedback to develop employee behaviors that align with your company’s values.
Get the Workbook

Offer feedback using the Situation Behavior Impact (SBI) framework 
Connect behaviors to your company’s values and your employees’ work 
Ask coaching questions to avoid prescribing specific actions

subject: Build a Safety Culture for Your Remote Employees
body:
Employees working remotely create health and safety challenges for organizations, and the issue can be more acute in small to mid–sized organizations where it is common for one individual to wear several hats, including safety coordinator. 
View in browser
 
 
Tackling the Environmental Health & Safety Challenges of a Remote Workforce
 
On Demand
 
Employees working remotely create health and safety challenges for organizations, and the issue can be more acute in small to mid–sized organizations where it is common for one individual to wear several hats, including safety coordinator. With almost 92 million Americans working from home at least one day a week, companies struggle with how to keep employees working virtually safe, healthy and productive.
 
Join
 Andrea Foster-Mack, product director, EHS eLearning at Traliant, for a 45-minute webinar addressing how companies can effectively meet their responsibilities under OSHA to provide a healthy and safe work environment for employees working from home, coffee shops or on the move. Andrea will share best practices learned during her 17 years of combined EHS experience working with the Department of Labor, OSHA, CDC & US Senate/House subcommittees for safety and health. Learn valuable tips for empowering remote and hybrid employees to become safety advocates for themselves and co-workers.
 
The webinar will cover: 
Employer’s responsibilities under OSHA’s General Duty Clause for Remote Workers
Common EHS hazards for employees working remotely 
Building a safety culture  
Reimagining EHS strategies and training for a remote/hybrid workforce 
Empowering employees to become safety advocates 
Implementing Job Hazard Analysis 
Filing a workplace incident report
START WATCHING

subject: How to Implement a Global DEI Strategy Locally
body:
Gain critical insights—register for the webinar on August 30.
 
 
AUGUST 30, 2023
 / 11:00 a.m. – 12:00 p.m. ET
 
Webinar on August 30: 
Think Global, Act Local—
Contextualize a Universal DEI Vision
 
Hi Ashton,
As more and more organizations move toward a global DEI perspective, we must answer the question: 
What goals need to be prioritized on the local level where cultural differences play an important role?
Join Catalyst and a panel of expert speakers on Wednesday, August 30 to gain critical insights on how to successfully strategize and implement a global DEI strategy locally. 
Discussion topics will include:
How companies can tailor solutions for each region while ensuring company values remain consistent globally.
Opening space for effective insider-outsider partnerships. 
Identifying local change agents, their goals and strategies, and the specific obstacles to inclusion. 
Adopting a transversal approach: a global framework that shapes and guides the work along with the flexibility and autonomy to adapt it locally.

body:

Join us on 15 November 2023 in Toronto and online for Catalyst Honours—the premier Canadian DEI conference and dinner.

This year’s theme, “
Accelerating equity on all fronts—so women thrive
,” is the inspiration behind new and original Catalyst research, as well as expert sessions—including what organizations can do to make a difference for frontline employees, addressing racism in the workplace, and building more inclusive workplace cultures.

Boeing Partners With NASA on Sustainable Flight Demonstrator Project
 
Boeing and NASA will partner to collaborate with airlines in the United States to advise the Sustainable Flight Demonstrator (SFD) project and development of the X-66A research aircraft.
 
The SFD project is part of Boeing and NASA’s efforts to improve sustainability. Alaska Airlines, American Airlines, Delta Air Lines, Southwest Airlines and United Airlines will provide input on operational efficiencies, maintenance, handling characteristics and airport compatibility.

subject: Deliver Effective Learning With AI
body:
In this webinar Dr. Michael Kolodziej explores how leaders can apply the principles of good learning in order to develop an effective learning experience in the workplace.
View in browser
 
 
Innovations in Learning: How leaders can leverage AI for effective training
 
 
 
Tuesday, August 22, at 1 p.m CT
 
In this webinar Dr. Michael Kolodziej explores how leaders can apply the principles of good learning in order to develop an effective learning experience in the workplace. He reviews the key aspects of good learning and looks at how artificial intelligence (AI), specifically adaptive learning, AI-Chat GPT+ and video-based assessments enable leaders to deliver effective learning on a larger scale. Dr. Kolodziej also takes you on a brief journey through the trough of disillusionment, addressing the perils and pitfalls leaders should be keen to when it comes to technological innovation.
 
This webinar will cover:
The dimensions of good learning and where technology fits in.
How leaders can leverage artificial intelligence (AI), specifically adaptive learning, AI-Chat GPT+ and video-based assessments to scale effective learning.
Leadership challenges: The Perils and pitfalls of technological innovation.

subject: Out & Equal’s August 2023 Newsletter
body:
Out & Equal Welcomes New Directors to its Board 
 
 
The Out & Equal team is incredibly excited to welcome three new leaders to its distinguished Board of Directors. These individuals are all working to advance representation, inclusion, and equity for the LGBTQ+ community in the workplace, and beyond. They will build on the breadth of expertise on the Board, and their experiences and insights will continue to elevate and drive Out & Equal’s mission globally.
 
Javier Constante (he/him)
 
President, Dow Brasil & América Latina
 
Javier Constante has been President of Dow in Brazil and Latin America since late 2019. In this role, he is responsible for developing and overseeing Dow’s regional strategy and financial performance in the region with the goal of making Dow the most customer-centric, innovative, sustainable, and inclusive materials science company in the world. As part of his current role, Javier drives increased focus and action around ESG parameters, including moving to a low-carbon and circular economy, building a more transparent, authentic and safe work environment for employees, and moving toward a more equitable society. 
 
In 2022, Javier received Out & Equal's Outie Award in the category "
Global LGBTQ+ Advocate of the Year
" for his leadership in initiatives to include LGBTQIA+ people in the labor market. Javier also made it once again to the TOP 100 LGBT+ executives recognized by the 2022 OUTstanding LGBT+ Role Model List, which he is listed for the third consecutive time.  
Javier holds a bachelor’s degree in chemical engineering from Universidad de La Plata, Argentina, and a master of business administration (MBA) from Instituto Altos Estudio Empresariales - IESE, Argentina.
 
 
 
Chris Mossiah (they/them)
 
Executive Director—Consumer & Community Banking, JPMorgan Chase
 
GEC, Co-Chair 
PRIDE Tri-State, TGNC & Non-binary Co-Lead 
 
Chris Mossiah, based in New York City, is an Area Product Director for a design system within the Consumer & Community Banking Department. They are also the Co-Chair of the Firmwide GEC (Gender Expansive Council) as well as co-lead for the Transgender, Gender Nonconforming, and Non-binary subcommittee of PRIDE Tri-State BRG. Chris has worked for JPMorgan Chase for more than five years while being a member of the Pride leadership team for more than four years. Chris also serves on the TNI (Transgender, Non-binary, and Intersex) subcommittee of Open Finance (a forum that unites LGBTQ+ leaders of major financial services organizations across the NY metro area).  
Prior to coming to JPMorgan, Chris was enlisted in the US Navy as an electronic technician and has been in the technology field for over 20 years. Chris holds both a bachelor’s and a master’s in Computer Science from The City College of New York and Syracuse University, respectively. 
 
 
Emily “Hawking” Shilling (she/her)
 
Naval Aviator, Test Pilot, Military Professional, Speaker, and President of 
SPARTA
Emily “Hawking” Shilling is a Commander (CDR) in the United States Navy (USN). Joining in 2005, she was winged as a Naval Aviator in 2007 and went on to fly the Aircraft Carrier based EA-6B Prowler on sixty combat missions. Hawking has flown 21 different aircraft, accruing over 1,700 flight hours, and served as a USN Test Pilot for the EA-18G and F-18E/F fighter jets out of VX-23.  
 
Now an Aerospace Engineering Duty Officer, she is stationed on Patuxent River MD, where she procures and develops our nation’s most advanced next generation of warfighting capabilities. CDR Shilling holds a bachelor of science in Aerospace Engineering, master of science in Systems Engineering, and has received national awards and recognition for both her advocacy and flying endeavors.  
 
She is currently the senior, actively serving, trans-identifying line officer in the United State Navy and President of SPARTA, an organization that advocates and educates about transgender military service and is dedicated to the support and professional development of more than 2,000 transgender service members. 
﻿
In 2022, CDR Shilling received the Outie Award in the category of "
LGBTQ+ Corporate Advocate of the Year
" for 
actively working with transgender personnel, Congress, high level military leaders, and the Defense Health Agency, to provide mentorship, advocate for inclusive military service, improve access to medical care, and create a safe environment in which transgender individuals not only serve, but thrive.
 
 
 
 
 
Queer Money Matters!
 
Experian and Out & Equal are embarking on a one-of-a-kind credit data study for LGBTQ+ consumers and 
we need you
! 
Consumers’ identities are not included in traditional lending data so aspects about the LGBTQ+ (lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer or questioning, intersex, asexual, and + to recognize the limitless sexual orientations and gender identities used by members of the community) community’s needs, status, and gaps are too often overlooked. With information about credit access, financial wellbeing, and the credit health of LBGTQ+ consumers so limited, organizations have not had the needed data to develop tools and resources specific to the needs of the community. 
This study* will help us better understand the overall credit health of LGBTQ+ participants and reveal areas of success and inequity. The intention is to help companies, organizations, nonprofits, and others create programs and resources to help improve overall credit health and awareness for LGBTQ+ consumers.  
Join this initiative by participating in the study to financially empower the LGBTQ+ community. Once completed we would also encourage you to please share this opportunity with members of your organization’s ERG and community. The more information we can collect, the more financial empowerment we can deliver to the LGBTQ+ community!  
﻿
As an incentive, participants who complete the survey will gain access to Experian’s credit monitoring services, as well as your monthly FICO score—both essential ingredients in building a strong financial foundation to create a future where you and your community thrive. 
Participate in the Study
 
*As a leading information services company, some of Experian’s chief priorities include protecting and ensuring the accuracy of consumer information. The integrity of our data is critical and aligns with efforts to advocate for financial inclusion for everyone.
 
 
 
A Day of Transformation: Out & Equal Hosts 2023 LGBTQI+ APAC Forum
 
On July 11
th
 Out & Equal partnered with 
Pride Circle
, India’s premier diversity and inclusion organization, to host the 
2023 LGBTQI+ APAC Forum: A Day of Transformation
 
in Bangalore, India. 
﻿
The inaugural LGBTQI+ APAC Forum united nearly 300 change agents from ten countries: India, Australia, China, Japan, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, and the United States. Influential leaders with roles in Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEIB), Human Resources (HR) and, Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) were brought together to strategize on innovative approaches to LGBTQ+ DEIB policies and practices, making for an epic day of transformation.  
 
Download the full recap
 
 
More APAC Impact! 
﻿
Out & Equal Hosts LGBTQI+ Workplace Inclusion Leadership Symposium and Corporate-Community Roundtable  
Two days after the 2023 LGBTQI+ APAC Forum, Out & Equal, in partnership with Pride Circle, organized a half-day “LGBTQI+ Workplace Inclusion Leadership Symposium,” followed by a “Corporate-Community Roundtable” in Hyderabad, India.  
 
The LGBTQI+ Workplace Inclusion Leadership Symposium centered around the theme of “Leading with Authenticity” and leveraged the knowledge of local expert and session speaker, Harsha Ravikumar (he/him), ERG GLEAM Co-Lead, Microsoft, alongside Out & Equal APAC Manager, Akriti Rana (she/her). This informative session was followed by an intimate, thirty-person Corporate Community Roundtable in which local community leaders working towards LGBTQI+ workplace inclusion facilitated constructive dialogue toward shared goals, agenda alignment, and best practices for hiring and retaining LGBTQI+ talent.  
 
 
Eliminating the “Lavender Ceiling” Once and For All!
 
  
LGBTQ+ leaders may face a “lavender” or “pink” ceiling,” that is, an unofficial limit to their advancement in the workplace. These limits and barriers result from a confluence of overt and subtle bias, structural inequalities, and broader stereotypes that manifest as career blocks.   
﻿
Out & Equal and Korn Ferry surveyed over 130 out-at-work LGBTQ+ and allied leaders about their careers and workplace experiences with openness at work, workplace relationships, and mentorship opportunities. 
The full report will be released in September.
Read a preview of the report

subject: Watch Now: Tackling the Environmental Health & Safety Challenges of a Remote Workforce
body:
Employees working remotely create health and safety challenges for organizations, and the issue can be more acute in small to mid–sized organizations where it is common for one individual to wear several hats, including safety coordinator. 
View in browser
 
 
Tackling the Environmental Health & Safety Challenges of a Remote Workforce
 
On Demand
 
Employees working remotely create health and safety challenges for organizations, and the issue can be more acute in small to mid–sized organizations where it is common for one individual to wear several hats, including safety coordinator. With almost 92 million Americans working from home at least one day a week, companies struggle with how to keep employees working virtually safe, healthy and productive.
 
Join
 Andrea Foster-Mack, product director, EHS eLearning at Traliant, for a 45-minute webinar addressing how companies can effectively meet their responsibilities under OSHA to provide a healthy and safe work environment for employees working from home, coffee shops or on the move. Andrea will share best practices learned during her 17 years of combined EHS experience working with the Department of Labor, OSHA, CDC & US Senate/House subcommittees for safety and health. Learn valuable tips for empowering remote and hybrid employees to become safety advocates for themselves and co-workers.
 
The webinar will cover: 
Employer’s responsibilities under OSHA’s General Duty Clause for Remote Workers
Common EHS hazards for employees working remotely 
Building a safety culture  
Reimagining EHS strategies and training for a remote/hybrid workforce 
Empowering employees to become safety advocates 
Implementing Job Hazard Analysis 
Filing a workplace incident report

body:
On Weds. August 23, Talent Management will host its next Breakfast Club event, AI and Machine Learning in HR: Transforming Talent Management Strategies. 
 
AI and Machine Learning in HR: Transforming Talent Management Strategies
 
On Weds. August 23, Talent Management will host its next 
Breakfast Club event, AI and Machine Learning in HR: Transforming Talent Management Strategies
.
 Join Talent Management and our expert panelists as we discuss how to best implement these technologies, their transformative impact and how AI and machine learning can provide deeper insights into organizations.
 
Diane August, chief learning architect with Nationwide Insurance
,
 
will lead the discussion as panel moderator.
  
 
 
Diane August serves as senior consultant-learning excellence (chief learning architect) at Nationwide Insurance, enterprise talent development team. Her role is to provide thought leadership on learning strategy, best practices and standards, and learner experience excellence. August’s current focus is on Future of Work Center initiatives including upskilling, reskilling and experiential learning.
 
She also created Nationwide’s initial learning architecture including design principles, solution types and learning levels, evolving it to the current architecture used for the Future Capability/Skills Development initiative. She previously served at Nationwide as the director of IT learning and development and owned her own instructional design consulting firm for 15 years.
 
Don’t miss your chance to join the conversation with Diane and our expert panelists!

subject: Learn More About Our Day 2 Keynote Speaker - CLO Symposium
body:
Ruth Gotian, chief learning officer for Weill Cornell Medicine, delivers her keynote address, "The Success Factor — Developing the Mindset and Skill Set for Peak Performance," on Tuesday, October 17, during the 2023 CLO Symposium.
 
Dear Ashton,
 
High achievers share the same four attributes: intrinsic motivation, perseverance, a strong foundation and constant learning through informal means. The key to their success is that they do all four of these things in tandem.

subject: Solving Safety Challenges for a Remote Workforce
body:
Employees working remotely create health and safety challenges for organizations, and the issue can be more acute in small to mid–sized organizations where it is common for one individual to wear several hats, including safety coordinator. 
View in browser
 
 
Tackling the Environmental Health & Safety Challenges of a Remote Workforce
 
TOMORROW, July 26, at 1 p.m CT
 
Employees working remotely create health and safety challenges for organizations, and the issue can be more acute in small to mid–sized organizations where it is common for one individual to wear several hats, including safety coordinator. With almost 92 million Americans working from home at least one day a week, companies struggle with how to keep employees working virtually safe, healthy and productive.
 
Join
 Andrea Foster-Mack, product director, EHS eLearning at Traliant, for a 45-minute webinar addressing how companies can effectively meet their responsibilities under OSHA to provide a healthy and safe work environment for employees working from home, coffee shops or on the move. Andrea will share best practices learned during her 17 years of combined EHS experience working with the Department of Labor, OSHA, CDC & US Senate/House subcommittees for safety and health. Learn valuable tips for empowering remote and hybrid employees to become safety advocates for themselves and co-workers.
 
The webinar will cover: 
Employer’s responsibilities under OSHA’s General Duty Clause for Remote Workers
Common EHS hazards for employees working remotely 
Building a safety culture  
Reimagining EHS strategies and training for a remote/hybrid workforce 
Empowering employees to become safety advocates 
Implementing Job Hazard Analysis 
Filing a workplace incident report

subject: Join Talent Management at our Next Breakfast Club - Aug. 30
body:
How can companies and organizations expand their talent pool during record low unemployment and the Great Resignation?
 
Recruiting talent and retaining talent in an ever-changing job market requires adaptability and new avenues for identifying potential employees. How can companies and organizations expand their talent pool during record low unemployment and the Great Resignation?
 
Fortunately, there are more than 27 million people in the U.S alone who are looking and willing to work but may be excluded by the hiring practices in use by the organizations who could benefit from their skills. These “hidden workers’ represent marginalized groups, caregivers, veterans and those lacking traditional qualifications.
 
Learn how your organizations can identify and recruit this talent at the 
Aug. 30, Talent Management Breakfast Club, Tapping Into Untapped Talent.

subject: Modernizing IT Skilling: Join Our Webinar Today!
body:
Join us for an engaging webinar that explores the power of modernizing IT skilling through collaborative learning!
View in browser
 
 
Igniting IT Skilling for the Modern Era: Success through Collaborative Learning
 
TODAY, July 20, at 1 p.m CT
 
Join us
 for an engaging webinar that explores the power of modernizing IT skilling through collaborative learning! 
 
Organizations are facing budget constraints amid fears of recession, and many will need to explore more focused approaches to bridging skills gaps, according to a recent Harvard Business Review article. One of the biggest developments in this space is the rise of cohort-based learning. Discover how Brian Cator, vice president of software engineering at CoreLogic, partnered with Eric Truong, associate director of digital learning at Cognizant, to implement this innovative approach to address IT skills gaps and drastically improve IT learning initiatives on a global level. 
 
In this webinar, we’ll explore real-world examples of IT skilling challenges and overcoming the nuances of managing global diverse teams with complex needs and unique cultural dynamics. From experienced programmers to fresh graduates, CoreLogic had to design a training program that catered to a wide range of skill levels and language backgrounds while keeping up with rapidly evolving advancements in technology. Learn the strategies used for building successful and scalable learning programs that fostered peer collaboration and increased engagement and productivity among both experienced and novice programmers. 
 
Not only will we dive into the benefits of modernizing your IT skilling program, but also the tangible results and success metrics that were achieved to guide the audience on how to tackle and transform their own IT skilling efforts. Reserve your seat now! 
 
Learning Objectives: 
Understand common challenges in implementing global IT-based learning initiatives and how to overcome them.
Learn the benefits of modernized IT skilling through collaborative learning.
Explore best practices for interactive and collaborative learning to drive scalable success for IT skilling across diverse teams.

subject: Tapping Into Untapped Talent | Aug. 30 TM Breakfast Club
body:
On Weds, Aug. 30, Talent Management (TM) will host another edition of its Breakfast Club series, Tapping Into Untapped Talent.
 
On Weds, Aug. 30, Talent Management (TM) will host another edition of its Breakfast Club series, Tapping Into Untapped Talent. BetterWork Media Group’s (BMG) Breakfast Club series is now in its 18th year of facilitating discussions, keynotes and events to align learning and development with business strategy.
Tapping Into Untapped Talent
 
2020 research from Accenture and Harvard Business School explores the phenomenon of “hidden workers,” or the millions of people who want to work and are actively seeking work, but who remain “hidden” from most businesses by the very processes those companies use to find talent. The research estimates there are more than 27 million hidden workers in the U.S. alone and includes caregivers, veterans, immigrants and refugees, people with physical disabilities, relocating partners and spouses, those with mental health or developmental/neurodiversity challenges, those from disadvantaged backgrounds or populations, people who were previously incarcerated and those lacking traditional qualifications.
 
As record lows in unemployment and the Great Resignation continue to limit workforce growth, how can organizations connect with this hidden talent and what needs to change in existing recruitment practices?
Each mini-event lasts about two hours and consists of a 60-minute panel discussion with L&D and talent practitioners, a 20-minute FASTtalk presentation and a 20-minute research segment, garnering real-time data from attendees and prompting discussion of the day’s themes, followed by closing remarks from me, Talent Management’s editor-in-chief.
 
We hope that you can join us.
 
Ashley St. John
Founder, Chief Content Officer & Editor-in-Chief
BetterWork Media Group, parent company of Chief Learning Officer & Talent Management

 / 11:00 a.m. – 12:00 p.m. ET
 
Webinar on July 26: What Actions Can Organizations Take To Lead Intentionally Post-Affirmative Action?
 
Hi Ashton,
On Wednesday, July 26, join Catalyst and a panel of expert speakers from NYU School of Law and Chevron to discuss the corporate implications of the US Supreme Court's recent affirmative action ruling.
Undeniably, this decision will have a ripple effect on the workplace. Companies need to start preparing now on how to best respond to ensure their DEI initiatives are protected and sustained.

For the second year in a row, Catalyst brought together virtually our employee resource group (ERG) community to gain critical ERG lessons from leaders at Bank of America, Humana, SHRM, and more.  
﻿
The event gathered hundreds of global ERG leaders, members, sponsors, HR professionals, and CEOs. Some key takeaways include: Provide value to ERG leaders, connect ERGs to employees’ sense of purpose, and, if you’re a senior leader, support ERGs by getting out of the way.  
Read more highlights
. 
 
Also Coming Up
 
 
 
GET TICKETS AND PACKAGES
 
 
Tickets and packages are now on sale for Canada's premier diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) event, the 2023 Catalyst Honours, taking place on 15 November.

subject: Learn How to Build a Safety Culture
body:
With almost 92 million Americans working from home at least one day a week, companies struggle with how to keep employees working virtually safe, healthy and productive.
View in browser
 
 
Tackling the Environmental Health & Safety Challenges of a Remote Workforce
 
Wednesday, July 26, at 1 p.m CT
 
Employees working remotely create health and safety challenges for organizations, and the issue can be more acute in small to mid–sized organizations where it is common for one individual to wear several hats, including safety coordinator. With almost 92 million Americans working from home at least one day a week, companies struggle with how to keep employees working virtually safe, healthy and productive.
 
Join
 Andrea Foster-Mack, product director, EHS eLearning at Traliant, for a 45-minute webinar addressing how companies can effectively meet their responsibilities under OSHA to provide a healthy and safe work environment for employees working from home, coffee shops or on the move. Andrea will share best practices learned during her 17 years of combined EHS experience working with the Department of Labor, OSHA, CDC & US Senate/House subcommittees for safety and health. Learn valuable tips for empowering remote and hybrid employees to become safety advocates for themselves and co-workers.
 
The webinar will cover: 
Employer’s responsibilities under OSHA’s General Duty Clause for Remote Workers
Common EHS hazards for employees working remotely 
Building a safety culture  
Reimagining EHS strategies and training for a remote/hybrid workforce 
Empowering employees to become safety advocates 
Implementing Job Hazard Analysis 
Filing a workplace incident report

subject: Ashton, an invitation for a select group of leaders
body:
It’s time to effect transformative change.
View in browser
 
It’s time to effect transformative change. 
 
 
Ashton, 
Motivated to uncover new ways of solving challenges you face within your organization? This email is for you. 
NYU Steinhardt is currently seeking a select group of leaders to explore its distinguished 
EdD in Leadership and Innovation
 program, wherein executives from diverse industries converge to exchange ideas and learn how to tackle their respective obstacles. 
Accelerated Model 
Unlike other doctoral programs, the EdD program can be completed at an accelerated pace in as few as 24 consecutive months. 
Get the details about the EdD
 
Real-World Impact 
In place of a dissertation, you'll work on a Problem of Practice. With insights from faculty and your peers, you'll use an academic lens to examine real-life organizational challenges and explore solutions. 
How the program works
 
GRE Not Required 
Applicants must have a bachelor’s and master’s degree, plus at least seven years of work experience in a leadership role. 
Learn more about the application process
 
 
“The beauty of this EdD degree is I'm doing research with really talented and brilliant minds and applying it to my work. The return is measurable.” 
Neil Persaud, EdD ’22

A Blueprint for a Skills-Based L&D Strategy
 
The latest industry research in learning and development nowadays points to a growing list of benefits of a skills-based approach — such as stronger and more equitable talent attraction and a more agile workforce among others
But how does your organization define skills and what comes next? While every organization’s journey to becoming skills-based will undoubtedly look different, there are, nevertheless, best practices and approaches emerging from across the L&D industry.

subject: Read Fair360's Latest Meeting in a Box on Advancing Supplier Diversity!
body:
Meeting in a Box
 | 
Career Advice
 | 
Webinars
 | 
Education
Quote of the day
“Never be limited by other people’s limited imaginations.” 
—Mae Jemison
 
Today's Topics: 
Meeting in a Box: Advancing Supplier Diversity
Career Advice: Joanna Kraynek
Jefferson Health's Supply Chain Connect
-The Fair360 Staff
MEETING IN A BOX
 
Meeting in a Box: Advancing Supplier Diversity for Sustainable Success
 
Unlocking the full potential of supplier diversity has become a paramount goal for forward-thinking organizations across industries. In this Meeting in a Box, Fair360 shares best practices for operating an effective supplier diversity program, the top companies for supplier diversity and metrics to assess success.  
 
This resource also includes a timeline of key supplier diversity events, facts and figures from Fair360’s Top 50 Companies for Diversity and how companies can leverage minority- and women-owned business enterprises to bridge the supplier diversity gap in some sectors.   
 
Use this Meeting in a Box as a tool to continue your employees’ understanding of the relevance of supplier diversity.   
DOWNLOAD
 
CAREER ADVICE
 
Career Advice: Joanna Kraynek
 
In this week’s installment of our Career Advice video series, Fair360’s Linda Bell interviewed Joanna Kraynek, Trust Solutions Partner, CPA and Parenting Inclusion Network Leader at PwC (a Fair360 Hall of Fame company). Kraynek shared her advice for achieving work-life balance, what has kept her at PwC for almost three decades and how being nimble has contributed to her success. 
 
WATCH
 
RECENT NEWS
 
Jefferson Health Reimagines Supplier Diversity With Supply Chain Connect
 
For more than four years, Bridgett Battles has managed community engagement and supplier diversity for Jefferson Health (No. 13 on the Fair360 2023 Top Hospitals and Health Systems list).
 
The Director for Community Engagement and Supplier Diversity was constantly approached by vendors of color asking how they could conduct business with Jefferson Health.
 
“One of the challenges in the industry is often MWBEs aren’t aware of open-to-bid opportunities,” she says. “The second challenge is with capacity. With an organization as large as Jefferson, MWBE’s may not be able to deliver the scale to our demands. We also must keep in mind incumbent vendors who have strong relationships with our supply chain which makes it difficult to compete.”
Read Full Article
 
  
Upcoming Webinar
July 19, 2023 | Building Your Personal Board of Directors
In this session, attendees will learn how to develop a personal Board of Directors, including strategies for building relationships with mentors, sponsors and allies.
 
Upcoming Event
2023 Women of Color and Their Allies
Join us for the 6th annual Women of Color and Allies event on September 21 at the Gaylord National Resort near Washington, D.C. Register now to learn actionable strategies and connect with professionals dedicated to inclusive workplaces.
 
In Case You Missed It
Data Dive: Analyzing Leadership Development in Fair360’s Top Companies
A deep dive into the data from Fair360’s 2023 Top 50 Companies for Diversity survey highlights companies that drive leadership development among underrepresented populations.
 
5 Biggest News Stories of the Week: June 30
This news roundup covers facts about Independence Day, the Pregnant Workers Fairness Act taking effect and more.
