subject: Q&A with Legal Experts on the Affirmative Action Decision
body:
What the Supreme Court ruling means for your company. 
 
JULY 2023
RESEARCH
 | 
EVENTS
 | 
BLOG
 | 
SUBSCRIBE
 
 
 
Ashton
,
I am continuing to reflect on last week's US Supreme Court ruling on affirmative action. This decision could have serious consequences for the work of leaders who are dedicated to advancing diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI). 
Catalyst is here to support your company
 in these challenging times.
While these headwinds are leading many to burnout and fear, this moment also presents an opportunity to build on decades of progress. Now’s the time to be proactive and use Catalyst’s research-backed, fact-based tools and practices to continue creating more equitable (and profitable) businesses.
Through conviction and action, we can and will move forward together.
 
 
 
 
Lorraine Hariton
﻿
Catalyst President & CEO
 
AFFIRMATIVE ACTION RULING: ﻿WHAT COMPANIES NEED TO KNOW
 
Catalyst spoke with NYU legal experts 
Kenji Yoshino 
and
 
David Glasgow
 to 
learn more about how companies should be preparing now to protect their DEI efforts. 
"It is critical to maintain DEI initiatives; the key is to do so in a smart and responsible manner," they said
.
Read the full conversation
.  
Learn more by 
attending our July 26 webinar
.
 
CONVICTION AND ACTION: WHERE TO START
 
 
“We see [DEI] fatigue when companies do not invest in the skillsets of vulnerability and connection,” says Audrey Gallien, former Senior Director of Catalyst’s Learning & Advisory Services. 
Learn more about the phenomenon of “diversity fatigue”
 and how companies can combat it. 
 
WHY IT'S IMPORTANT
 
LGBTQ+ rights are under attack in the US and elsewhere. 
Read how Catalyst Supporter TD Bank
 is standing up to support its employees through concrete policies and practices (Supporter-exclusive).
Would you recognize a microaggression if you witnessed one? This phenomenon can be a major cause of stress for employees from marginalized groups. Enroll your team in our 
two-hour workshop
 to learn respectful intervention tactics.
Burnout is a psychological and physical exhaustion caused by prolonged stress, and organizations must tackle it as a systemic issue. Learn how with this 
Supporter-exclusive overview
.
Employees with childcare responsibilities often find the summer months—when school is out for the season
—
particularly difficult. To offer more support in these challenging times, we surveyed Catalyst staff and found 
11 key ways to keep kids engaged
. 
 
CATALYST IN THE NEWS
 
Recent news coverge featuring Catalyst experts and research:
Forbes | 
Fortune 500 Board Seats for Women and People of Color Surge—But There's Still Progress Needed, Report Says
 
Authority Magazine | 
Julie Nugent of Catalyst on How to Create More Inclusive Workplaces
 
Talent Canada | 
Diversity is a Fact. Inclusion is a Choice. Kindness is the Key
.
Context News | 
She-suite: African Women Lead the Way in Global Boardrooms
 
 
UPCOMING CATALYST EVENTS
 
 
July 26 | Webinar
US Supreme Court Affirmative Action Ruling and the Future of DEI in Corporate America
Join Catalyst and our panel of expert speakers who will discuss the actions organizations can take to lead intentionally during this pivotal time.
﻿
Carefully assess and understand the impact of the Affirmative Action decision on the workplace.
Identify ways to sustain your DEI initiatives and ensure a diverse pool in hiring and succession planning.
Preempt potential pitfalls in the current climate and effectively manage legal and business risks.
REGISTER FOR THE WEBINAR
 
 
 
 
15 November | Online & In Person | Toronto
2023 Catalyst Honours
Individual tickets and ticket packages are now available for Catalyst's premier annual event in Canada, the 2023 Catalyst Honours.
Taking place on 15 November in Toronto and online, this exclusive hybrid event celebrates individuals who are making exceptional progress on DEI in their workplaces and gathers hundreds of other corporate leaders from across Canada and the world. Learn more about our growing agenda and speakers list and register today.
Catalyst Honours attendees will also have the opportunity to gain 
up to 4.75 personal development credits
 
for SHRM-CP® or SHRM-SCP® recertification activities.
 
GET TICKETS AND PACKAGES
 
 
SEE ALL EVENTS
 
 
 
 
* 
A note to our readers:
 There will be no C-News or Catalyst Connects newsletter in August. We will return in September. Thank you.
 
CONNECT WITH CATALYST
 
Don’t forget to follow Catalyst on social media for daily updates on our work.  
  
  
  
 
 
 
About Catalyst
Catalyst
 is a global nonprofit supported by many of the world’s most powerful CEOs and leading companies to help build workplaces that work for women. Founded in 1962, Catalyst drives change with preeminent thought leadership, actionable solutions, and a galvanized community of multinational corporations to accelerate and advance women into leadership—because progress for women is progress for everyone.

subject: Coachability Insights from the Mission to Mars–and More
body:
The next CLO Breakfast Club of 2023: Brick by Brick: Building a Coachability Culture, will take place on Weds, July 26, 2023.
View in browser
 
 
Brick by Brick: Building a Coachability Culture
 
Wednesday, July 26, at 11 a.m. ET
 
Take part in our discussion of coachability and organizational culture with learning and development professionals from around the globe during the next CLO Breakfast Club of 2023: Building a Coachability Culture. The panel is joined by 
Jake Weiss, Ph.D.,
 industrial-organizational psychologist and president & CEO of Coachability Consultants Inc.
 
Focusing on coaching, employee coachability and organizational cultures in his current role, Jake bridges the scientist-practitioner gap and brings best-in-class, evidence-based engagements to clients. Prior to his current role, Jake served at Inteflex, Inc., where he conducted innovative research to inform the creation of its advanced managerial coaching development workshops across the health sciences, bioPharma, and biotech industries. Before – and during – his tenure at Inteflex, Jake worked on multiple NASA-funded initiatives to uncover optimal crew composition and necessary team processes for Long-duration Space Exploration (LDSE) to inform and maximize the mission to Mars.
 
Join Jake, fellow panelists and learning and development practitioners on Tues, July 26.

subject: Empowering Women Leaders: Design, Impact, Success
body:
Inclusive organizations outperform those that are not. One of the largest groups of underrepresented leaders is women. 
 
Developing an Impactful Women’s Leadership Program
 
Tuesday, August 1, at 11 a.m CT
 
Inclusive organizations outperform those that are not. One of the largest groups of underrepresented leaders is women. Building a program that develops leadership acumen, empowers women leaders to exert greater influence, advocates for development of the teams they lead and promotes a culture of learning and development should be the framework for developing a women’s leadership program.
This program should help all women leaders navigate the business landscape and provide roles of greater influence and contribution. An additional outcome is an expanding network of connections, coaches and mentors. Leaders completing the program should gain a greater appreciation of behaviors and strategies that enhance leadership in the workplace and positively impact success for women.
This webinar will provide an overview of a successful women’s leadership program: How it was designed, how it was leveraged and the impact on the women leaders who completed the program.
 
Learning objectives:
Assess the current climate of female diversity in your organization — it’s not just about the numbers.
Determine where you will start. Effectively assess budget, scope and engagement constraints.
Determine the critical foundations for your organization’s program.
Evaluate your program’s impact.

body:

2023 WOCA Registration
Onboarding and Supporting Transgender Employees
-The Fair360 Staff
LEADERSHIP
 
Data Dive: Analyzing Leadership Development in Fair360’s Top Companies
 
A deep dive into the data from Fair360’s 2023 Top 50 Companies for Diversity survey shows a comprehensive picture regarding leadership development. 
According to the Top 50 survey, a significant disparity exists in how companies measure the success of high potentials. High potentials are identified as having the necessary skills to move into a leadership or management role. The data reveals that 83% of Hall of Fame companies, 90% of Top 10 companies and 92% of Top 50 companies track progress in developmental programs.  
Read Full Article
 
CAREER ADVICE
 
Career Advice: Maxine Swayne
 
In this week’s installment of our Career Advice video series, Fair360’s Linda Bell interviewed Maxine Swayne, Chief Administrative Officer, Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at U.S. Bank (No. 11 on the Fair360 2023 Top 50 Companies for Diversity list). Swayne spoke about her work on corporate boards, the role of environmental, social and governance (ESG) in attracting and retaining talent and what gives her the most career fulfillment.
WATCH
 
UPCOMING EVENT
 
WOCA Registration Is Now Open
 
We hope you have your calendars marked because we’re weeks away from Fair360’s 6th Annual Women of Color and Their Allies (WOCA) event.
On September 21, 2023, Fair360 will host Women of Color and Their Allies live from the Gaylord National Resort, just outside Washington, D.C., from 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. EST and include a networking cocktail reception to round out the day.
This innovative and interactive event has become the go-to conference for leaders to discover best practices, learn actionable strategies and engage with hundreds of professionals committed to creating inclusive and equitable workplaces.
REGISTER
 
BEST PRACTICES
 
A Guide to Onboarding and Supporting Transgender Employees
 
In today’s evolving society, not only is creating an inclusive and supportive workplace for all employees a moral imperative, but it is also a strategic advantage for organizations. As societal awareness and understanding of gender identity progress, businesses must embrace inclusivity and ensure that transgender individuals feel valued, respected and empowered in the workplace.
 
This guide aims to provide companies with practical insights, strategies and best practices for onboarding and retaining transgender employees in the workplace.

There is just two weeks left until nominations close for 
Consulting Magazine
’s 
Women Leaders in Consulting 2023 Awards
 and this is your reminder to nominate!
This year’s awards has new team & firm categories which recognizes female-led teams who are making a profound difference for their firms, clients, future women leaders and entrants to the profession. Categories include:
Retaining Female Talent
In an industry where no one can avoid the talent war, the ability to keep hold of your best people has never been so important—particularly when it comes to balancing the industry’s gender split. Many junior women leave the industry after career breaks such as maternity leave, or never feel supported enough to believe that they have a future in the profession.
ESG Initiative
This award is for firms or teams within firms that have a female lead. The team or firm must have designed or implemented ESG initiatives or programs within the firm during the past 12 months.
DEI Initiative
This award is for firms or teams within firms that have a female lead. The team or firm must have designed or implemented DEI initiatives or programs within the firm during the past 12 months.

subject: TODAY: Your Skills Journey Starts Here
body:
Skill data lends a new level of granularity to talent management, empowering organizations to be more agile as market conditions demand it.
View in browser
 
 
Your Skills Journey Starts Here
 
TODAY, June 28, at 11 a.m. CT
 
To stay competitive, it’s crucial for organizations to leverage skills data to gain deeper insights into the capabilities of their people. 
 
Skill data lends a new level of granularity to talent management, empowering organizations to be more agile as market conditions demand it.
 
Yet, initiatives focused solely on skills management can be complex to implement, time-consuming, and challenging to maintain. Legacy skills management tools are not fit for our modern era.
 
Jumping straight into the most complex skills use cases often leads projects to stall, as the questions and repercussions become overwhelming! 
 
In our 
upcoming webinar
, we'll dive into this topic and provide insights on how to get started on your skills journey. 
 
You will learn:
What to know before you launch a skills-based talent practice
How to implement a skills-based approach without compromising on your core objectives
Which technology is required and real-life examples of this tech in action
How to scale skills intelligence across the enterprise

subject: You Can Still Join Us for Today’s Breakfast Club!
body:
Chief Learning Officer’s Breakfast Club event, Mobilizing Talent for the Future, is today!
View in browser
 
 
You Can Still Join Us for Today’s Event!
 
Chief Learning Officer’s Breakfast Club event, "
Mobilizing Talent for the Future
," is today!
 
Investing in internal talent mobility has been a growing trend, and the benefits are numerous: Efforts in this area can help organizations attract and retain talent, develop more diverse pipelines, fill open roles and bridge critical skill gaps amid the labor shortage. Autonomous career paths or “tracks,” career and leadership development opportunities and growth initiatives, and knowledge, skill and resource sharing are all woven into a comprehensive internal talent mobility strategy.  
 
What new strategies and tools are emerging for internal talent mobility and career pathing at this halfway point in 2023? And how are organizations using the ever-maturing talent marketplace to match employees’ existing skills with skills needed for aspirational roles or emerging roles of the future?
 
The experts weigh in:
Jennifer Buchanan, vice president, operations and supply chain academy leader, Walmart Inc.
Amy Tenney Curren, Esq., director of attorney learning and development, Morrison Foerster LLP
Cari Bohley, vice president, talent management, Peraton
Jessica Billiet, principal consultant - workforce transformation, Pluralsight
 
We hope to see you at today's event!
 
Sincerely, 
The Chief Learning Officer Team

subject: Top LGBTQ+ Employers Live by These Practices
body:
Meeting in a Box
 | 
Career Advice
 | 
Webinars
 | 
Education
Quote of the day
"It takes no compromise to give people their rights ... it takes no money to respect the individual. It takes no political deal to give people freedom. It takes no survey to remove repression." 
—Harvey Milk
 
Today's Topics: 
Practices of Top Companies for LGBTQ+ Workers
Career Advice: Torod Neptune
Mastercard's Support of Women Entrepreneurs
Meeting in a Box: Pride Month 
-The Fair360 Staff
BEST PRACTICES
 
How Top Companies for LGBTQ+ Workers Embrace Equality, Inclusion 
 
The percentage of people who identify as gay, lesbian, transgender or bisexual rose to a new high in 2022. In today’s inclusive world, employers must foster an environment that celebrates and supports employees of all sexual orientations and gender identities.  
 
While LGBTQ+ employees worldwide have progressed in the workplace, many are experiencing unseen challenges and concealed fears at work that hinder their ability to thrive.  
 
We examined the workplace practices of five of Fair360’s Top Companies for LGBTQ Workers for insights into how they are delivering on the promise to help LGBTQ+ workers thrive and succeed. 
Read Full Article
 
CAREER ADVICE
 
Career Advice: Torod Neptune
 
In this week’s installment of our Career Advice video series, Senior Business Writer Linda Bell interviewed Torod Neptune, Senior VP & Chief Communications Officer at Medtronic (No. 2  on the Fair360 2023 Top 50 Companies for Diversity list). Neptune shared his thoughts on empathetic leadership, balancing priorities as a communications executive and the importance of mentorship.
 
WATCH
 
FEATURED PARTNER
 
How Mastercard Supports Women Entrepreneurs
 
Mastercard is dedicated to empowering women entrepreneurs by offering tailored solutions to overcome obstacles like limited access to funding. With a focus on financial inclusion, it provided solutions to 25 million women entrepreneurs in 2020, recognizing their significant contributions to economies worldwide.
Read Full Article
 
MEETING IN A BOX
 
Meeting in a Box: Pride Month 2023
 
Pride Month takes place in June to celebrate the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and related communities, the diversity of identities and their fight toward equal rights around the world. During this time, we spotlight and pay homage to the successes of LGBTQ+ people, the injustices they’ve overcome and their continued efforts to make the world a safe place for every person to be their authentic selves.
 
In this Meeting in a Box, we provide a timeline of LGBTQ+ history in the U.S. and facts and figures concerning LGBTQ+ Americans. We also examine steps companies can take to promote LGBTQ+ inclusivity and belonging at work and acknowledge LGBTQ+ people in the political sphere.
 
Share this document with your colleagues to further your team’s cultural competence education on the LGBTQ+ community.
DOWNLOAD
 
  
Upcoming Webinar
June 28, 2023 | Transitions at Work: How to Support Transgender Employees
Join our next webinar to learn practical strategies for supporting trans employees and creating a culture of acceptance and inclusion. Reserve your spot now!
 
In Case You Missed It
 
Webinar Recap: The Key to Successfully Onboarding LGBTQ+ Employees
In this webinar, Fair360 Senior Digital Copy Editor Danielle Hess and Leslie O’Harrow, Trusted Solutions Partner – Shine Network at PwC, discussed the best ways to onboard LGBTQ+ talent in a way that makes them feel seen, valued and supported.

Unlock career success with Claire Lofgren, Senior Data Analyst at KeyBank. Learn about internships, the data-driven employee experience and skill-building. Watch now!

subject: Tech in Action-Your Skills Journey Starts Here
body:
Skill data lends a new level of granularity to talent management, empowering organizations to be more agile as market conditions demand it.
View in browser
 
 
Your Skills Journey Starts Here
 
Wednesday, June 28, at 11 a.m. CT
 
To stay competitive, it’s crucial for organizations to leverage skills data to gain deeper insights into the capabilities of their people. 
 
Skill data lends a new level of granularity to talent management, empowering organizations to be more agile as market conditions demand it.
 
Yet, initiatives focused solely on skills management can be complex to implement, time-consuming, and challenging to maintain. Legacy skills management tools are not fit for our modern era.
 
Jumping straight into the most complex skills use cases often leads projects to stall, as the questions and repercussions become overwhelming! 
 
In our 
upcoming webinar
, we'll dive into this topic and provide insights on how to get started on your skills journey. 
 
You will learn:
What to know before you launch a skills-based talent practice
How to implement a skills-based approach without compromising on your core objectives
Which technology is required and real-life examples of this tech in action
How to scale skills intelligence across the enterprise

subject: Out & Equal's 2023 Pride Month Newsletter
body:
The Power of Pride
 
 
Pride Month is a time to celebrate the resilience and contributions of the LGBTQ+ community, reflect on progress made, and innovate to effectively address the work still to be done in order to achieve measurable and lasting equality.  
And while the LGBTQ+ community—with the support of allies, advocates, and authentic corporate commitments—has made great strides, we find ourselves at a critical moment. Across the United States and around the globe, the introduction of hundreds of bills and efforts to restrict the rights and freedoms of LGBTQ+ people—with a specific and bigoted focus towards transgender and nonbinary people, LGBTQ+ people of color, and their families—is a stark reminder that the fight for recognition, inclusion, and belonging is far from over. 
We all have work to do and roles to play to realize the inclusive world we seek. We must come together as a larger community of LGBTQ+ people and allies to persevere, push forward, and thrive. And while there is much hard work to be done, we must remember to celebrate and refuel with Queer joy. It’s our superpower and has given our collective community the strength to endure in the darkest of times.  
We hope the content in this special Pride Month issue of our newsletter aids in your celebrations still to come, supports the work that’s underway, and serves as a resource to drive progress, equality, and change forward.  
 
Driving Change & Building Inclusive Environments
 
 
In Pride Month and beyond, Out & Equal is committed to being a catalyst of change, 
intentionally and actively working to achieve workplace equality and belonging by supporting LGBTQ+ employees, leaders, and teams. We hope you'll find great value (and share!) everything below, this month and year-round. 
Pride Guide
Out & Equal’s 2023 Pride Guide
 is designed to embrace and amplify the remarkable beauty of a community united in love, joy, and progress, while also supporting change agents within organizations—be they individual contributors, employee resource group members, or teams—in bringing inclusive conversations and celebrations into the workplace during the month of June and throughout the year. 
 
﻿
What's Your Pronoun
Much like our individual names, pronouns are tied to our deepest sense of identity. Utilizing inclusive pronoun practices in the workplace is vital in building organizational cultures of respect and belonging not just for the LGBTQ+ community, but for anyone who in some way challenges traditionally accepted/expected models of gender identity and expression.
 
Out & Equal’s resource, 
“What’s Your Pronoun?,”
 provides practical guidance on how to implement successful practices and norms around pronouns in the workplace. 
 
Visiblity 
Visibility—in the workplace and beyond—plays a key role in shaping the narrative that individuals can be both successful 
and
 their authentic selves simultaneously. Out & Equal’s 
“How to Celebrate Transgender Day of Visibility Year-Round"
 offers organizations a helpful tool to support transgender/gender expansive community members in aspects of the workplace and beyond. 
 
Global Toolkit for Change 
Around the world, we have seen instances of the business community leading the momentum for LGBTQ+ inclusion, well ahead of legal and societal changes. Out & Equal’s 
“Global Toolkit for Change: Assessing LGBTQ+ Inclusion In Your Workplace”
 
serves as an actionable learning, self-evaluation, and self-improvement guide to support organizations identify possible gaps between policies, programs, and inclusive practices versus the day-to-day realities for employees. 
 
 
Outandequal.org
Out & Equal has an incredible library of resources dedicated to advancing LGBTQ+ equality and representation within the workplace, which can be found on 
our website
!
 
 
 
 
In Conversation with
EMILY SHILLING (she/her) 
 
 
Emily Shilling
 (she/her), Out & Equal's 2022 Corporate Advocate of the Year, & President of SPARTA, discusses how she is reflecting on Pride Month this year and highlights the critical importance—and tremendous ripple effect—of recognition and representation.  
 
Keep an eye on our blog for more conversations with trailblazers and role models from the Out & Equal community! 
And speaking of Outie Awards... 
2023 Outie Award Nominations are Open
﻿
Representation matters! Each year, 
The Outie Awards
 recognize and celebrate individuals, organizational initiatives, and employee resource groups that serve as role models in advancing equity for LGBTQ+ people in the workplace and beyond. 
 
Nominations are now open and the deadline to submit is Friday, July 7th. Winners will be announced at the closing ceremonial gala at our 
Workplace Summit
. 
 
NOMINATE TODAY
 
 
 
LGBTQ+ Is Not A Monolith: Intersectionality & Intersectional Approaches to LGBTQ+ Workplace Inclusion Matter 
 
 
Queer people of color have always played an integral role in fighting for and shaping the LGBTQ+ community. While we celebrate these pioneers as part of Pride throughout the month of June, we also are intentional in recognizing Juneteenth (June 19), a federal holiday in the United States commemorating the emancipation of enslaved African Americans. 
We celebrate Juneteenth understanding that the LGBTQ+ community is not a monolith, and in order to be most effective and impactful toward achieving measurable and lasting LGBTQ+ inclusion, we must center and recognize the unique experiences and needs of our Black community members. 
To learn more about intersectionality in the workplace, check out the content and videos within the featured sessions highlighted in Out & Equal’s, “
Practitioners for Change: Intersectionality Learning Series Resources.
”
 
 
In Other Out & Equal News
 
 
PRIDE EVENT
We are deeply grateful to have been part of the largest White House Pride event in history. 
Our very own Deena Fidas, Managing Director, Chief Programs & Partnerships Officer, joined our friends and partners from 
PFLAG
, Diego Sanchez, and 
Equality California
, Valerie Ploumpis, in a day of celebration, reflection, and Queer joy.  
 
 
PARTNER EXCLUSIVE WEBINAR
In a webinar held exclusively for our Partner community, we led an engaging discussion featuring O&E's own Deena Fidas, with Bob Witeck, President of 
Witeck
 
Communications discussing the Pride landscape in 2023 and the evolution of corporate engagement of and support for the LGBTQ+ community 
 
“
It’s not just a data point to say 90% of the Fortune 500 companies support our community. Well, what does that mean? Try to boycott a tech company that supports our community and you’ll probably be left with chalk on a side walk...You’d be hard pressed to find an industry right now that isn’t filled with companies that are fully supportive of the LGBTQ+ community.”
 
 
—Deena Fidas (she/her), Managing Director | Chief Programs and Partnerships Officer, Out & Equal
EVENT
On June 15, we delivered an amazing 
Southern States Forum
 in Mobile, Alabama, hosted by our Partner Airbus. The Forum (#SSForum2023) brought together executives, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEIB) and Human Resource (HR) practitioners, Employee Resource Group (ERG) leaders, and other workplace inclusion change-makers for interactive workshopping, peer-to-peer educational sessions, and discussions on innovative best practices including intersectionality and LGBTQ+ workplace inclusion. 
 
We’ll be sharing a more detailed recap in our next newsletter! For now, check out the inspiring “In Conversation With” blog interview with pioneer Amanda Simpson (she/her), Vice President for Research and technology at Airbus!  
READ MORE
UPCOMING EVENT
On July 11, 
Out & Equal’s 2023 LGBTQI+ APAC Forum
, is returning to an in-person gathering this year with an even wider geographic reach and an agenda designed to incorporate more diverse perspectives from across the region

subject: Career Advice: Claire Lofgren
body:
Meeting in a Box
 | 
Career Advice
 | 
Webinars
 | 
Education
Quote of the day
"Openness may not completely disarm prejudice, but it’s a good place to start." 
—Jason Collins 
 
Today's Topics: 
Career Advice
KPMG's 2023 US Impact Plan
Meeting in a Box: Pride Month 
-The Fair360 Staff
CAREER ADVICE
 
Career Advice: Claire Lofgren
 
In this week’s installment of our Career Advice video series, Senior Business Writer Linda Bell interviewed Claire Lofgren, Senior Data Analyst, Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at KeyBank. Lofgren spoke about the benefits of internships, how she leverages data to improve the employee experience and the importance of skill-building.
 
WATCH
 
FEATURED PARTNER
 
KPMG’s 2023 US Impact Plan: Fostering Integrity and Community Engagement
 
KPMG is making significant strides in its commitment to workplace fairness and environmental, social and governance (ESG) initiatives through its recently unveiled 2023 U.S. Impact Plan. 
 
The report outlines four pillars: People, Planet, Prosperity and Principles of Governance. These pillars form the basis of the firm’s approach to driving positive change. 
 
In a recent Q&A session with Elena Richards, Chief Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Officer at KPMG U.S., key insights were shared regarding the importance of each pillar in advancing the company’s DEI and ESG goals, highlighting KPMG's dedication to its employees, integrity and community impact.
Read Full Article
 
MEETING IN A BOX
 
Meeting in a Box: Pride Month 2023
 
Pride Month takes place in June to celebrate the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and related communities, the diversity of identities and their fight toward equal rights around the world. During this time, we spotlight and pay homage to the successes of LGBTQ+ people, the injustices they’ve overcome and their continued efforts to make the world a safe place for every person to be their authentic selves.
 
In this Meeting in a Box, we provide a timeline of LGBTQ+ history in the U.S. and facts and figures concerning LGBTQ+ Americans. We also examine steps companies can take to promote LGBTQ+ inclusivity and belonging at work and acknowledge LGBTQ+ people in the political sphere.
 
Share this document with your colleagues to further your team’s cultural competence education on the LGBTQ+ community.
DOWNLOAD
 
Upcoming Webinar
June 28, 2023 | Transitions at Work: How to Support Transgender Employees
Join our next webinar to learn practical strategies for supporting trans employees and creating a culture of acceptance and inclusion. Reserve your spot now!
 
In Case You Missed It
Inclusive Onboarding Best Practices: Strategies for Success
Onboarding is one of the most critical parts of the employee experience. It’s the first official interaction workers will have with their new employers. 
 
Career Advice: Eliana Nunez
Discover the inspiring career journey of Eliana Nunez, VP of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at The Cigna Group, as she shares valuable insights on employee resource groups, volunteerism and her 40 years with the company.

Mobilizing Talent for the Future
 
Tuesday, June 27, at 11 a.m. ET
 
On Tues, June 27, Chief Learning Officer will host its next Breakfast Club: 
Mobilizing Talent for the Future
. Jessica Billiet, principal consultant - workforce transformation at Pluralsight joins the discussion.
 
Jessica Billiet
 
has been designing, building and leading excellent learning experiences for more than 10 years. As a principal consultant at Pluralsight, she enjoys empowering people to transform their organizations so employees have the means to unlock their potential and thrive. Jessica’s struggles with poverty in her early life shaped a core belief that talent exists everywhere, but opportunities are scarce. With a heavy focus on organizational psychology and user experience design, Jessica believes in inspiring others to take charge of their career. 
 
Join Jessica and other thought-leaders on June 27, when they’ll discuss new emerging strategies and tools for internal talent mobility and career pathing, and how organizations are using the ever-maturing talent marketplace to match employees’ existing skills with skills needed for aspirational roles or emerging roles of the future.
 
Sincerely,

subject: Brick by Brick: Building a Coachability Culture
body:
On Wednesday, July 26, Chief Learning Officer (CLO) will host its next Breakfast Club. Now in its 18th year, BetterWork Media Group’s (BMG) Breakfast Club series continues its work in connecting leaders over breakfast to strengthen the link between learning and development and business strategy.
View in browser
 
 
Brick by Brick: Building a Coachability Culture
 
Wednesday, July 26, at 11 a.m. ET
 
On Wednesday, July 26, Chief Learning Officer (CLO) will host its next Breakfast Club. Now in its 18th year, BetterWork Media Group’s (BMG) Breakfast Club series continues its work in connecting leaders over breakfast to strengthen the link between learning and development and business strategy.
Brick by Brick: Building a Coachability Culture
 
Organizational investment in coaching has grown substantially in recent years, with good reason: Businesses need managers who can lead teams through change, stress and economic upheaval. And executive coaching can prepare leaders and leadership teams for transition and growth and help them level up their management skills.
 
However, a growing body of research indicates that focusing on coaching without coachability may prove costly. Highly coachable leaders have been found to foster greater levels of employee engagement and retention, and research shows highly coachable individuals achieve significantly higher levels of performance, agility and promotability.
 
Join CLO for this deep dive into the compelling case for coachability.
Each mini-event lasts about two hours and consists of a 60-minute panel discussion with L&D and talent practitioners, a 20-minute FASTtalk presentation and a 20-minute research segment, garnering real-time data from attendees and prompting discussion of the day’s themes, followed by closing remarks from BetterWork Media Group’s editorial staff.
 
We hope that you can join us.
 
Ashley St. John
Founder, Chief Content Officer & Editor-in-Chief
BetterWork Media Group, parent company of Chief Learning Officer & Talent Management

subject: In 15 Minutes: Boosting Workforce Efficiency
body:
The global economy is starting a downturn. Efficiency will be the top priority of organizations. That means employees will be expected to do more, with less.
View in browser
 
 
Workflow Learning: The Key to Digital Upskilling and Better Productivity
 
 
TODAY, June 13, at 11 a.m CT
 
The global economy is starting a downturn. Efficiency will be the top priority of organizations. That means employees will be expected to do more, with less. Work happens on software in the modern workplace. For businesses, it is critical to empower their workforces to get the best out of their software application stack to be more efficient and productive.
 
For L&D leaders, there is a pressing need to demonstrate learning that translates to performance. "Digital upskilling" will have to be done at scale, especially for a distributed workforce. Learning needs to happen in the flow of work, without pulling people from their work environment. Learning needs to be continuous and personalized at scale, to improve knowledge retention. Learning can’t be disjointed. It must go beyond one single task or action at a given time to connect end-to-end processes to deliver integrated experiences that accelerate productivity. 
 
This session will discuss ideas on how L&D can implement workflow learning to digitally upskill their workforces and help improve real business outcomes with better efficiency and productivity.
 
Key takeaways: 
Identify ways to demonstrate how learning can impact performance.
Ideas on how to effectively implement workflow learning.
Understand how digital adoption platforms help L&D to digitally upskill their workforces with workflow learning and help improve productivity.

subject: Achieving Optimal Results Through Inclusive Onboarding Practices
body:
Meeting in a Box
 | 
Career Advice
 | 
Webinars
 | 
Education
Quote of the day
"You can't let your failures define you. You have to let your failures teach you." 
—Barack Obama
 
Today's Topics: 
Inclusive Onboarding
Career Advice
Eli Lilly's Latest ESG Report
Meeting in a Box: Pride Month 
-The Fair360 Staff
BEST PRACTICES
 
Inclusive Onboarding Best Practices: Strategies for Success
 
First impressions matter. Onboarding is one of the most critical parts of the employee experience. It’s the first official interaction workers will have with their new employers. 
 
Not only does an inclusive onboarding process positively impact employee satisfaction, retention, productivity and engagement, but it also contributes to a favorable employer brand. Yet, only 12% of employees believe their organization does a great job onboarding new employees, according to research from Gallup. 
 
“The result of onboarding is that the individual is confident of their ability to succeed, has the tools and knowledge to enable them to succeed and that they’re engaged and driven to succeed,” says Doug Hammond, Division President, Randstad Inhouse Services at Randstad USA (No.16 on the Fair360 2023 Top 50 Companies for Diversity list). “If you don’t deliver on those three, you will fail.” 
 
Read Full Article
 
CAREER ADVICE
 
Career Advice: Eliana Nunez
 
In this week’s installment of our Career Advice video series, Senior Business Writer Linda Bell spoke with Eliana Nunez, VP of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at The Cigna Group (No. 14 on the Fair360 2023 Top 50 Companies for Diversity list). Nunez shared insights on her 40-year career at Cigna, the benefits of employee resource groups and her passion for volunteerism.
 
WATCH
 
FEATURED PARTNER
 
Eli Lilly’s Latest ESG Report Highlights Progress Toward Sustainability Goals
 
Eli Lilly and Company recently published its latest Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) report, highlighting its progress towards ambitious sustainability goals.
 
These highlights include:
 
The company achieved a more than 20% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions between 2020 and 2022 despite significant business growth during the same period. Additionally, it made progress in workforce diversity, with minority group members occupying 25% of management positions in the U.S. and women holding nearly half (49%) of management positions globally.
Read Full Article
 
MEETING IN A BOX
 
Meeting in a Box: Pride Month 2023
 
Pride Month takes place in June to celebrate the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and related communities, the diversity of identities and their fight toward equal rights around the world. During this time, we spotlight and pay homage to the successes of LGBTQ+ people, the injustices they’ve overcome and their continued efforts to make the world a safe place for every person to be their authentic selves.
 
In this Meeting in a Box, we provide a timeline of LGBTQ+ history in the U.S. and facts and figures concerning LGBTQ+ Americans. We also examine steps companies can take to promote LGBTQ+ inclusivity and belonging at work and acknowledge LGBTQ+ people in the political sphere.
 
Share this document with your colleagues to further your team’s cultural competence education on the LGBTQ+ community.
DOWNLOAD
 
Upcoming Webinar
June 14, 2023 | The Key to Successfully Onboarding LGBTQ+ Employees
Uncover the power of onboarding in talent acquisition and the employee experience. Join us for our next webinar to explore LGBTQ+ inclusivity and support structures. Reserve your spot now!
 
In Case You Missed It
Career Advice: Saira Mazhar
In this Career Advice video, Senior Business Writer Linda Bell spoke with Saira Mazhar, Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Manager at Southern Company. 
 
5 Biggest News Stories of the Week: June 2
This news roundup covers GLAAD's "Accelerating Acceptance" report, the latest jobs report from the BLS and more.
Did you enjoy today's email?
We appreciate your feedback. Click the image below.

subject: How to Scale Skills Intelligence Across the Enterprise
body:
To stay competitive, it’s crucial for organizations to leverage skills data to gain deeper insights into the capabilities of their people. 
View in browser
 
 
Your Skills Journey Starts Here
 
Wednesday, June 28, at 11 a.m. CT
 
To stay competitive, it’s crucial for organizations to leverage skills data to gain deeper insights into the capabilities of their people. 
 
Skill data lends a new level of granularity to talent management, empowering organizations to be more agile as market conditions demand it.
 
Yet, initiatives focused solely on skills management can be complex to implement, time-consuming, and challenging to maintain. Legacy skills management tools are not fit for our modern era.
 
Jumping straight into the most complex skills use cases often leads projects to stall, as the questions and repercussions become overwhelming! 
 
In our 
upcoming webinar
, we'll dive into this topic and provide insights on how to get started on your skills journey. 
 
You will learn:
 
What to know before you launch a skills-based talent practice
How to implement a skills-based approach without compromising on your core objectives
Which technology is required and real-life examples of this tech in action
How to scale skills intelligence across the enterprise

subject: How to Develop a Coaching Program Tied to Larger Organizational Initiatives
body:
While facing challenges including limited budget and securing support from leadership, HR and L&D teams must get creative to solve organizational challenges with less.
 
Leadership (Re)Development: Integrating Your Coaching Program to Drive Organizational Impact
 
TODAY, June 6, at 1 p.m CT
 
While facing challenges including limited budget and securing support from leadership, HR and L&D teams must get creative to solve organizational challenges with less. In this resource constrained environment, it’s important to leverage tools and development tactics that are able to solve multiple challenges at once. 
 
During this webinar, Torch's head of behavioral science insights Elizabeth Weingarten will be joined by Tiffany Price, senior director of HR at Blueprint Test Prep to learn how she overcame those challenges. Tiffany will share how she has leveraged scaled coaching, integrated across her organization, as a kind of development Swiss army knife. By integrating coaching across the organization, Tiffany has seen positive results including increased performance, engagement and retention rates. 
 
This session is part of Leadership (Re)Development, Torch’s conversation series that shares stories about the evolution of leadership development within organizations to become more inclusive, integrated and impactful.
 
During this session you’ll learn: 
How to gain support from leadership to scale coaching across an organization
How to think about measuring the impact of your coaching program
Actionable ways to leverage coaching as a part of your greater people development strategies
How to develop a coaching program that is tied to larger organizational initiatives

body:
The State of DEIB, Learning and Talent Management reports all proved the modern workforce is still managing and making sense of the many changes, evolutions and events experienced throughout the last few years.
 
The State of DEIB, Learning and Talent Management Reports Are Now Available
 
The State of DEIB, Learning and Talent Management reports all proved the modern workforce is still managing and making sense of the many changes, evolutions and events experienced throughout the last few years. To summarize:
 
A first review from BMG’s Research of DEI’s progression and status, the 
State of DEIB
 report suggests the positive impact of allocating resources and maintaining a consistent incremental effort in developing and/or executing DEI programs.

subject: Happy Pride Month from Catalyst
body:
Be a better LGBTQ+ ally with these Catalyst resources.
 
JUNE 2023
RESEARCH
 | 
EVENTS
 | 
BLOG
 | 
SUBSCRIBE
 
 
 
Ashton
,
As companies around the world celebrate Pride Month in June, we must stand up against efforts to oppress and harm the LGBTQ+ community. In the workplace, advance equity by ensuring that 
LGBTQ+ inclusion and allyship
 are central to your workplace culture—and by educating yourself on the barriers faced by employees of all genders. Catalyst resources in this newsletter can show you how. 
I also want to build on my comments last month about the need for companies to engage men more effectively in gender equity initiatives. Research, programs, and training from Catalyst's pioneering initiative—
Men Advocating Real Change (MARC)
—can help you begin this effort. But going beyond initial steps requires more than simply engaging men—it requires companies to build cultures of true 
gender partnership
. This newsletter also highlights key resources to help you understand what gender partnership is and why it's important.
 
 
 
 
Lorraine Hariton
﻿
Catalyst President & CEO
 
GENDER PARTNERSHIP: WHERE TO START
 
 
Gender Partnership: What, Why, How. 
Through gender partnership, everyone—regardless of gender—can be both agents and beneficiaries of systemic change. In our 
infographic
 and 
Supporter-exclusive tool
, learn the four components necessary to put gender partnership into action.  
 
WHY IT'S IMPORTANT
 
"This challenging experience revealed deep-rooted biases I had about gender roles and caregiving,"
 writes Catalyst's Ludo Gabriele, Senior Director of MARC Branding, in a recent blog post about his decision to be a full-time caregiver for his son. This Father's Day—celebrated in June in the US, UK, and Canada—
read Ludo's story
 about recommendations for supporting caregivers of all genders.
"
There is simply no substitute for sitting across from women in the MARC environment and listening to how they feel.
 Raw conversations, emotional, moving..." said former Enbridge CEO Al Monaco about MARC's interactive programming. 
Learn more about our MARC Leaders Immersive 1.5-day workshop
 (available to Supporters only) for directors through senior executives.
 
SPOTLIGHT: PRIDE MONTH
 
 
"It's easy to create fears in your own mind
... 
about how you'll be viewed or accepted after coming out,"
 said Catalyst Board Member and Dow Chairman & CEO Jim Fitterling in a conversation with Catalyst. 
Read more
 about his journey to becoming one of the few openly gay CEOs of a Fortune 500 company.
Learn key ways to be an ally
 
to different members of the LGBTQ+ community
 with our 
"I Am an Ally" infographic
.
Browse our 
one-stop-shop
 for the best Catalyst resources on LGBTQ+ inclusion
—including case studies from companies who are getting it right and guides on how to be more inclusive through your words and behaviors.
 
SPOTLIGHT: INDIGENOUS PEOPLE'S HISTORY MONTH
 
 
Nearly half of Indigenous employees in Canada feel on guard to bias in the workplace, according to 
Catalyst research
. During National Indigenous History Month in June, and Indigenous Peoples Day on June 20, become a better ally and learn about the 
unique culture and history of Indigenous Peoples in Canada
 as well as the 
systemic barriers they face in the workplace
. 
 
CATALYST IN THE NEWS
 
Recent news coverage featuring Catalyst experts and research:
Associated Press | 
For the Few Women Who Sit Atop S&P 500 Companies, Thinner Paychecks as Median Compensation Slips
 
People Management UK | 
What Employees Want from the Workplace in 2023
 
Toronto Star| 
Her Post on Sexism in the Workplace Went Viral. A Year Later, the CEO in Heels Reflects on the Comments that Sparked a Global Conversation
 
 
UPCOMING CATALYST EVENTS
 
 
June 7 | Online
enERGize (ERG Event)
Don't miss your chance next week to join hundreds of ERG leaders, members, allies, and executive sponsors at enERGize by Catalyst. 
Together you will explore
 
how ERGs can maximize impact for your business and cultural goals.
Individual tickets and Supporter-exclusive ticket packages are still available.
 
Confirmed speakers now include leaders from 
Accenture
, 
Chevron
, 
Google
, 
McDonald's Canada
, 
Zoetis
, and more!
Attendees also have the opportunity to gain 
up to 4.75 personal development credits
 
for SHRM-CP® or SHRM-SCP® recertification activities.
If you can't join on the day of the event—don't worry. All registrants will be able to access session recordings for 30 days after the event. Reserve your seat today.
 
GET TICKETS AND TICKET PACKAGES
 
 
June 14 | Webinar 
﻿
﻿
﻿
﻿Allyship in Action: How to Be a Workplace Advocate and Move Beyond Performative Support for LGBTQIA+ Colleagues
 
 
June 22 | Virtual Roundtable
﻿
﻿
﻿
﻿
﻿LGBTQ+ Inclusion at TD - Forever Proud. Forever Progressing.
 
 
SEE ALL EVENTS
 
 
CONNECT WITH CATALYST
 
Don’t forget to follow Catalyst on social media for daily updates on our work.  
  
  
  
 
 
 
About Catalyst
Catalyst
 is a global nonprofit supported by many of the world’s most powerful CEOs and leading companies to help build workplaces that work for women. Founded in 1962, Catalyst drives change with preeminent thought leadership, actionable solutions, and a galvanized community of multinational corporations to accelerate and advance women into leadership—because progress for women is progress for everyone.

subject: Your Skills Journey Starts Here
body:
To stay competitive, it’s crucial for organizations to leverage skills data to gain deeper insights into the capabilities of their people. 
View in browser
 
 
Your Skills Journey Starts Here
 
Wednesday, June 28, at 11 a.m. CT
 
To stay competitive, it’s crucial for organizations to leverage skills data to gain deeper insights into the capabilities of their people. 
 
Skill data lends a new level of granularity to talent management, empowering organizations to be more agile as market conditions demand it.
 
Yet, initiatives focused solely on skills management can be complex to implement, time-consuming, and challenging to maintain. Legacy skills management tools are not fit for our modern era.
 
Jumping straight into the most complex skills use cases often leads projects to stall, as the questions and repercussions become overwhelming! 
 
In our 
upcoming webinar
, we'll dive into this topic and provide insights on how to get started on your skills journey. 
 
You will learn:
 
What to know before you launch a skills-based talent practice
How to implement a skills-based approach without compromising on your core objectives
Which technology is required and real-life examples of this tech in action
How to scale skills intelligence across the enterprise

body:
Meeting in a Box

 | 
Webinars
 |

Quote of the day
“Equal rights, fair play, justice, are all like the air: we all have it, or none of us has it. That is the truth of it.” – 
Maya Angelou
 
Today's Topics: 
Career Advice
Johnson & Johnson on the Importance of Clinical Trials
Meeting in a Box: Pride Month 
-The Fair360 Staff
CAREER ADVICE
 
Career Advice: Saira Mazhar
 
In this week’s installment of our Career Advice video series, Senior Business Writer Linda Bell spoke with Saira Mazhar, Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Manager at Southern Company. Mazhar shared insights on how she transitioned to corporate America and what employers and employees can do to foster an inclusive workplace.
 
WATCH
 
FEATURED PARTNER
 
Johnson & Johnson Shares the Importance of Inclusive Clinical Trials
 
Johnson & Johnson shared the importance of diversity and inclusivity in clinical trials, citing the need to include underrepresented individuals.
 
If a patient has a condition but no approved treatments are available or if the available treatments are not proving effective, the patient may be able to consider a clinical trial as an option. Patients often learn about clinical trials from their doctor or a patient advocacy organization.
 
However, many clinical trials have not had an accurately diverse group of participants, affecting both the trial’s findings and the treatment for underrepresented patients.
Read Full Article
 
MEETING IN A BOX
 
Meeting in a Box: Pride Month 2023
 
Pride Month takes place in June to celebrate the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and related communities, the diversity of identities and their fight toward equal rights around the world. During this time, we spotlight and pay homage to the successes of LGBTQ+ people, the injustices they’ve overcome and their continued efforts to make the world a safe place for every person to be their authentic selves.
 
In this Meeting in a Box, we provide a timeline of LGBTQ+ history in the U.S. and facts and figures concerning LGBTQ+ Americans. We also examine steps companies can take to promote LGBTQ+ inclusivity and belonging at work and acknowledge LGBTQ+ people in the political sphere.
 
Share this document with your colleagues to further your team’s cultural competence education on the LGBTQ+ community.
DOWNLOAD

subject: Leadership (Re)Development: Drive Organizational Impact
body:
In this resource constrained environment, it’s important to leverage tools and development tactics that are able to solve multiple challenges at once.
 
Leadership (Re)Development: Integrating Your Coaching Program to Drive Organizational Impact
 
Tuesday, June 6, at 1 p.m ET
 
While facing challenges including limited budget and securing support from leadership, HR and L&D teams must get creative to solve organizational challenges with less. In this resource constrained environment, it’s important to leverage tools and development tactics that are able to solve multiple challenges at once. 
 
During this webinar, Torch's head of behavioral science insights Elizabeth Weingarten will be joined by Tiffany Price, senior director of HR at Blueprint Test Prep to learn how she overcame those challenges. Tiffany will share how she has leveraged scaled coaching, integrated across her organization, as a kind of development Swiss army knife. By integrating coaching across the organization, Tiffany has seen positive results including increased performance, engagement and retention rates. 
 
This session is part of Leadership (Re)Development, Torch’s conversation series that shares stories about the evolution of leadership development within organizations to become more inclusive, integrated and impactful.
 
During this session you’ll learn: 
How to gain support from leadership to scale coaching across an organization
How to think about measuring the impact of your coaching program
Actionable ways to leverage coaching as a part of your greater people development strategies
How to develop a coaching program that is tied to larger organizational initiatives

May 26, 2023
 
3 Timeless Principles of Leadership
 
Over the years, my colleagues and I have embraced numerous ideas about leadership that fall under the category of servant leadership. Three timeless leadership principles have risen to the top.

SPONSORED CONTENT
 
5 Strategies to Ensure Your Company Culture is Recession-Proof
 
Everyone is trying to survive and minimize losses. The most proactive companies take this time to focus on company culture - supporting your employee’s development can make or break performance in tough and uncertain times. Having a culture that is resilient and adaptable can go a long way in ensuring your business's success.

to save $100 on your LearningElite application – and gain access to many other great benefits!
APPLY NOW
 
UPCOMING WEBINARS
 
Learners & Connectivity: The Magic Behind a Comprehensive Tech User Experience
 
Wednesday, May 31 at 1 p.m. CT
Sponsored By: 
Degreed
 
Ironically, connectivity is the thread holding your business together. Yet, could you easily create a map of all the tools and technologies that work together to keep your business afloat? How about all the skills present (and missing) across your workforce? Or the inner workings of the skill supply and demand chain in your organization?
 
It might seem like complicated minutia, but it’s worth untangling. These connections are an ecosystem; one part relies on another to survive and thrive. With knowledge and dominion over your ecosystem, you can increase efficiency, enhance workforce capabilities and, in turn, create better business outcomes in the face of an ever-evolving world of work.
REGISTER NOW
 
Developing an Impactful Women’s Leadership Program
 
Wednesday, May 31, at 11 a.m. CT
Sponsored By: 
Sponsor Now!
Inclusive organizations outperform those that are not. One of the largest groups of underrepresented leaders is women. Building a program that develops leadership acumen, empowers women leaders to exert greater influence, advocates for development of the teams they lead and promotes a culture of learning and development should be the framework for developing a women’s leadership program. 
 
This program should help all women leaders navigate the business landscape and provide roles of greater influence and contribution. An additional outcome is an expanding network of connections, coaches and mentors. Leaders completing the program should gain a greater appreciation of behaviors and strategies that enhance leadership in the workplace and positively impact success for women. 
 
This webinar will provide an overview of a successful women’s leadership program: How it was designed, how it was leveraged and the impact to the women leaders who completed the program. 
REGISTER NOW
 
FEATURED WHITE PAPERS
 
10 People Metrics With a Big Financial Impact
 
 
CHROs are under increasing pressure to become more accountable for workforce costs and effectiveness, especially during shifting labor markets and an uncertain economy. But the path from employee to a line item on the balance sheet isn’t always clear. There’s often several degrees of separation between workforce initiatives and the actual bottom line, making it difficult to quantify and clearly convey impact.
 
We’ve put together a checklist of 10 important people metrics that have a big financial impact.
DOWNLOAD NOW
 
 
Leading in the Middle
 
Competing priorities interfere with virtually every large organization. Centralized functions seek standardization and organizational efficiencies, while line management seeks customized, customer-focused solutions. When unresolved, these clashing forces can drain morale and impede productivity.
 
Learn how middle managers can navigate these challenges and ultimately learn to balance these competing forces and boost their careers by differentiating their leadership skills. Learn how you and leaders within your organization can lead in the middle.
DOWNLOAD NOW

—Ruth Bader Ginsburg

-The Fair360 Staff
CAREER ADVICE
 
Career Advice: Keisha Marant
 
In this week’s installment of our Career Advice video series, Senior Business Writer Linda Bell spoke with Keisha Marant, VP, Senior Diversity and Inclusion Manager at TD Bank (No. 20 on the Fair360 2023 Top 50 Companies for Diversity list). Marant shared her insights about the power of employee resource groups, the importance of mentorship and how workers can best position themselves in a talent shortage.
 
WATCH
 
EDUCATION
 
Acknowledging Jewish American Contributions: A Spotlight on Jewish American Heritage Month
 
Jewish Americans have played a significant role in the development, expansion and success of the United States since the nation’s founding. Employers can honor their contributions by celebrating Jewish American Heritage Month (JAHM) in May. Part of that effort should involve addressing antisemitism in the workplace and acknowledging the achievements of Jewish Americans. 
 
Jewish Americans first settled in what became the United States in 1654 in New Amsterdam, which later became New York City. They played a key role in many pivotal moments in U.S. history, including founding the American Red Cross, writing the poem affixed to the Statue of Liberty and serving in the Armed Forces (more than 500,000 fought during World War II alone).   
Read Full Article
 
MEETING IN A BOX
 
Meeting in a Box: Pride Month 2023
 
Pride Month takes place in June to celebrate the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and related communities, the diversity of identities and their fight toward equal rights around the world. During this time, we spotlight and pay homage to the successes of LGBTQ+ people, the injustices they’ve overcome and their continued efforts to make the world a safe place for every person to be their authentic selves.
 
In this Meeting in a Box, we provide a timeline of LGBTQ+ history in the U.S. and facts and figures concerning LGBTQ+ Americans. We also examine steps companies can take to promote LGBTQ+ inclusivity and belonging at work and acknowledge LGBTQ+ people in the political sphere.

subject: [Webinar] Evaluate Your Women’s Leadership Program's Impact
body:
Inclusive organizations outperform those that are not. One of the largest groups of underrepresented leaders is women. 
 
Developing an Impactful Women’s Leadership Program
 
Thursday, June 1, at 12 p.m ET
 
Inclusive organizations outperform those that are not. One of the largest groups of underrepresented leaders is women. Building a program that develops leadership acumen, empowers women leaders to exert greater influence, advocates for development of the teams they lead and promotes a culture of learning and development should be the framework for developing a women’s leadership program.
This program should help all women leaders navigate the business landscape and provide roles of greater influence and contribution. An additional outcome is an expanding network of connections, coaches and mentors. Leaders completing the program should gain a greater appreciation of behaviors and strategies that enhance leadership in the workplace and positively impact success for women.
This webinar will provide an overview of a successful women’s leadership program: How it was designed, how it was leveraged and the impact on the women leaders who completed the program.
 
Learning objectives:
Assess the current climate of female diversity in your organization — it’s not just about the numbers.
Determine where you will start. Effectively assess budget, scope and engagement constraints.
Determine the critical foundations for your organization’s program.
Evaluate your program’s impact.

subject: Integrate Your Coaching Program to Drive Organizational Impact
body:
While facing challenges including limited budget and securing support from leadership, HR and L&D teams must get creative to solve organizational challenges with less. 
 
Leadership (Re)Development: Integrating Your Coaching Program to Drive Organizational Impact
 
Tuesday, June 6, at 1 p.m ET
 
While facing challenges including limited budget and securing support from leadership, HR and L&D teams must get creative to solve organizational challenges with less. In this resource constrained environment, it’s important to leverage tools and development tactics that are able to solve multiple challenges at once. 
 
During this webinar, Torch's head of behavioral science insights Elizabeth Weingarten will be joined by Tiffany Price, senior director of HR at Blueprint Test Prep to learn how she overcame those challenges. Tiffany will share how she has leveraged scaled coaching, integrated across her organization, as a kind of development Swiss army knife. By integrating coaching across the organization, Tiffany has seen positive results including increased performance, engagement and retention rates. 
 
This session is part of Leadership (Re)Development, Torch’s conversation series that shares stories about the evolution of leadership development within organizations to become more inclusive, integrated and impactful.
 
During this session you’ll learn: 
 
How to gain support from leadership to scale coaching across an organization
How to think about measuring the impact of your coaching program
Actionable ways to leverage coaching as a part of your greater people development strategies
How to develop a coaching program that is tied to larger organizational initiatives

subject: Meeting in a Box: Pride Month 2023
body:
Meeting in a Box
 | 
Career Advice
 | 
Webinars
 | 
Education
Quote of the day
"We have to do it because we can no longer stay invisible. We have to be visible. We should not be ashamed of who we are." 
--Sylvia Rivera
 
Today's Topics: 
Meeting in a Box: Pride Month 2023
The Shifting Labor Market
TD Bank's New Accessibility Tool
-The Fair360 Staff
MEETING IN A BOX
 
Meeting in a Box: Pride Month 2023
 
Pride Month takes place in June to celebrate the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and related communities, the diversity of identities and their fight toward equal rights around the world. During this time, we spotlight and pay homage to the successes of LGBTQ+ people, the injustices they’ve overcome and their continued efforts to make the world a safe place for every person to be their authentic selves.
 
In this Meeting in a Box, we provide a timeline of LGBTQ+ history in the U.S. and facts and figures concerning LGBTQ+ Americans. We also examine steps companies can take to promote LGBTQ+ inclusivity and belonging at work and acknowledge LGBTQ+ people in the political sphere.
 
Share this document with your colleagues to further your team’s cultural competence education on the LGBTQ+ community.
DOWNLOAD
 
TALENT
 
What the Shifting Labor Market Means for Employers and Employees
 
Amid economic uncertainty, companies are responding by implementing job cuts, imposing hiring freezes and tightening their budgets. The shifting environment has added a new dimension to workers’ priorities and expectations.  
 
Fifty-two percent of workers are worried about the impact of economic uncertainty on their job security, according to Randstad’s Workmonitor Report. But even as the macroeconomic conditions change, talent maintains the advantage in the worker-employer relationship.  
 
“The truth is we’re still living in a world of talent scarcity,” says Traci Fiatte, CEO of Randstad North America (No. 19 on Fair360’s 2023 Top 50 Companies for Diversity list). “While the economy has slowed, the most recent BLS report still shows a record-low unemployment rate of 3.4%. There is still demand for workers in the market but a shortage of talent available. Companies are competing for workers and must adapt to find and attract the best talent for their workforce.”  
Read Full Article
 
FEATURED PARTNER
 
TD Bank Supports Diverse Needs With Adapted Accessibility Tool
 
May 18 is Global Accessibility Awareness Day, encouraging accessibility and inclusion for people living with disabilities. We spoke with Samantha Estoesta, Product Manager – Social Innovation Specialization at TD Bank and Product Owner of TD Adapted Accessibility, a new tool that will drive inclusive and accessible experiences for online users. 
 
Created by TD Lab, TD Adapted Accessibility enables users to personalize websites to address their accessibility needs and preferences.  
Read Full Article
 
Upcoming Webinar
June 1, 2023 | Equitable Experiences Across the Employee Lifecycle for LGBTQ+ Employees
Join us for our next webinar on LGBTQ+ equity in the employee lifecycle. Gain insights from diverse experts on fostering inclusivity, supporting LGBTQ+ employees and addressing their unique challenges throughout their employment journey.
 
In Case You Missed It
Haitian Heritage Month: Reflecting on Haitian Americans’ Contributions to Society
The first Haitian Heritage Month was celebrated in May 1998 in the United States. The Haitian diaspora celebrates the observance worldwide. It coincides with Haitian Flag Day, the month Haiti gained independence from France in 1804.   
 
Tackling the Financial Literacy Gap With Education
The United States faces a financial literacy gap, with only 57% of adults possessing basic financial knowledge. Black and Hispanic Americans experience even lower levels, significantly threatening their communities' financial well-being and future.

subject: Build ERGs with Personal Impact at enERGize
body:
Attend enERGize on June 7 & align your personal and professional values.
 
 
ERGs Make a Personal 
﻿
& Professional Impact
enERGize is in three weeks on June 7! 
Join us online to learn best-in-class ERG strategies from speakers like 
BMO
, 
Chevron
,
 
and

4.75 credits toward SHRM-CP and SHRM-SCP recertification
. 
A program code will be provided after the event for those who would like to receive credit.
 
Join Us—Buy Online Tickets  »
 
 
 
Nazya's ERG Story
Participating in an ERG is about more than meeting workplace goals. 
ERGs offer us a way to activate our personal values and connect them to the work we do
—and that's what happened for Nazya, one of Catalyst's employees who participated in an ERG. Read more about her story below!
 
Nazya Ayaz
Director, Event Content
Catalyst
 
 
 
Q: Can you summarize your past participation as a member of an ERG? 
Nazya: 
I previously served as a committee member for three years on an ERG that helped to develop the leadership abilities for women on staff.
Q: How has participating in an ERG impacted your personal & professional life? 
Nazya:
 Being an ERG member taught me the benefit of giving to a community and how I can build that value into my personal circle of influence. Professionally, it taught me how to be an inclusive leader, respecting differences in colleagues and creating a framework on how to advance social causes.
Q: Tell us a story about your ERG experience.
Nazya:
 I helped to secure a workshop speaker for my ERG who focused on teaching us how we can be better negotiators and make our voices heard in the commodity industry, an industry largely dominated by men. It was extremely well-received by my colleagues and led to the Executive ERG Sponsor becoming my professional mentor. Additionally, I also started to serve as a mentor to a junior peer from another company to pay it forward and continue the cycle of supporting women in the workplace. It was an enriching and fulfilling experience, knowing that my work was making a difference in something that was important to me.

subject: Watch Any of Our On-Demand Breakfast Clubs Now!
body:
At this time, numerous Breakfast Clubs, hosted by Chief Learning Officer, are available on-demand.
View in browser
 
 
At this time, numerous Breakfast Clubs, hosted by Chief Learning Officer, are available on-demand. Here’s a taste of what’s one play button away from elevating the L&D function within your workplace:
 
Journey to the Metaverse
The metaverse means a lot of different things to a lot of different people. Some say it’s the blending of the digital and the real worlds or the augmentation of experience with a digital layer. For learning, it can allow people to practice (even tasks or roles that are rare, dangerous or expensive) in collaborative digital environments from the comfort and safety of their own home or workplace. It can bring information to people in the flow of work, and it allows the practice of both hard skills and more human skills, such as empathy.
 
But the metaverse is still shrouded in mystery for many, especially those who aren’t sure where to begin their journey. From those who are toeing the start line to those who are farther along the trek, how are L&D leaders leveraging immersive technologies to further their learning efforts? And how do you determine when it’s the right option for learning — and when it’s not?
WATCH NOW
 
Owning the Leadership Role: Learning Leaders’ Expanding Skillsets
The upheaval and challenges of the pandemic, the move to hybrid work and the push for big upskilling and internal mobility initiatives have finally given L&D leaders the seat at the table they’ve long been seeking. They are being tasked with larger, more complicated strategic challenges, and this requires them to develop their own personal skills in some areas alongside their more traditional L&D skills, particularly data and decision-making, leadership, core business skills and more, according to 2022 RedThread research, “Future-proofing L&D: Developing the Right Skills.”
 
With expanding responsibilities and the pressure to deliver results, how are L&D leaders prioritizing their own skills development and the development of their L&D teams?
WATCH NOW
 
Watch either of the above events on-demand now, or check out any of the 
other topics
 – also available at this time.
 
Sincerely, 
The Chief Learning Officer Team

subject: Today's News: Haitian Heritage Month, Tackling the Financial Literacy Gap and More
body:
Meeting in a Box

Career Advice

Webinars
 | 
Education
Quote of the day
“Honesty and openness is always the foundation of insightful dialogue.”
--bell hooks
 
Today's Topics: 
Haitian Heritage Month
Tackling the Financial Literacy Gap
Hilton Spotlights GM Ben Ly for AAPI Heritage Month
-The Fair360 Staff
EDUCATION
 
Haitian Heritage Month: Reflecting on Haitian Americans’ Contributions to Society
 
Haitian Heritage Month is a nationally recognized month celebrated in May every year.  
 
“As a Haitian American, celebrating Haitian Heritage Month is significant because it allows us to recognize and honor Haitian Americans’ contributions to the fabric of American society,” says Hans Patrick Domercant, President of the Haitian Chamber of Commerce. “Haitian Americans have significantly contributed to medicine, business, education, politics and culture. Celebrating these accomplishments helps to highlight our rich history, cultural heritage and the ongoing impact that we have on American society.” 
 
The first Haitian Heritage Month was celebrated in May 1998 in the United States. The Haitian diaspora celebrates the observance worldwide. It coincides with Haitian Flag Day, the month Haiti gained independence from France in 1804.   
Read Full Article
 
EDUCATION
 
Tackling the Financial Literacy Gap With Education
 
Tiffany Grant grew up in a household where discussing money was considered a taboo topic.
 
She was raised by her grandparents until the age of 12 and later moved in with her mother, who had a stack of credit cards that she would use to purchase anything her daughter wanted.
 
However, Grant soon learned that this behavior came with consequences, as both her mother and grandparents had to file for bankruptcy, and her mother also went through foreclosure. Grant recognized that this was due to debt accumulation from excessive use of credit cards.
 
Given the financial insecurity faced by most Black Americans, Grant was determined to avoid falling into the same situation.
Read Full Article
 
FEATURED PARTNER
 
Hilton Spotlights Ben Ly for Asian American and Pacific Islander Heritage Month
 
Zachari Dunes at Mandalay Beach, Curio Collection by Hilton GM Ben Ly recently shared his successful journey as an Asian American and Pacific Islander (AAPI) during AAPI Heritage Month.
Read Full Article

subject: Mobilizing Talent for the Future
body:
Investing in internal talent mobility has been a growing trend, and the benefits are numerous: Efforts in this area can help organizations attract and retain talent, develop more diverse pipelines, fill open roles and bridge critical skill gaps amid the labor shortage.
View in browser
 
 
Mobilizing Talent for the Future
 
Tuesday, June 27, at 11 a.m. ET
 
Next month, Chief Learning Officer will host "
Mobilizing Talent for the Future
," as a part of our Breakfast Club Series, which continues its work in connecting leaders over breakfast to strengthen the link between learning and development and business strategy. 
 
Investing in internal talent mobility has been a growing trend, and the benefits are numerous: Efforts in this area can help organizations attract and retain talent, develop more diverse pipelines, fill open roles and bridge critical skill gaps amid the labor shortage. Autonomous career paths or "tracks," career and leadership development opportunities and growth initiatives, and knowledge, skill and resource sharing are all woven into a comprehensive internal talent mobility strategy.
 
What new strategies and tools are emerging for internal talent mobility and career pathing at this halfway point in 2023? And how are organizations using the ever-maturing talent marketplace to match employees' existing skills with skills needed for aspirational roles or emerging roles of the future?
 
Each mini-event lasts about two hours and consists of a 60-minute panel discussion with L&D and talent practitioners, a 20-minute FASTtalk presentation and a 20-minute research segment, garnering real-time data from attendees and prompting discussion of the day’s themes, followed by closing remarks from me, CLO’s editor-in-chief.
 
We hope that you can join us.
 
Sincerely, 
Ashley St. John
Founder, Chief Content Officer & Editor-in-Chief
BetterWork Media Group, parent company of Chief Learning Officer & Talent Management

Forty-one percent of the workforce left their jobs last year due to lack of career advancement.
Employees today want companies who will prepare them for the future.

The CEO Blindspot
  
When it comes to understanding what employees want and need from their jobs and the real-world challenges they’re facing, there is a chasm between what the C-suite thinks and the reality of what employees actually experience.
This disconnect has a direct impact on an employers’ ability to attract and retain talent, which is why it’s imperative that the C-suite and senior leaders not make decisions without consulting their people data first.

subject: The Future of the Four-day Workweek
body:
Meeting in a Box
 | 
Career Advice
 | 
Webinars
 | 
Education
Quote of the day
"Every accomplishment starts with the decision to try."
--John F. Kennedy
 
Today's Topics: 
The Future of the Four-Day Workweek
Career Advice
How Sustainability Helps Organizations Attract Talent
-The DiversityInc Powered by Fair360 Staff
TALENT
 
The Future of the Four-Day Workweek
 
Work-life balance in the 1800s? Forget about it. 
 
When the United States first began tracking workers’ hours in 1890, it was common for manufacturing employees to work up to 100 hours a week. When Congress passed the Fair Labor Standards Act in 1938, the U.S. limited the workweek to 44 hours. Two years later, the workweek was amended to 40 hours and became the workplace norm for almost a century.    
 
Andrew Barnes says a change is long overdue. 
 
“Humans are no different from machines. You don’t run a machine full stop and don’t give it maintenance and downtime. But we do that with our people, which makes no sense to me,” says the co-founder of 4 Day Week Global, a nonprofit organization advocating for a four-day workweek with no reduction in pay and benefits.
Read Full Article
 
CAREER ADVICE
 
Career Advice: Lisa Fishel-Slater
 
In this week’s installment of our Career Advice series, Lisa Fishel-Slater, Manager of Diversity Inclusion and Engagement at The Hershey Company, spoke with Senior Business Writer Linda Bell about her passion for developing people, the challenges in her job and what has kept her at Hershey for three decades.
WATCH

Amy Freshman, Senior Director of Global HR at ADP, suggests that environmental sustainability practices can be a valuable tool for recruitment and retention. While it's important to promote these initiatives, they should not be solely for marketing purposes. Genuine, ethical and continual action is essential.
