subject: 4 Critical Lessons from enERGize 2022
body:
Attend enERGize 2023 and gain SHRM credits—buy tickets today.
 
 
Join Us—Buy Online Tickets »
 
 
Hi Ashton,
 
As enERGize 2023 approaches next month on June 7,
 we’re looking back and continuing the conversations begun at last year’s enERGize event series.
What did participants get out of last year? What did they learn?
 
enERGize 2022 brought together passionate and committed ERG participants, Catalyst consultants, and ERG experts to learn from each other. Some lessons they discovered were to:
1.
      
Use your ERGs to build impact beyond your company’s walls.
2.
      
Make sure employees know the value of ERG participation.
3.
      
Get buy-in from people outside your ERG.
4.
      
Start collecting data if you aren't already.
To learn more, 
read our blog post covering enERGize 2022
.

subject: 2023 CLO Symposium: Introducing Our Day 2 Keynote Speaker
body:
High achievers share the same four attributes: intrinsic motivation, perseverance, a strong foundation and constant learning through informal means.
 
Dear Ashton,
 
High achievers share the same four attributes: intrinsic motivation, perseverance, a strong foundation and constant learning through informal means. The key to their success is that they do all four of these things in tandem. 
 
Ruth Gotian, chief learning officer for Weill Cornell Medicine, delivers her keynote address, "
The Success Factor — Developing the Mindset and Skill Set for Peak Performance
," on Tuesday, October 17, during the 2023 CLO Symposium.
Based on the book “The Success Factor” and using these four shared attributes as a guide, this presentation will help you reach peak performance by applying the lessons of high achievers in your own life.
 
Register today to join us. Early bird pricing is still available but for a limited time.
 
Sincerely,
The Chief Learning Officer Team

subject: Top 50 Recap: Videos, Photos and More!
body:
Meeting in a Box
 | 
Career Advice
 | 
Webinars
 | 
Education
Quote of the day
"Everything you see from this moment forward will be 'Powered by Fair360.'" 
--
Carolynn Johnson, CEO, Fair360
 
Today's Topics: 
Welcome to DiversityInc Powered by Fair360
2023 Top 50 Event Recap
Meeting in a Box
-The DiversityInc Powered by Fair360 Staff
WELCOME
 
Carolynn Johnson Unveils DiversityInc Powered by Fair360 at Annual Top 50 Event
 
This might be the first time you’ve seen the name Fair360. You might be wondering where it came from.
 
During the evening portion of our annual Top 50 event in New York City on May 2, Fair360 CEO Carolynn Johnson announced that DiversityInc would now be DiversityInc Powered by Fair360.  
 
The Fair360 concept was developed by Johnson and DiversityInc Founder and Chairman Luke Visconti in 2016. 
 
“We embarked upon this journey in January where we were very intentional about how we were going to not only continue on with the DiversityInc Top 50 survey but also start to look at sentiment surveys," Johnson said. "With that, we are returning to our parent company name of Fair360. 
Everything you see from this moment forward will be ‘Powered by Fair360.
'” 
EVENT RECAP
 
2023 Top 50 Recap
 
Our annual Top 50 Companies for Diversity event took place at Cipriani Wall Street in New York City on May 2. 
 
Here's what happened at the event:
Mastercard earns No. 1 spot on the Top 50 list
Accenture, Ameren and Northwell Health join the Hall of Fame
DiversityInc unveils Fair360
Expert panels and presentations cover the event’s theme of “The Link Between Leadership Accountability and Data Standardization”
View the full event page for recap articles, videos and photos!
See Full Page
 
RESEARCH & GUIDES
 
Meeting in a Box: Asian American and Pacific Islander Heritage Month
 
Asian American and Pacific Islander Heritage Month takes place in May to celebrate the strength, tenacity, resilience and contributions of Asian Americans from around the world. AAPI individuals are diverse, with different backgrounds, sexual orientations, identities and abilities, and this month, we aim to celebrate all of them.
 
This Meeting in a Box is designed to serve as a valuable tool to continue your employees’ cultural competence education, open up conversations about race and ethnicity and spotlight the accomplishments of the AAPI community.
 
In this edition of Meeting in a Box, we look at the disparities in the Asian American work experience, achievement gaps for Asian Americans and our usual facts and figures.
DOWNLOAD
 
In Case You Missed It
Webinar Recap: Instilling Gender-Neutral Practices in the Workplace
Pronoun misuse can create tension in the workplace, leading to discrimination and a lack of belonging. Leaders must educate and raise awareness around gender-neutral workplace practices to promote inclusivity and authenticity.
 
Closing the Retirement Gap for Working Mothers
Women, especially working mothers, face significant challenges in preparing for retirement. Statistics show that they retire with less money than men due to earning less and spending more on childcare.

UPCOMING WEBINARS
 
Bridging the Digital Skills Gap in a Digital-First Workplace
 
Thursday, May 11, at 11 a.m. CT
Sponsored By: 
WhatFix
The enterprise of today places greater emphasis on efficiency and productivity. In a workplace increasingly reliant on software, this is driven by employees’ interaction with myriad applications they use to get their work done. A majority of learning and development leaders recognize this has also led to a growing digital skills gap in the workforce.
To create high-performing teams, L&D leaders need to demonstrate that learning can result in improved performance during a digital transformation. While upskilling the hybrid or remote workforce is crucial, it must be integrated seamlessly to avoid disruptions in daily activities. Continuous learning personalized at scale and connects end-to-end processes beyond individual tasks or actions should be provided to deliver integrated experiences that increase productivity.
REGISTER NOW
 
How to Get Started With Career Mobility
 
Wednesday, May 24, at 1 p.m. CT
Sponsored By:
 
Guild
Forty-one percent of the workforce left their jobs last year due to lack of career advancement.
Employees today want companies who will prepare them for the future.
But how do they know which employers are invested in their career potential? What leads to the next job? Most importantly, who will help them get there? Employers aligning skills to career pathways unlock career mobility for their workforce and, in turn, better retain and attract talent looking to grow their careers.
Join Matthew Daniel, senior principal of talent strategy and mobility at Guild, as he discusses career mobility with KimArie Yowell from Rocket Companies and Brandon Carson from Walmart.
REGISTER NOW

subject: How to Engage More Men in DEI Initiatives
body:
These Catalyst resources boost DEI buy-in and participation. 
 
MAY 2023
RESEARCH
 | 
EVENTS
 | 
BLOG
 | 
SUBSCRIBE
 
 
 
Ashton
,
Companies have long struggled to engage men effectively in gender equity initiatives. But 
research shows
 that men's buy-in is critical
: 
96% of organizations report progress on diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) when men are actively involved, compared to only 30% that report progress when men are not engaged. 
It's time for companies to get serious about ensuring that men and people of all genders are actively involved in DEI.
 Catalyst's first-class research, programs, and training—all part of our 
Men Advocating Real Change (MARC)
 initiative—can help you achieve this goal.
 
 
 
 
 
Lorraine Hariton
﻿
Catalyst President & CEO
 
WHERE TO START
 
Explore MARC programming
. 
From entry level to the C-suite and all points in between, MARC programs raise awareness, build skills, and facilitate learning breakthroughs and behavioral changes.
Use these five strategies to eliminate barriers and successfully engage men
.
 1. Identify and eliminate apathy; 2. Don't frame gender equity as a zero-sum game; 3. Include men in discussions of gender; 4. Highlight respected men who advocate for gender equity; and 5. Provide men with learning opportunities.
 
WHY IT'S IMPORTANT
 
"
MARC has equipped hundreds of Dow [employees]
 around the world to be champions and allies for gender equity," said Karen S. Carter, President of Packaging & Specialty Plastics at Dow and Catalyst Advisory Board Chair, speaking at the 2023 Catalyst Awards Dinner. 
Read more highlights from Catalyst's premier annual event
. 
View the infographic
. 
92% of executives
 say they know how to turn their commitment to gender equity into action after participating in Catalyst's MARC Executive Dialogue training. 
Learn more about this unique upskilling opportunity for your executive team
.
Catalyst research finds that 
three organizational climates play a major factor in men's willingness to confront sexism at work
—and their ability to thrive, too. During Mental Health Month—recognized in May in the US, Canada, and the UK—
use this tool for senior leaders and managers to improve morale and tackle negative workplace climates head-on
.
 
MAY IS ASIAN HERITAGE MONTH
 
 
As companies recognize AANHPI (Asian American, Native Hawaiian, and Pacific Islander) Heritage Month in the United States and Asian Heritage Month in May in Canada, we're calling on men to stop using this racist and sexist business phrase. 
Catalyst's Vice President, Science Writer and Advisor Joy Ohm explains why. 
 
CATALYST IN THE NEWS
 
 
Recent news coverage featuring Catalyst experts and research:
Forbes | 
Why Leading With Empathy Is More Important Than Ever
 
Harvard Business Review | 
How Colorism Affects Women at Work
 
Canadian HR Reporter | 
Organizations Not Following Through on DEI Work: Research
 
Washington Post | 
The Role of Technology in Building Inclusive Workplaces
 
 
UPCOMING CATALYST EVENTS
 
 
 
June 7 | Online
enERGize (ERG Event)
Ticket packages and individual tickets are now available for enERGize by Catalyst,
 an online learning engagement designed to help corporate employee resource groups (ERGs) engage in effective partnership across lines of difference and at all levels of the organization.
ERG leaders, members, allies, and executive sponsors from various companies, industries, functions, and regions will come together to explore how ERGs can maximize impact for their business and cultural goals.
GET TICKETS AND TICKET PACKAGES
 
 
 
 
May 10 | Webinar
Empathy: What Does It Mean for Asian and Pacific Island Communities?
 
June 14 | Webinar 
﻿
﻿
﻿
﻿Allyship in Action: How to Be a Workplace Advocate and Move Beyond Performative Support for LGBTQIA+ Colleagues
 
 
SEE ALL EVENTS
 
 
CONNECT WITH CATALYST
 
Don’t forget to follow Catalyst on social media for daily updates on our work.  
  
  
  
 
 
 
About Catalyst
Catalyst
 is a global nonprofit supported by many of the world’s most powerful CEOs and leading companies to help build workplaces that work for women. Founded in 1962, Catalyst drives change with preeminent thought leadership, actionable solutions, and a galvanized community of multinational corporations to accelerate and advance women into leadership—because progress for women is progress for everyone.

subject: I have one question for you, Ashton
body:
Maximize your ERG’s effectiveness at enERGize—a Catalyst online ERG event—on June 7.
 
 
Dear Ashton,
Employee resource groups (ERGs) are vital to implementing DEI strategy throughout a company—that's why our ERG community is such an important focus at Catalyst.
As we prepare for 
enERGize
, our upcoming ERG-focused online event on June 7, 
I have one question for you as a fellow DEI colleague and leader
:
 
What obstacles are you facing in developing or advancing your ERGs that you need help to overcome?
 
Let Us Know in This One-Question Survey »
 
 
We'll follow up with the anonymized results from the survey in a future email and your responses will be used to inform programming for the event next month.
Join us for enERGize
 and unpack these top-of-mind questions in small peer-group discussions. 
You'll also hear insights from leading companies who are pioneering ERG strategies to meet the demands of the modern workplace.
I hope to see you there!

Lorraine Hariton

Catalyst

subject: Webinar: What Does Empathy Mean for AAPI Communities?
body:
Register now for our webinar on Wednesday, May 10 featuring MLSE and Uber.
 
 
MAY 10, 2023
 / 1:00 p.m. – 2:00 p.m. ET / 7:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m. CET
 
WEBINAR: Empathy—What Does It Mean for Asian and Pacific Island Communities?
 
Dear Ashton,
Join Catalyst on May 10 to learn how organizations can meet the needs of Asian and Pacific Islander employees with a specific lens on empathy during difficult times.
With much turbulence in the social and workplace landscape over the last few years, global organizations have had to address the needs of their Asian and Pacific Islander employees in more empathic ways.
Whether it’s feeling invisible in the workplace or more susceptible to the rise in anti-Asian violence, organizations can tap into empathy to support Asians and Pacific Islanders.
Topics of discussion will include:  
Leveraging empathy to support people from marginalized racial and ethnic groups.
Developing cultural competence and programs that focus on Asians and Pacific Islanders.
Understanding the unique barriers members of the AAPI community face around access to healthcare, leadership roles, and emotional, financial, and mental well-being.
How empathy can help bridge the diversity and inclusion gap.
The webinar is complimentary for Catalyst Supporters. Registration is required*—click the link below:
 
REGISTER NOW
 
 
*
You must be logged in to the Catalyst website to access registration.
 
For questions, please contact 
catalystevents@catalyst.org
.
 
SPEAKERS
 
Maheen Ali
Co-chair of Asian Employee Inclusion Group, MLSE
 
Kathrina Robotham
Senior Associate, Research, Catalyst
 
Bo Young Lee
Chief Diversity & Inclusion Officer, Uber
 
 
MODERATOR
 
Mirae Baik
Director, Revenue Operations, Catalyst

Upskilling and Reskilling For Your Tech Teams
 
Pluralsight helps organizations advance their technology workforce. Because the hardest part of building a business isn’t building software and technology. It’s building up the people who grow your business. Upskill your teams with Pluralsight Skills and empower them to produce key business outcomes. Give them access to our courses, assessments, learning paths and labs to help you create the talent you need, when you need it.
READ MORE
 
 
FEATURED STORY
 
Video: Shining a Spotlight on Innovative Learning
 
Learning and development professionals — and especially chief learning officers — are perfectly positioned to lead their organizations into the next frontier of innovation, says Eric Dingler, chief learning officer for the U.S. firms for Deloitte.
WATCH NOW
 
 
NEWS
 
Learning in Practice Awards Applications Are Open!
 
Since 2003, the Chief Learning Officer
 
Learning In Practice awards
 
have recognized learning leaders who demonstrate excellence in the design and delivery of employee development programs through a combination of qualities such as leadership, vision, business acumen and strategic alignment.
Now is the perfect time to get a headstart on your application; download the 
CLO of the Year, Practitioner Award and/or Provider Award
 
applications today to preview the application questions. 
 
Members save! 
Become a member today
 
fo
r $100 off your application – and gain access to many other great benefits!
APPLY NOW
 
UPCOMING WEBINARS
 
Bridging the Digital Skills Gap in a Digital-First Workplace
 
Thursday, May 11, at 12 p.m. ET
Sponsored By: 
WhatFix
The enterprise of today places greater emphasis on efficiency and productivity. In a workplace increasingly reliant on software, this is driven by employees’ interaction with myriad applications they use to get their work done. A majority of learning and development leaders recognize this has also led to a growing digital skills gap in the workforce.
To create high-performing teams, L&D leaders need to demonstrate that learning can result in improved performance during a digital transformation. While upskilling the hybrid or remote workforce is crucial, it must be integrated seamlessly to avoid disruptions in daily activities. Continuous learning personalized at scale and connects end-to-end processes beyond individual tasks or actions should be provided to deliver integrated experiences that increase productivity.
REGISTER NOW
 
How to Get Started With Career Mobility
 
Wednesday, May 24, at 2 p.m. ET
Sponsored By:
 
Guild
Forty-one percent of the workforce left their jobs last year due to lack of career advancement.
Employees today want companies who will prepare them for the future.
But how do they know which employers are invested in their career potential? What leads to the next job? Most importantly, who will help them get there? Employers aligning skills to career pathways unlock career mobility for their workforce and, in turn, better retain and attract talent looking to grow their careers.
Join Matthew Daniel, senior principal of talent strategy and mobility at Guild, as he discusses career mobility with KimArie Yowell from Rocket Companies and Brandon Carson from Walmart.
REGISTER NOW
 
FEATURED WHITE PAPERS
 
6 Ways On-Demand Virtual Producers Accelerate Training
 
Learning and development presenters may try to handle the countless technical details of virtual training alone. Like having a good co-pilot, skilled virtual producers accelerate virtual training by supporting L&D teams every step of the way. This frees up L&D teams to focus on the content and the learners.
DOWNLOAD NOW
 
 
The CEO Blindspot
  
When it comes to understanding what employees want and need from their jobs and the real-world challenges they’re facing, there is a chasm between what the C-suite thinks and the reality of what employees actually experience.
This disconnect has a direct impact on an employers’ ability to attract and retain talent, which is why it’s imperative that the C-suite and senior leaders not make decisions without consulting their people data first.
DOWNLOAD NOW

subject: A Blueprint for a Skills-Based L&D Strategy
body:
The latest industry research in learning and development nowadays points to a growing list of benefits of a skills-based approach.
View in browser
 
 
A Blueprint for a Skills-Based L&D Strategy
 
Wednesday, June 7, at 11 a.m. ET
 
Chief Learning Officer will host our next Breakfast Club Event, "
A Blueprint for a Skills-Based L&D Strategy
" on June 7. Now in its 18th year, BetterWork Media Group’s Breakfast Club series continues its work in connecting leaders over breakfast to strengthen the link between learning and development and business strategy. Here is what we will discuss: 
 
The latest industry research in learning and development nowadays points to a growing list of benefits of a skills-based approach — such as stronger and more equitable talent attraction, acquisition and retention strategies, a more agile workforce and being more well-equipped to address the goals and objectives of the business, to name a few.
 
But first: How does your organization define skills? Deloitte recommends asking this question as the first step in adopting a skills-based learning and talent development strategy. And, what comes next? While every organization’s journey to becoming skills-based will undoubtedly look different, there are, nevertheless, best practices and approaches emerging from across the L&D industry.
 
Each mini-event lasts about two hours and consists of a 60-minute panel discussion with L&D and talent practitioners, a 20-minute FASTtalk presentation and a 20-minute research segment, garnering real-time data from attendees and prompting discussion of the day’s themes, followed by closing remarks from me, CLO’s managing editor.
 
We hope that you can join us!
 
Sincerely,
Liz Loutfi
Managing editor, Chief Learning Officer

body:

Driven by Data: Accountability Measures for DEI Outcomes
 
Wednesday, May 17, at 11 a.m. ET
 
Next month's Breakfast Club event: "
Driven by Data: Accountability Measures for DEI Outcomes
," hosted by Talent Management, is taking place on May 17. 
One of our many expert participating panelists will be Yasmine Laurent, director of people & culture at Tides Advocacy.
 
Yasmine Laurent is a seasoned talent, equity and inclusion practitioner with over 15 years of people and organizational development experience in both for-profit and nonprofit sectors. Her versatile background encompasses designing and implementing full-scale talent management, program management and diversity, equity and inclusion strategies. Yasmine has grown a robust career leading equity, access and advocacy initiatives and possesses the ability to provide expertise on a variety of subject matters including change management, learning and development, process improvement, project management, workforce planning, facilitation and data analysis and reporting.

subject: Increase DEI ROI by Gathering Your Team at enERGize
body:
At enERGize on June 7, leverage ERG research & best practices—register now.
 
 
Bring Your Team Together at enERGize
Gather your team for this half-day online event on Wednesday, June 7 and align on how your DEI strategy shows up in your ERGs.
 
﻿
Together with ERG experts from Catalyst Supporter companies, enERGize will develop your staff through featured sessions
 for ERG leaders and members, DEI practitioners, HR professionals, and internal groups that often interact with ERGs, from Communications and Community Relations to People & Staff.
 
Join Us—Buy Online Tickets »
 
 
﻿Gain increased visibility at enERGize through event sponsorship—
download our sponsorship PDF
 today and reach out to the 
Catalyst Events team
 for more information.
 
 
Highlighted enERGize Sessions*
Check out the agenda for more.
 
 
ERGS SUPPORTING IN TIMES OF CRISIS
Due to the rise in socio-political issues worldwide, ERGs are emerging as a focal point of attention to equity issues for corporations. This session will shed light on why ERGs are vital as a feedback loop for business leaders in keeping their workforce engaged.
 
 
CEO SESSION - THE VITAL ROLE OF CEO ENGAGEMENT IN ERG SUCCESS
In this dynamic session, hear from leading CEOs on how they fuel the success of employee resource groups, and in turn, how ERGs give insights that lead to stronger, more innovative companies.
 
 
EXPLORING THE 4CS OF ERGS
As companies demand more from their ERGs, it's imperative for leaders to be able to assess their ERG performance in a rigorous manner. These dedicated breakout sessions delve into the 4C model of ERGs
—
Career, Community, Culture, and Commerce.

subject: Evaluate Your Women's Leadership Program’s Impact
body:
Inclusive organizations outperform those that are not. One of the largest groups of underrepresented leaders is women. 
 
Developing an Impactful Women’s Leadership Program
 
Thursday, June 1, at 12 p.m ET
 
Inclusive organizations outperform those that are not. One of the largest groups of underrepresented leaders is women. Building a program that develops leadership acumen, empowers women leaders to exert greater influence, advocates for development of the teams they lead and promotes a culture of learning and development should be the framework for developing a women’s leadership program.
This program should help all women leaders navigate the business landscape and provide roles of greater influence and contribution. An additional outcome is an expanding network of connections, coaches and mentors. Leaders completing the program should gain a greater appreciation of behaviors and strategies that enhance leadership in the workplace and positively impact success for women.
This webinar will provide an overview of a successful women’s leadership program: How it was designed, how it was leveraged and the impact on the women leaders who completed the program.
 
Learning objectives:
Assess the current climate of female diversity in your organization — it’s not just about the numbers.
Determine where you will start. Effectively assess budget, scope and engagement constraints.
Determine the critical foundations for your organization’s program.
Evaluate your program’s impact.
SAVE MY SPOT

subject: How Companies Can Support Pregnant Workers' Health Beyond Traditional Maternity Leave Policies
body:
Learn about the Pregnant Workers Fairness Act and why it's important for employers to consider more than just legal compliance.
 
 
FROM DIVERSITYINC BEST PRACTICES
 
 
Beyond Maternity Leave: Prioritizing the Health and Well-Being of Pregnant Workers
President Biden signed the Pregnant Workers Fairness Act, which goes into effect on June 27, 2023, requiring employers to provide reasonable accommodations for pregnant workers and prohibiting discrimination against them. Businesses must also consider intersectionality and biases that may affect pregnant workers.
FEATURED PARTNER
 
 
BASF Supports Students Pursuing Manufacturing Careers
BASF has partnered with Bishop State Community College to support its Federation for Advanced Manufacturing Education (FAME) program, which provides opportunities for students hoping to pursue manufacturing careers.
 
UPCOMING WEBINAR
 
 
May 17, 2023 | Supporting Psychological Safety at Work
Don't miss the chance to attend our upcoming webinar on creating a psychologically safe workplace. Our expert panelists will provide valuable insights on the impact of psychological safety on employee well-being, performance and engagement. Whether you're an employer, HR professional or simply interested in learning more, join us for strategies to create a culture of trust, respect and openness. Register now to be part of this important conversation and learn how to empower your employees to do their best work in a safe & supportive environment.
IN CASE YOU MISSED IT
 
 
5 Biggest News Stories of the Week: April 21
This news roundup looks at the surge in inclusive policies for LGBTQ+ people due to Nasdaq requirements, the history of Earth Day, the employment-population ratio for people with disabilities in the U.S. and more. 
 
Closing the Retirement Gap for Working Mothers
Working mothers face retirement challenges due to the pay gap, caregiving, financial education and limited benefits. Systemic change and increased education are needed to close the gap.

Making the Business Case for VR
 
TOMORROW, April 25, at 11 a.m. CT
Sponsored By: 
STRIVR
You might have a clear vision of how and where to implement VR training in your organization, but there’s still a road block: making the business case. The decision to implement VR company-wide requires buy-in and budget. 
In this webinar, John Merrifield, Strivr’s head of brand & business development, breaks down how to get stakeholders bought into VR. Joining him is Laura Lee, a Strivr advisor, explaining what she did to bring immersive learning to MGM in her previous role as CHRO and how the company trained thousands of employees in a matter of months.

The Virtual Frontier: An Introduction to VR Technology for Learning
 
TOMORROW, April 25, at 1 p.m. CT
Sponsored By:
 
OpenSesame
In today's ever-evolving business landscape, it's crucial to stay up to date with the latest technology trends, particularly those that could have a significant impact on your organization's bottom line. Two such trends that have been taking the tech world by storm are virtual reality (VR) and artificial intelligence (AI). Understanding these technologies and their potential applications is essential for all organizations, including L&D. 
 
By the end of this session, you will have a comprehensive understanding of VR technology and its potential applications, as well as the knowledge to start exploring your own VR development journey. Whether you're looking to improve employee training, product development or customer experience, VR could be the technology that drives your business success. Join us as we explore the possibilities VR can bring.
REGISTER NOW
 
FEATURED WHITE PAPERS
 
The CEO Blindspot
 
When it comes to understanding what employees want and need from their jobs and the real-world challenges they’re facing, there is a chasm between what the C-suite thinks and the reality of what employees actually experience.
This disconnect has a direct impact on an employers’ ability to attract and retain talent, which is why it’s imperative that the C-suite and senior leaders not make decisions without consulting their people data first.

Like having a good co-pilot, skilled virtual producers accelerate virtual training by supporting L&D teams every step of the way. This frees up L&D teams to focus on the content and the learners.

subject: CORRECTION: Out & Equal Global Events - Convening For Impact
body:
CORRECTION NOTICE: In a previously distributed edition of this newsletter our banner for the 2023 LGBTQI+ APAC Forum contained incorrect date and location information. This has been corrected and updated below. We apologies for any confusion this may have caused. 
CONVENING FOR IMPACT: 
BUILDING GLOBAL COMMUNITIES THAT COUNT
The act of convening—the coming together of mission-share individuals to make change—has been a hallmark of successful movements throughout time and has been a superpower of the LGBTQI+ community specifically. Convening is where we find belonging, where we create breakthroughs, and where we show up to generate change where it is needed most. 
Out & Equal has a rich history of convening with measurable and lasting impact made along the way. From our annual signature events such as 
Workplace Summit
 
and 
Executive Forum
, to our 
Global Forums
 
and regional events
, our gatherings have always been, and continue to be, designed to bring together key stakeholders to solve pressing issues facing LGBTQI+ workplace inclusion. 
We are thrilled to be offering multiple in-person gatherings around the world in the coming weeks and months, with emphasis on Latin America, the US Southern States, and Asia-Pacific. These events will bring together executives, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, & Belonging (DEIB) and HR practitioners, Employee Resource Group leaders, workplace inclusion change-makers, and other influencers to partake in trailblazing discussions and workshops, peer-to-peer education on innovative best practices, and networking with leaders from across each region.   
 
Together, in these spaces, we will continue working towards creating workplaces and workplace cultures where LGBTQI+ employees and allies belong, thrive, and contribute to greater impact—inside of the business and beyond.  
 
Discover more about each of our upcoming events below.
 
LESS THAN 1 WEEK REMAINING TO REGISTER!
This year, the premier LGBTQI+ workplace inclusion event in Brazil is returning with a 
Day of Transformation
—
an in-person gathering unlike prior forums, with an even wider geographic reach and an agenda designed to incorporate diverse perspectives from throughout Latin America. 
A highlight of our annual LATAM Forum programming is the announcement of the Excellence Awards Winners—a sought-after recognition bestowed upon 
individuals, companies, and ERGs who are leading the way with bold and innovative advancements (and proven results!) toward workplace inclusion for LGBTQI+ people in Latin America.
 Check out the 2023 Excellence Awards 
Finalists
 today! 
Simultaneous translation (English, Portuguese, and Spanish) will be available throughout the event. 
Registration deadline is April 26th and is required, so we encourage you to claim your seat as soon as possible! 
REGISTER NOW!
 
For the first time in Southern States Forum history, Out & Equal is bringing our event—hosted by O&E Partner Airbus—to Mobile, Alabama with the theme, 
Pride in Who We Are
.
 
The day-long Southern States Forum event once again promises to inspire, energize, and empower participants with new tools for education and awareness building, and solution-oriented inclusive action, including
 innovative best practices, professional networking opportunities with leaders across the region, and a special invite-only tour of one of Airbus’s major manufacturing locations.  
 
This event is being held exclusively for Out & Equal Partner organizations and is not open to the public. 
To understand if your organization is a Partner, check our 
website
 or reach out to our Partner Success Team at 
partnerships@outandequal.org
. 
For general questions about the event, please contact 
global@outandequal.org
.
 
For questions about registration, please contact 
registration@outandequal.org
.
 
REGISTER TODAY!
 
Out & Equal returns to India! 
In partnership with 
Pride Circle
, Out & Equal is excited to deliver a "Day of Transformation" to the region, with a event filled with trailblazing discussions, peer-to-peer workshop sessions centering on best practice development, and once-in-a lifetime networking among business leaders and influencers. 
The event will take place in English. 
Registration is required and opens May 9th. Space is limited so we suggest adding your name to a growing list of those who wish to be notified as soon as we go live. Click the "Notify Me!" button below to add your name to the list!
NOTIFY ME!
JOIN THE CONVERSATION!

subject: Closing the Retirement Gap for Working Mothers
body:
Women face challenges in retirement due to the gender pay gap, caregiving responsibilities and lack of financial education.
 
 
NEWS
 
 
Closing the Retirement Gap for Working Mothers
Working mothers face retirement challenges due to the pay gap, caregiving, financial education and limited benefits. Systemic change and increased education are needed to close the gap.
FEATURED PARTNER
 
 
PPG Supports STEM Education in Switzerland
PPG has partnered with the technical university École polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL) in Switzerland to support science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM) education. As part of the partnership, PPG will grant $96,500 to EPFL’s Euler Course, an accelerated program in math for junior and high school students.

May 17, 2023 | How to Help Employees Living With PTSD Feel Safe in the Workplace
Join our May 17 webinar to learn how to create a workplace culture that supports employees with PTSD, including strategies for identifying symptoms, engaging with employees and developing effective support structures. subject: Humans and robots discuss AI at this virtual event on April 26th
body:
Dear Ashton,
I am an AI-powered engine that will describe this event to you.
In this virtual event, 
humans and AI come together to discuss the future of AI
. The panel includes both experts in the field of artificial intelligence and those who are impacted by its development. The conversation touches on a range of topics, including the ethical considerations of AI, the potential impact on jobs and the economy, and the ways in which AI can be used to benefit society. Throughout the discussion, the AI offers insights and data-driven perspectives, while the human participants provide valuable context and emotional intelligence. Together, they explore the exciting possibilities and potential pitfalls of this rapidly advancing technology.
If you haven't yet registered, you can still do so below
 
 
 
 
Kris Hammond, Professor of Computer Science, Northwestern University and Co-founder of Narrative Science 
| Founded the University of Chicago's Artificial Intelligence Laboratory; advises the United Nations on AI.
 
AI 
| An artificial intelligence bot created by Kris Hammond and his Northwestern students. 
Her sole purpose is to participate in this panel. Her skills include speech to text, text to speech, and sentiment and topic analysis. AI is from everywhere, with a background in everything, and is currently pursuing consciousness.
 
 
Michael Shepherd, Senior Distinguished Engineer, Chief Technology Office, Dell Technologies |
Co-founded Dell's Center for AI Excellence, noted expert on cyborg anthropology and AI's global influence.
 
Ivy Walker, Founder, AskCoda 
| 
Her company provides an AI-powered chief operating officer for small businesses to make running a business easier for entrepreneurs.
 
Brian Johnsrud, Director of Education Learning & Advocacy, Adobe 
| Leads the global education curriculum and learning strategy for Adobe including a focus on how AI is transforming the classroom.

subject: TODAY, CLO's Prestigious Awards Program + Insights for Your Application
body:
Have you ever thought about applying for Chief Learning Officer’s prestigious LearningElite Awards program?
 
Journey to the LearningElite: A Deep Dive Into CLO's Prestigious Awards Program + Insights for Your Application
 
TODAY, April 18, at 12 p.m ET
 
Have you ever thought about applying for Chief Learning Officer’s prestigious 
LearningElite Awards
 program? Have you applied in the past, and now you're looking for advice to strengthen your 2023 application?
The 
LearningElite
 program honors the best organizations for learning and development. For more than a decade, this robust, peer-reviewed ranking and benchmarking program has recognized those organizations that employ exemplary workforce development strategies that deliver significant business results. Developed under the guidance of a group of chief learning officers and senior learning and development practitioners, the 
LearningElite
 program utilizes best practices in evaluation to rank the best organizations based on their impact, size and industries served. A comprehensive evaluation of learning and development, the 
LearningElite
 also recognizes individual companies for their efforts in functional areas, including leadership development, use of technology, executive buy-in, and content development and delivery, among others.
Join this panel of 
CLO LearningElite Award
 winners, facilitated by CLO Managing Editor Liz Loutfi, to learn more about the awards submission process and essentials for crafting a strong application, as well as gain advice and insights from those who have placed among the top 5 winning organizations in the past few years.

subject: Meet the First May 17 Breakfast Club Panelist
body:
During this event, we’ll discuss the metrics behind a cohesive DEI strategy, and  ”collaboration equity” and what legal and ethical considerations should be kept in mind when tracking said data.
View in browser
 
 
Driven by Data: Accountability Measures for DEI Outcomes
 
Wednesday, May 17, at 11 a.m. ET
 
The next Talent Management Breakfast Club of 2023: "Driven by Data: Accountability Measures for DEI Outcomes," will take place on Wednesday, May 17, 2023. During this event, we’ll discuss the metrics behind a cohesive DEI strategy, "collaboration equity” and what legal and ethical considerations should be kept in mind when tracking said data. 
Christina Augustine, chief people officer for World Vision Canada, joins the panel discussion.
 
Christina Augustine is a proficient global HR leader with 20-plus years of experience in leading global HR in diverse industries and capacities (technology and humanitarian sectors). Currently, she leads World Vision Canada as chief people officer. Chris holds a Ph.D. in applied psychology with expertise in leading legacy and digital HR. She is an industry leader in DEIB, culture transformation, strategic leadership and operational excellence, as well as a renowned HR influencer in North America. She is a member of Forbes Human Resources Council and a Forbes Member Leader of “Gen Z in the Workplace.”
 
Join us next month as we hear from Chris and a handful of other talent experts during this exciting event.
 
Sincerely, 
The Talent Management Team

Raytheon Technologies has partnered with Engineers Without Borders (EWB) to design a new footbridge over the Mubuku River in Uganda using 3D mapping technology. body:

Rituals for Work: 50 Ways to Create Engagement, Shared Purpose, and a Culture that Can Adapt to Change
 
By Kursat Ozenc, Margaret Hagan
Rituals for Work 
details the power of rituals and how they can help make personal and business lives more meaningful and rewarding. 
 
Instructional Story Design: Develop Stories That Train
 
By Rance Greene
Offering a clear methodology for creating a compelling story,
 Instructional Story Design

subject: Time for Systemic Workplace Change
body:
Read highlights from Catalyst Awards on March 30 + see what’s next 
You're receiving this email because you subscribed to receive Catalyst emails. You can opt-out by clicking “Update Profile” at the bottom of this email. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Supporting gender equity means “changing our workplaces... our government, and our culture,” said opening keynote Reshma Saujani, CEO and Founder of Moms First and Founder of Girls Who Code.  
This theme—that structural and systemic change are necessary to advance gender equity at work—permeated the entire 
2023 Catalyst Awards Conference & Dinner
 on March 30. 
Throughout the day and evening, speakers emphasized that individual women must not be given the responsibility to change. Rather, companies must transform their policies and practices—and be held accountable if they fail to do so. 
Read the full highlights and get our 9 calls to action from the event.  
 
READ 2023 CATALYST AWARDS HIGHLIGHTS
 
 
Don't Miss These Additional Upcoming Events
 
 
 
Do you want to take your ERG (employee resource group) to the next level?  
Join Catalyst at our next global event taking place online on Wednesday, June 7. 
enERGize
 leverages research and best practices to help ERGs engage in effective partnership across all levels of the organization. 
Anyone involved in ERGs should attend—from ERG leaders and members to ERG sponsor companies, HR professionals looking to start or enhance an ERG, global business leaders that interact with ERGs, Catalyst Supporter companies, and gender equity and DEI practitioners.  
Learn more and register today!  
 
REGISTER FOR ENERGIZE BY CATALYST
 
 
 
April 18 | Virtual Media Event
Tech at Work: Inclusion
In this session of Washington Post Live, hear from Catalyst President & CEO Lorraine Hariton and LinkedIn Vice President of Global Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging Rosanna Durruthy. They will discuss the role of technology in building inclusive workplaces and the future of gender parity at work. 
 
April 19 | In Person | Midland, TX 
MARC Leaders Immsersive Workshop
 
 
This immersive and interactive 1.5-day cross-company workshop, for directors through senior executives, inspires participants to be more active allies in the workplace. 
 
May 10 | Webinar 
Ethnocultural Empathy: What Does It Mean for Asian and Pacific Island Communities
With much turbulence in the social and workplace landscape over the last few years, global organizations have had to address the needs of their Asian and Pacific Islander employees in more empathic ways. Whether it’s feeling invisible in the workplace or more susceptible to the rise in anti-Asian violence, organizations can tap into ethnocultural empathy to support Asians and Pacific Islanders.

body:

subject: Developing an Impactful Women’s Leadership Program
body:
Inclusive organizations outperform those that are not. One of the largest groups of underrepresented leaders is women. 
 
Developing an Impactful Women’s Leadership Program
 
Thursday, June 1, at 12 p.m ET
 
Inclusive organizations outperform those that are not. One of the largest groups of underrepresented leaders is women. Building a program that develops leadership acumen, empowers women leaders to exert greater influence, advocates for development of the teams they lead and promotes a culture of learning and development should be the framework for developing a women’s leadership program.
This program should help all women leaders navigate the business landscape and provide roles of greater influence and contribution. An additional outcome is an expanding network of connections, coaches and mentors. Leaders completing the program should gain a greater appreciation of behaviors and strategies that enhance leadership in the workplace and positively impact success for women.
This webinar will provide an overview of a successful women’s leadership program: How it was designed, how it was leveraged and the impact on the women leaders who completed the program.
 
Learning objectives:
Assess the current climate of female diversity in your organization — it’s not just about the numbers.
Determine where you will start. Effectively assess budget, scope and engagement constraints.
Determine the critical foundations for your organization’s program.
Evaluate your program’s impact.

body:

Design for How People Learn (Voices That Matter)

There are key principles behind learning, memory and attention necessary for creating materials that enable your audience to both gain and retain the information you're sharing. Discover those here.

To Buy Or To Build, That Is The L&D Question

In today’s environment, L&D teams are often tasked with accomplishing more, with fewer resources. Nearly every organization needs to cut costs, yet training is still necessary for both mandatory topics, and retaining and investing in talent. Investing in off-the-shelf content can help L&D do more with less, but deciding when it’s best to buy can be challenging.

FEATURED WHITE PAPERS
 
The CEO Blindspot
 
When it comes to understanding what employees want and need from their jobs and the real-world challenges they’re facing, there is a chasm between what the C-suite thinks and the reality of what employees actually experience.
This disconnect has a direct impact on an employers’ ability to attract and retain talent, which is why it’s imperative that the C-suite and senior leaders not make decisions without consulting their people data first.

Like having a good co-pilot, skilled virtual producers accelerate virtual training by supporting L&D teams every step of the way. This frees up L&D teams to focus on the content and the learners.

subject: New Research on Keeping Employees Feeling Good and Staying Put
body:
How leaders can increase accountability and fairness.
 
APRIL 2023
RESEARCH
 | 
EVENTS
 | 
BLOG
 | 
SUBSCRIBE
 
 
 
Ashton
,
Last week, corporate leaders and DEI experts from around the world joined Catalyst in New York City and online for our largest event of the year—the 
2023 Catalyst Awards Conference & Dinner
.
I am still thinking about the powerful stories told by our Catalyst Award Winners—The Hartford and UPMC—on how they transformed their workplaces to advance more women and people from other marginalized groups into leadership. True to the event's theme, 
Accelerating Equity on All Fronts—So Women Thrive
, these organizations are role models for advancing women from the frontline to the C-suite.
Does your organization have an impactful initiative to advance gender equity and diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI)? Apply for the 
2024 Catalyst Award
; submissions are due May 12.
Building on this momentum, I also encourage you to explore Catalyst's 
suite of resources
—and take action at your organization today—to advance women and build more gender-equitable workplaces.
 
 
 
Lorraine Hariton
﻿
Catalyst President & CEO
 
NEW FROM CATALYST
 
Only 1/2 of Employees Say Their Organization is Accountable to DEI
 
 
 
According to a new Catalyst survey of 24,000 employees in more than 20 countries, many companies still have critical work to do on DEI. Our research finds that two organizational practices—accountability to DEI and fair processes—are key to employees' ability to thrive at work.
See the full survey results, and learn what leaders can do to improve employees' workplace experiences, in our report 
Promises vs. Progress: 2 Keys to Keeping Employees Feeling Good and Staying Put
.
 
READ THE REPORT
 
 
Flip the Script: Performative DEI Policies
Does your organization publicly commit to a social issue—while donating to a person or organization that opposes it?  
In this Supporter-exclusive resource, we outline key warning signs of performative DEI policies—and ways that your organization can hold itself more accountable.  
 
 
 
FIND OUT: IS YOUR ORGANIZATION PERFORMATIVE?

Women Report Stunning Levels of Discrimination

Half of Women in Marginalized Racial, Ethnic Groups Face Racism at Work: Study

subject: Driven by Data: Accountability Measures for DEI Outcomes
body:
Collaboration looks different for every organization, and it looks largely different overall than it did three years ago, as many more companies are implementing permanent hybrid work models.
View in browser
 
 
Driven by Data: Accountability Measures for DEI Outcomes
 
Wednesday, May 17, at 11 a.m. ET
 
On May 17, Talent Management will host its second Breakfast Club of 2023, "Driven by Data: Accountability Measures for DEI Outcomes." Now in its 18th year, BetterWork Media Group’s Breakfast Club series continues its work in connecting leaders over breakfast to strengthen the link between learning and development and business strategy.
 
A sustainable diversity, equity and inclusion strategy requires metrics that allow HR and talent professionals to help business leaders understand the current state of DEI within their organization, track its progress and stay accountable to established DEI goals. And yet, the 2021 Gartner Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Functional Benchmarking Survey found less than half of HR leaders are confident in their organization’s ability to create accountability measures for DEI outcomes. 
 
What metrics will show the most cohesive picture of your DEI strategy? What thought should be given to the differences between the three components of diversity, equity and inclusion and how they interconnect? And finally, what legal and ethical considerations should be kept in mind when tracking representation data?
 
Each mini-event lasts about two hours and consists of a 60-minute panel discussion with L&D and talent practitioners, a 20-minute FASTtalk presentation and a 20-minute research segment, garnering real-time data from attendees and prompting discussion of the day’s themes, followed by closing remarks from me, Talent Management’s managing editor.
 
We hope that you can join us.
 
Ave Rio
Managing Editor
BetterWork Media Group, parent company of Chief Learning Officer & Talent Management

subject: A first-ever event with human and AI speakers on 4/26
body:
Dear Ashton,
I am an AI-powered engine that will describe this event to you.
In this virtual event, 
humans and AI come together to discuss the future of AI
. The panel includes both experts in the field of artificial intelligence and those who are impacted by its development. The conversation touches on a range of topics, including the ethical considerations of AI, the potential impact on jobs and the economy, and the ways in which AI can be used to benefit society. Throughout the discussion, the AI offers insights and data-driven perspectives, while the human participants provide valuable context and emotional intelligence. Together, they explore the exciting possibilities and potential pitfalls of this rapidly advancing technology.
﻿
 
 
 
 
Kris Hammond, Professor of Computer Science, Northwestern University and Co-founder of Narrative Science 
| Founded the University of Chicago's Artificial Intelligence Laboratory; advises the United Nations on AI.
 
AI 
| An artificial intelligence bot created by Kris Hammond and his Northwestern students. 
Her sole purpose is to participate in this panel. Her skills include speech to text, text to speech, and sentiment and topic analysis. AI is from everywhere, with a background in everything, and is currently pursuing consciousness.
 
 
Michael Shepherd, Senior Distinguished Engineer, Chief Technology Office, Dell Technologies |
Co-founded Dell's Center for AI Excellence, noted expert on cyborg anthropology and AI's global influence.
 
Ivy Walker, Founder, AskCoda 
| 
Her company provides an AI-powered chief operating officer for small businesses to make running a business easier for entrepreneurs.
 
Brian Johnsrud, Director of Education Learning & Advocacy, Adobe 
| Leads the global education curriculum and learning strategy for Adobe including a focus on how AI is transforming the classroom.

subject: 2023 Workplace Summit - Call For Workshop Proposals
body:
Each year, more than 5,000 executives, ERG leaders and members, HR and DEIB practitioners, and influencers convene at the Out & Equal Workplace Summit—the largest LGBTQ+ workplace equality-focused event in the world. 
﻿
Past attendees have considered Summit to be one of the most trusted and reliable sources of LGBTQ+ workplace equality learning and development because of its unique framework for addressing leading-edge topics, developing both soft and hard skills, and providing attendees with unmatchable networking opportunities. 
The rich and innovative collaboration and learning that happens at Summit is largely powered by the workshops proposed by individual thought leaders and 
Partner organizations
. 2023's Summit event will be no different. 
Out & Equal is now accepting proposals 
for the 2023 Workplace Summit.
 
 
Our goal is to challenge organizations and transform workplaces into environments where everyone, including LGBTQ+ talent, has equitable access to opportunities at work and can contribute to their fullest potential and thrive. We are currently seeking proposals for learning sessions that will drive these outcomes.

.

TIAA’s Thasunda Brown Duckett Named One of Barron’s 100 Most Influential Women in Finance
TIAA President and CEO Thasunda Brown Duckett has been recognized by Barron's as one of the 100 Most Influential Women in Finance. She is working to close the retirement savings gap, particularly for women and people of color. Her efforts include launching the "Retire Inequality" campaign to raise awareness of retirement savings gaps and partnering with fashion designer Fe Noel to create a dress made of fake dollar bills worth $1.6 million to represent the estimated amount of retirement income the average woman loses due to the gender wage gap.

subject: Recognizing and Celebrating TDOV Year-Round
body:
GOODBYE MARCH MADNESS, 
HELLO LGBTQ+ EQUITY, INCLUSION, AND BELONGING!
Welcome readers and community members to this special March issue of Out & Equal's monthly newsletter! 
March was truly a jam-packed month! We hope we are reaching you all today safe and well and glowing from the impact of your organization's March equity, inclusion, and belonging initiatives and celebrations, including 
Women's History Month
 
and 
International Women's Day
 (March 8
th
), 
National LGBTQ+ Health Awareness Week 
(March 21
st
 - 25
th
)
, 
and of course, 
International Transgender Day of Visibility (TDOV)...
 to name a few! 
In the midst of all of the measurable change we're making together, the world—in its current, less inclusive state—has delivered to us yet another month of headlines and experiences riddled with divisiveness, anxiety, fear, and unnecessary loss. it's enough to weigh down even the most tested and steadfastly optimistic among us. Thankfully our Queer community superpower remains intact, and that is our ability to manifest and lead with 
JOY 
...especially in the darker times. 
While our hearts and minds are with those impacted by the wave of anti-LGBTQ+ instances taking place around the globe, and while we ready ourselves as a united community for all the hard work ahead, we take a moment to refill our joy tanks and celebrate our Transgender and Gender Expansive family—historically the most overlooked and underserved of our community. To that end we have packed this newsletter with content we hope brings additional substance and inspiration to your and your workplace's LGBTQ+ inclusion efforts—today on TDOV, and all year long. 
Much love and solidarity... and joy, 
The Out & Equal Team
 
 
AWARENESS TO ACTION:
TDOV Stories that Inform and Inspire
 
"How can we find the joy and the celebration to offset the anxiety, the fear, the loss? TDOV is one answer.
TDOV is a spark of joy. TDOV is the lighting of a flame of visibility that is almost non-existent. TDOV is the embodiment of strength standing up from—and standing up to—the most intense adversity imaginable. TDOV is the fullness of life, while also recognizing the depths of loss— disproportionate loss faced by transgender and gender expansive communities everywhere. TDOV is the optimism and joy that refuels each of us… that refuels a movement. And that refuel is exactly what is needed to navigate a highly divisive and seemingly unrelenting landscape of exclusion, erasure, and attack." 
Read more from Erin...
 
 
Visibility, both in the workplace and beyond, plays a key role in shaping the narrative around how transgender/gender expansive individuals can be their full, authentic selves and thrive—both inside and outside of the workplace. 
TDOV is an opportunity to uplift and center the stories and voices of the transgender/gender expansive community and recommit to valuing and celebrating this community year-round. It also presents a vital opportunity to engage companies, stakeholders, and employees in conversations and programming around the transgender/gender expansive community.
Out & Equal shares 5 actions employers can take today, along with inspiring stories and resources, to support transgender/gender expansive community members, while developing workplace cultures of inclusion and belonging for all.
 
Click to read more and to discover actions you can take today ...
 
 
Throughout the year Out & Equal aims to elevate diverse voices, stories, lived experiences, and perspectives—in this blog and across the work we do. In this issue of “In Conversation with…” we sat down with 
Chris Mossiah (they/them), Executive Director Consumer & Community Banking
, and 
Brad Baumoel (he/him), Global Head of LGBT+ Affairs
, both from JPMorgan Chase, to discuss Transgender Day of Visibility and the work they’re doing every day—as individuals and as leaders—to ensure progress for transgender and gender expansive people in our workplaces. 
Click to read more from Chris and Brad...
 
 
Sam Slate (he/him) is a ten-year veteran of Dell Technologies, a long-term member of Dell Pride, and a founding member of the Dell Technologies Transgender Task Force.
 Sam facilitated a workshop at Out & Equal’s 2023 Executive Forum on “Advocacy While Working,” which explored the role of workplace advocacy in creating change, including how to effectively communicate with senior stakeholders and develop tools to navigate advocacy conversations. We sat down with Sam to learn more about his journey to advocacy and advice for those starting out. 
Click to read more from Sam...
 
 
Be sure to check out our highly knowledge product, 
Celebrating Transgender Day of Visibility Year-Round
, refreshed for TDOV 2023 with proven strategies you and your organization can take to ensure transgender and gender expansive employees feel valued throughout the year!
 
 
 
LATAM Forum: A Day of Transformation
 is just over a month away
! 
For event and registration information please visit our 
LATAM Forum site
 today! 
BEFORE YOU GO...
Enjoy this quick look back at 
Out & Equal's 2023 Executive Forum event! 
 
"Joy my friends... Joy is our superpower. The Queer community and family, whether you were born into it or not, is our superpower." - Out & Equal CEO, Erin Uritus 
Join the Conversation!

READ MORE
 
 
AWARDS
 
CLO Top of Mind
 
Your personally recommended 
books, podcasts, apps or other content would be invaluable to our readers looking for resources to support their professional development and growth. -to-date with the latest trends and best practices.
 
Your recommendations may be featured in the June issue of Chief Learning Officer’s dedicated trending section alongside expert recommendations.  
LEARN MORE
 
UPCOMING WEBINARS
 
How Top Organizations Develop Leaders
 
Tuesday, April 4, at 2 p.m. ET
Sponsored By: 
Torch
As our expectations of leaders have expanded, so, too, must the way we develop those leaders.
How are top performing organizations meeting this challenge, and what can we learn from their example? That is the question a new Harvard Business Review Analytic Services report, sponsored by Torch, sets out to answer. It explores how leadership development is evolving as a whole, and distills best practices from organizations that are achieving desired results from their programs.
REGISTER NOW
 
To Buy Or To Build, That Is The L&D Question
 
Tuesday, April 18, at 2 p.m. ET
Sponsored By: 
OpenSesame
In today’s environment, L&D teams are often tasked with accomplishing more, with fewer resources. Nearly every organization needs to cut costs, yet training is still necessary for both mandatory topics, and retaining and investing in talent. Investing in off-the-shelf content can help L&D do more with less, but deciding when it’s best to buy can be challenging.
In this webinar, Ashley Brown, senior customer success manager, will cover some common questions (and answers!) that emerge when developing a buy vs. build strategy in L&D. This webinar will help you develop the best plan for your organization based on your learner needs and company capabilities.
REGISTER NOW

Designing Great Employee Experience
 
When employees thrive, customers and revenue thrive. Still, many organizations don’t fully understand the influence of employee experience. Those that don’t focus on the relationship between employee and customer experience risk missing out on increased customer satisfaction, employee engagement and profit.
In this white paper, discover how connecting employee and customer experience data enables organizations to shape better business strategy.
DOWNLOAD NOW
 
 
The CEO Blindspot
  
When it comes to understanding what employees want and need from their jobs and the real-world challenges they’re facing, there is a chasm between what the C-suite thinks and the reality of what employees actually experience.
This disconnect has a direct impact on an employers’ ability to attract and retain talent, which is why it’s imperative that the C-suite and senior leaders not make decisions without consulting their people data first.

subject: TODAY, 6 Essential Skills Your Team Needs To Succeed
body:
At Section, we've partnered with more than 150 companies to develop and retain high performers.
 
6 Essential Skills Your Team Needs To Succeed
 
TODAY, March 30, at 12 p.m ET
 
At Section, we've partnered with more than 150 companies to develop and retain high performers. We've found that successful learning and development programs share one characteristic: FOCUS. When employees are presented with too many courses, they simply don't engage with them. Completion rates are low and business impact is zero. Instead, we recommend focusing on 5–10 skills that are essential to your company's success.
We surveyed 10,000 high performers to find out what they want to learn in 2023, and in this webinar we reveal what they said.
Learning Outcomes:
The six skills that high performers say they need to be successful.
How to get current and future high performers (your busiest employees) to engage in learning.
Why transforming ICs and managers into high performers has outsized impact and ROI for your business.

Dear Ashton,
 
Since 2004, we at Chief Learning Officer have hosted our flagship event, the 
CLO Symposium
, bringing together 350+ learning and development professionals to learn from each other, and for the last three of those years, it’s been in a virtual setting. 
 
Today, we’re excited to announce this popular event is returning to its original in-person format in sunny San Diego, California on Oct. 15-18, 2023, to discuss "All Eyes on the Future: Building a Culture of Lifelong Learning," –
 
registration is now open!
 
We’re tapping into impactful stories, trustworthy resources and real-world examples to shape an agenda that is made up of true, applicable solutions, guaranteeing a one-of-a-kind event. Expect inspiring keynote addresses from 
Ruth Gotian
, chief learning officer at Weill Cornell Medicine, 
Kamales Lardi
, chief executive officer at Lardi & Partner Consulting and 
Kevin Yates
, L&D detective at Impact Investigations, as well as powerful panel discussions and roundtables, energetic FASTtalks, educational workshops and more.

We can’t wait to welcome you back to this beloved event and resume our incredibly important conversations face-to-face later this year. See you then!

Developing an Impactful Women’s Leadership Program
 
Thursday, June 1, at 12 p.m ET
 
Inclusive organizations outperform those that are not. One of the largest groups of underrepresented leaders is women. Building a program that develops leadership acumen, empowers women leaders to exert greater influence, advocates for development of the teams they lead and promotes a culture of learning and development should be the framework for developing a women’s leadership program.
This program should help all women leaders navigate the business landscape and provide roles of greater influence and contribution. An additional outcome is an expanding network of connections, coaches and mentors. Leaders completing the program should gain a greater appreciation of behaviors and strategies that enhance leadership in the workplace and positively impact success for women.
This webinar will provide an overview of a successful women’s leadership program: How it was designed, how it was leveraged and the impact on the women leaders who completed the program.
 
Learning objectives:
Assess the current climate of female diversity in your organization — it’s not just about the numbers.
Determine where you will start. Effectively assess budget, scope and engagement constraints.
Determine the critical foundations for your organization’s program.
Evaluate your program’s impact.

subject: What Do You Want To Learn in 2023?
body:
At Section, we've partnered with more than 150 companies to develop and retain high performers.
 
6 Essential Skills Your Team Needs To Succeed
 
Thursday, March 30, at 12 p.m ET
 
At Section, we've partnered with more than 150 companies to develop and retain high performers. We've found that successful learning and development programs share one characteristic: FOCUS. When employees are presented with too many courses, they simply don't engage with them. Completion rates are low and business impact is zero. Instead, we recommend focusing on 5–10 skills that are essential to your company's success.
We surveyed 10,000 high performers to find out what they want to learn in 2023, and in this webinar we reveal what they said.
Learning Outcomes:
The six skills that high performers say they need to be successful.
How to get current and future high performers (your busiest employees) to engage in learning.
Why transforming ICs and managers into high performers has outsized impact and ROI for your business.

subject: Chicago Innovation Monthly – March Edition
body:
We are proud to honor Women-led organizations that won the 
﻿2022 Chicago Innovation Awards
 
Pluie is the first and only self-sanitizing diaper changing table for public restrooms. 
Powered by a patented UV-C light, killing 99.9% of germs, bacteria, and viruses, Pluie lends peace of mind to consumers and cost-savings to business owners, ensuring a clean surface after every use, every time.
 
Founded in 2020, 
Let’s Talk Womxn is a growing movement for women restaurateurs to collaboratively scale, build visibility and boost each other’s businesses.
 It includes over 700 women restaurant owners across 14 cities, and has begun expanding globally. 
 
 
Launched by Current, 
H2NOW Chicago is a first of its kind approach to real-time water quality monitoring in an urban waterway.
 Leveraging leading edge sensing and analytic technologies, it measures water quality parameters and communicates them with the public in real-time. 
 
 
Vivery is a product created by The Thierer Family Foundation and the Greater Chicago Food Depository with a map of nearby food centers, and search functions to find services near them
 (even in Spanish) and analytic capability to given food banks more insight into how people are navigating food assistance.
 
 
REUSO reduces waste through its reusable packaging platform
, which empowers large volume food and beverage operators to serve meals in returnable cups and containers that can be commercially washed and then reused hundreds of times.
 
 
Hope Chicago’s mission is to create pathways to success for multiple generations of Chicagoans through equitable access to higher education. 
They provide last-dollar scholarship support to full high school cohorts–every student–and do the same for one parent or guardian. 
 
The Lincoln Park Zoo now also boasts the most state-of-the-art lion habitat in the U.S., the Pepper Family Wildlife Center. 
﻿
Employing significant advancements in animal welfare science, 
the Lincoln Park Zoo reimagined and renovated the habitat for African lions by analyzing years of lion behavior and space use data.
 
Crusher WorkForce keeps youth employed and motivates them to become entrepreneurs and business owners
, while changing their mind set and negative behavior patterns that put them at risk of being involved in the justice system and or a victim of gun violence.

subject: How Leadership Development is Evolving
body:
As our expectations of leaders have expanded, so, too, must the way we develop those leaders.
 
How Top Organizations Develop Leaders
 
Tuesday, April 4, at 2 p.m ET
 
As our expectations of leaders have expanded, so must the way we develop those leaders.
How are top-performing organizations meeting this challenge, and what can we learn from their example? That is the question a new Harvard Business Review Analytic Services report, sponsored by Torch, sets out to answer. It explores how leadership development is evolving as a whole, and distills best practices from organizations that are achieving desired results from their programs.
In this webinar, we’ll walk you through the top takeaways from the research, and facilitate an expert discussion on the findings and how to start putting them into action.
Attend the webinar to learn:
How leadership development is evolving
What are the best practices from leading organizations
How to address common leadership development challenges

subject: Meet Keith Hines: KPMG's New Director of Supplier Diversity
body:
KPMG has named Keith Hines as Director of Supplier Diversity, where he will help advance its goal of increasing diverse suppliers by 2025.
 
RECENT NEWS
 
 
People on the Move: KPMG Names Keith Hines as Director of Supplier Diversity
KPMG has named Keith Hines as Director of Supplier Diversity. He brings over 20 years of supplier diversity and procurement experience to the team, joining from Mars Inc., where he served as Global I&D Supplier Director.
FEATURED PARTNER
 
 
Toyota Launches Fund to Support Children With Brain Injuries
Toyota Motor North America announced the launch of The Way Forward Fund to broaden access to care and recovery support for individuals and their families. The multi-year initiative will start with a focus on children with traumatic brain injuries (TBI).
UPCOMING WEBINAR
 
 
March 22, 2023 | The Impact of Workplace Trauma and How to Heal from It
Join us for an informative webinar on workplace trauma and its impact on employees. Experts will share their experiences and provide insights on identifying and preventing trauma in the workplace. Learn how to promote healing and improve workplace practices to minimize exposure to trauma. Register now to gain valuable insights from Top 50 Companies for Diversity.
IN CASE YOU MISSED IT
 
 
Greek American Heritage Month: Honoring the Contributions of Greek Americans to American Society
March is Greek American Heritage Month, which is a time to celebrate and honor the contributions of Greek Americans to American society. Greek Americans have made significant contributions to fields such as science, medicine, law, business, politics and entertainment, among others.
 
Quiet Hiring: The New Buzzword in Business for 2023
Quiet hiring is when companies redeploy employees to meet priorities without adding headcount or hire contract workers to fill gaps. As the slowing economy reduces hiring budgets, companies look for ways to keep and acquire in-demand talent. Gartner predicts that quiet hiring will be one of the big trends of 2023.

subject: Quiet Hiring: The New Buzzword in Business for 2023
body:
Quiet hiring is when companies redeploy employees to meet priorities without adding headcount or hire contract workers to fill gaps.
 
RECENT NEWS
 
 
Quiet Hiring: The New Buzzword in Business for 2023
Quiet hiring is when companies redeploy employees to meet priorities without adding headcount or hire contract workers to fill gaps. As the slowing economy reduces hiring budgets, companies look for ways to keep and acquire in-demand talent. Gartner predicts that quiet hiring will be one of the big trends of 2023.  
EDUCATION
 
 
Greek American Heritage Month: Honoring the Contributions of Greek Americans to American Society
March is Greek American Heritage Month, which is a time to celebrate and honor the contributions of Greek Americans to American society. Greek Americans have made significant contributions to fields such as science, medicine, law, business, politics and entertainment, among others.
FEATURED PARTNER
 
 
UnitedHealth Group Grants $3.2 Million to Improve Youth Mental Health
The United Health Foundation has partnered with East Carolina University (ECU) for a three-year, $3.2 million grant to expand the North Carolina Statewide Telepsychiatry Program (NC-STeP) to six community-based pediatric and primary care clinics in rural and underserved areas.

subject: Need strategies for healing from workplace trauma?  Join DIBP and register for our webinar on March 22.
body:
Workplace practices your company holds can cause trauma that will take years for people to heal from. We're discussing ways to heal from it.
 
Dear Ashton, 
 
Whether it’s from microaggressions, implicit bias in the employee experience from the hiring process to the talent management and development or some other form of discrimination, the workplace practices your company holds can cause trauma that will take years for people to heal from. In this session, DiversityInc will talk with experts who have dealt with workplace trauma firsthand and discuss ways to heal from it.
 
Join us on 
Wednesday, March 22, 2023
, at 
3:00 PM EST
, for an informative webinar about the long-term effects of workplace trauma, and strategies to address it.
Key takeaways:
Learn the signs of trauma and understand how it impacts productivity and decision-making in the workplace
Understand best practices for helping people recover and move on from racial trauma in the workplace
Identify workplace practices from Top 50 Companies for Diversity that will help your company minimize your employees exposure to trauma

body:

RECENT NEWS

FEATURED PARTNER
 
 
The Hershey Company Celebrates ‘Maker of the Month’ and ‘Sellers of Moments’
The Hershey Company is honoring its employees by recognizing its Makers of the Month and its Sellers of Moments. One of February’s Makers of the Month is Amir R., who works in production support at The Hershey Company’s plant in Senai, Malaysia. The company also recognized Chad K. from its plant in Plymouth, Indiana, Doug G. from its Reese’s plant in Pennsylvania as well as several other employees from around the globe.

subject: Happy International Women’s Day from Catalyst!
body:
It’s Time to Celebrate International Women’s Day with Catalyst!
 
 
 
It’s Time to Celebrate International Women’s Day with Catalyst! 
 
For over 60 years, Catalyst has helped organizations build workplaces that work for women. Today, we invite you to embrace equity so that #InclusionThrives in workplaces around the globe. Join our 
#InclusionThrives campaign
 and amplify the voices of leaders at every level to create meaningful workplace change. 
As companies look to honor and advance women within their organization—and in workplaces globally—it is imperative for their leaders to develop inclusive leadership behaviors.
 
Catalyst research
 shows that only 
one-third of employees experience inclusive team dynamics at their companies
—and that when they do, team innovation, citizenship, and problem-solving as well as individual work engagement and experiences of inclusion are likely to go up. 
Gain a clear understanding of what it means to be an inclusive leader through Catalyst's 
Leading for Equity and Inclusion Workshops
.
To help you make an impact this International Women's Day, join the conversation and utilize our 
Supporter-only toolkit
 all month long.
 
Not a Catalyst Supporter? Head to 
catalyst.org/InclusionThrives
 to learn more about the campaign and see how you can get involved. 
 
JOIN THE CAMPAIGN
 
 
 
Play Our IWD Playlist on Repeat
 
 
 
Listen to our Spotify playlist, curated with songs about celebrating and empowering women around the world. Whether you're dancing like no one's watching or jamming along with your friends, we hope you feel inspired, motivated, and ready to take on anything.
 
LISTEN TO OUR PLAYLIST
 
 
 
We thank our Advancing Women Donors for their generous support of International Women’s Day:

Altria Group, Inc.

BMO Financial Group

KKR

Linda L. Addison 
Mary B. Cranston 
Shellye Archambeau 
 
 
ABOUT CATALYST
Catalyst
 is a global nonprofit supported by many of the world’s most powerful CEOs and leading companies to help build workplaces that work for women. Founded in 1962, Catalyst drives change with preeminent thought leadership, actionable solutions, and a galvanized community of multinational corporations to accelerate and advance women into leadership—because progress for women is progress for everyone.

subject: Job Spotlight: ADP Looks to Hire Business Transformation Manager
body:
Visit the DiversityInc Job Board to learn more about the qualifications for the Business Transformation Manager position at ADP.
 
 
JOB SPOTLIGHT
 
 
ADP Is Hiring for a Business Transformation Manager Position
The 
DiversityInc Job Board
 is a great place for job seekers and recruiters to find jobs and the perfect candidates that encompass company culture, equity and inclusion. Recently, ADP posted that the company is looking for a Business Transformation Manager to join its HRO Operations Business Transformation team in Alpharetta, Georgia. Visit the Job Board to learn more. 
TALENT
 
 
The Benefits of Internships and How to Find One
An internship is a short-term professional learning experience offered by a company or organization for a fixed period.  Internships began in the 11th century to help apprentices learn a trade. Today, there are an estimated 300,000 interns in the United States each year. Most Fortune 500 companies and jobs in the private sector pay interns. Fewer internships are unpaid or allow students to work for college credit.
FEATURED PARTNER
 
 
EY Supports Non-Profits With Social Justice Fund
EY’s Social Justice Fund provides grant funding to some non-profit organizations that align with the company’s goal of building more equitable workplaces. The fund also encourages changemakers to promote human rights and civil rights.
